Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: cr893378
Reviews.Content: This may be a 3 star facility but the staff is a SOLID 5 STARS. Everyone we encountered at Hotel Abbazia was very friendly and eager to help. The location is perfect for first time visitors to Venice. Very short walk from bus/taxi drop point and right next door to the train station. Special thanks go to Mateo and Alvise at the front desk for their exceptional service and guidance. I highly recommend Hotel Abbazzia and would not hestitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Monasterys not meeting the needs of toursists”
Reviews.Author: pimpam1
Reviews.Content: Located a couple of blocks from the train station (big advantage since you have to drag suitcases-remember, only water taxis) you get to it through an alley that looks a little sketchy. The staff is wonderful, some actually being flirtatious. They will help you with maps and tours including free water taxi ride to Marano to see the glass factories. Ask at the front desk (you have to get your own way back). The hotel is stark, being owned by the monastery and the feel is like walking into long school hallways. There is no elevator so get ready to climb the terrazzo stairs with your suitcase. The bedrooms do not look like the ones pictured on the web site. They are greatly embellished for the pictures. Half the furniture in the picture is not actually in the room. The ceilings are high, the floors in the rooms are terrazzo with no rugs (very cold) and the walls have no pictures, only scones. The bathrooms are fine, not elegant, just adequate. Get used to a vinyl tub/shower combination unit. Even though our room looked out on the back alley, it was still nice to throw open the shutters and see the sun and hear the church bells right next door. Compared to other hotels we stayed in in Italy, this was the most expensive and the worst value for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: sunnyskyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 noghts in April, our first trip to Venice. Hotel is a beautifully restored monastery with lots of original features and a lovely atmosphere. Hotel is ideally situated close to the bus and train stations. Buses from the airport cost 5 euros each way and run every 20 mins. You could also get a water bus or water taxi which are more expensive. Hotel is down a very narrow street about 7 mins walk from the bus station right by the Scalzi Bridge and vaporetto stops. We had booked a superior room which was on the second floor overlooking the garden. There are no lifts but our bag was brought to the room. Room had a kingsize bed, good lighting, desk with flatscreen TV, minibar and double wardrobe. There were no drawers but space in the wardrobe for underwear etc. Bathroom was small with shower attachment over the bath but no curtain. Both rooms were warm and spotlessly clean. There was a bar/sitting room with comfortable seating which was very peaceful. There was not an extensive wine list, the house red and white were 19 euros a bottle, they were drinkable but not great. They also provided complimentary crisps, nuts etc. Yes we were woken at 7.15am by the church bells but it didn't bother us and we were then able to snooze until 8.15 when they were rung again! Breakfast buffet was good with the usual cold meats and cheese, rolls, cereal, yoghurt, fruit and wonderful croissants and pastries which were freshly cooked. Matteo at reception was very helpful in recommending good local restaurants, I would certainly suggest if you are going to Venice for the first time that you do some research before you go as there are nearly 800 restaurants in Venice and many of them are overpriced and aimed at ripping off the tourist. I would recommend Osteria Al Vecio Pozzo (reviewed separately) which did amazing pizzas and was full of locals. St Marks's Square was amazing, especially in the sun, but be prepared for crowds and hugely expensive cafes - we paid 20 euros for a coffee and a sprite (some charge you to listen to the music too!) but it was worth it to experience the atmosphere. Despite the crowds, graffiti and tacky tourist areas, Venice is one of the most photogenic places I have ever been to, you just need to be prepared to wander and get lost in order to see the real Venice in all its beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missy C
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a great lobby area. Location is by the train station which is great for getting in and out. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Matteo was especially helpful. Thanks for a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel / Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel!!! Matteo (at the front desk) made our stay. He helped us with finding great restaurants (where the locals go and fabulous) to informing us that they offer a private water taxi and private tour where they blow the glass. Room was comfortable (4 people). Great location!! No elevators but they will carry your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MandrakeUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia is ideally located for travelling to and around Venice. It is close to the bus and train terminal and a short walk away from the water taxis on the Grand Canal. This hotel is a converted monastery and has the features to prove it, right down to the pulpit in the lounge. It has a lovely outdoor area for warmer days, which did not apply for our visit! We were welcomed in a friendly manner by the reception staff and that was maintained throughout our three day stay. The room was clean and well equipped, apart from the lack of a mirror in the bedroom, which caused some delay in preparations when starting the day or going out. The bed was large and comfortable. Breakfast at the hotel was what you would expect from a continental hotel - a selection of cereals, cold meat and cheese, croissants etc, but there was not a great variety of any of these. OK if you're not too fussy! Also there is no hot water machine so if you like your tea or coffee hot, you will not be too happy. Coffee is served from a jug and hot water from an individual jug, which soon gets cold. If you're going to Venice be sure to go there with a good bank balance. We have never been ripped off so much on our travels. We found it impossible to find a good restaurant and prices were topped up in all sorts of ways, service charges, charges for vegetables (portion sizes unbelievably small!). If you get a snack near to S. Marco - BEWARE! - drinks prices are astronomical! Having said that Venice is one of those must visit places. St Mark's, the Grand Canal etc have to be seen. The trouble is that thousands of others want to see it at the same time so crowds are the norm. TIPS - get a pass on the water buses for as long as you're staying and prepay for the Doge's Palace (then you can walk past the queue to the entrance).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshiper10
Reviews.Content: Hotel very easy to get to from bus station. Good location for trains and water buses. Lots of places to eat and plenty of shopping. The hotel staff were wonderful especially the reception staff very helpful. Our room unfortunately was on the 2nd floor no lifts, it happened to be hot in March and air con was not available, would not open windows due to mosquitoes. Bed very hard difficult sleeping. Breakfast was good plenty to keep you going. Overall okay for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Quiet and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: FrequentlyinItaly
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a quiet, very comfortable room with updated bathroom. The location was an easy walk with luggage from the station and great launching point to see the rest of Venice. While lacking in views, the price, overall comfort, friendly staff and nice breakfast more than make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Visit”
Reviews.Author: CarolynT1
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint, wonderful place. My only complaint was that the room was a little warm, but we had unusually warm weather this March, much too early for a/c. The staff was very helpful and breakfast was good. It is worth it to stay near the train station, dragging bags through Venice would not be enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms hot and some smell”
Reviews.Author: RealGiantPanda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Venice Santa Lucia Train station. Very convenient, Vaporetto stop right across. Can also walk to San Marco (kind of long but interesting). We had a small baby and thought it will be easier to stay near the train station rather than drag all our suitcases and the baby all over town. You basically get out of the train station, make a U-turn into the first small alley, and it's right there. The entrance is hard to spot as it is hidden - just look right across from the Chinese restaurant. The only problem is the smell permeating the hotel - they have those plug-in things throughout the hallways and in the rooms. I unplugged mine. The heat was also turned on even though it was not that cold outside. It was impossible to change the temperature from inside the room. I had to open the windows, but then it gets loud in the morning, and I did not feel comfy leaving the window open when we're not there. The shower also was small and had nothing to hold the soap. Kind of awkward to have to bend and put the shampoo on the floor. Kept knocking the faucet handle and changing the water temperature accidentally while doing that. I found a four-star hotel next door that agreed to offer us the same price, but reviews on tripadvisor indicated they also have the same problem with the "Venice smell", so we decided to stay in Abbazia. For two nights, it was not bad. The location made up for the deficiencies. I did not have problems with the church bells. As long as the window is closed I hear nothing from outside. The problem is having to open the window due to the excessive heat. There was no elevator in the hotel but the staff helped us with our luggage and was surprised when I offered a tip.

Reviews.Title: “In Venice just stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: Great team, great location just do book! The team will help you get the most from the trip even helping you to get lost in Venice! In a small way or if you prefer a big way. The hotel is great step out f the station turn left first right walk through the door to find you are being waited for. The hotel has great rooms they are as good as some "better" hotels in the UK, relax and enjoy the team will arrange it all for you.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Map_lovers
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with this hotel! We arrived at the Santa Lucia train station and were checking in the hotel five minutes later. It's location is beyond convenient! We were concerned that we might hear noise from the train station, but Hotel Abbazia is a quiet, serene spot in an otherwise crowded place in Venice. The hotel is also a great starting point for sightseeing in Venice; there is a major vaporetto stop a few minutes' walk from the hotel, and the hotel is located just off the major street that is filled with shops and restaurants. The rooms were in good condition, though a little run-down. Then again, everything in Venice is a little run-down. The only downside to our room was a curtain that had a torn loop and didn't hang properly and the headboard, which was covered in fabric, had little scratches and some threads hanging from it. This is what keeps us from ranking the hotel with five stars. However, the bathroom was fabulous! Nice tile, nice sink, nice tub, nice fixtures--and the bathroom was spacious. Also, the tub had jets. Considering the location and the fabulous bathroom, I wouldn't let some small tears in upholstery keep me from booking this hotel. The breakfast was average, certainly enough to tide you over until morning. As vegetarians, we had some delicious pastries and some fresh fruit and yogurt. People on a gluten-free diet will be happy to know that they have some gluten-free products available; we didn't try any, though. The staff was warm and welcoming. We were given invaluable tips for our time in Venice, and they always asked how we were doing and whether they could assist us with something. One other thing we enjoyed about the hotel was the quaint courtyard. It's filled with lush bushes and vines, and in a city that doesn't have many gardens, this was a welcome sight for us. We spent time just lounging on the comfortable wicker furniture. If you find a room at a good price and are arriving in the train station, you cannot beat the Hotel Abbazia!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LadysmithJuliet
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast! Friendly attentive staff, made our stay very enjoyable. We also valued the restaurant recommendations from staff, they didn't steer us wrong. The location is also central and close to shopping and vaporetto stops. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: cdcSeattle
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel!! This was my second time staying here. They even gave me the same room that I stayed in previously. The staff is so accommodating and we tried 3 of the restaurant suggestions, all terrific. The breakfast is very tasty with lots of choices, more than the usual continental roll and coffee. We took advantage of the offer to go by private boat to Murano and that was a great experience. Thanks to all of the staff but especially Mateo who helped make our vacation memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Simply marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: ruthandhammy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for new years and oh my! What a wonderful hotel! Wonderful location! The staff were lovely, the whole place was wonderful! I would throughly recommend getting the 'mini rough guide to venice' it was invaluable on our stay. The hotel was really useful on where to go, how to get there, etc. We got a cheap vaporetti online from the airport and then the bus back. It's expensive to eat, etc. but it's worth it. What a wonderful place! Go north of the hotel to the madonna church and go through the old jewish ghettos to get there. Try all the different routes to get to st marc's square, east of the hotel going round or south going through. Wonderful! Not enough good words for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location location!”
Reviews.Author: Hennie_Mostert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are carefull travellers as we have to stretch our Rand to the fullest extend. Hotel Abbazia is sure value for money, clean, oozes character, frienly staff and location location. The breakfast is the best I have experienced yet. My next trip to Venice will most certainly be Hotel Abbazia, perhaps just for a visit to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very polite hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: pufftetta
Reviews.Content: We had booked a superior double room at this hotel on February 3 to 5, to enjoy the atmosphere of Venice during the carnival. Unfortunately the climate has been very adverse, there has been a significant lowering of temperatures with abundant snowfalls that have literally paralyzed Italy, especially the transportation ... our train trip was canceled and so we had to give up our trip. So in my review I can not actually write about the structure and service, but I want to say a few words about the hotel management as they have been very very kind: given the reasons for the cancellation of the booking we were not charged any fee, not even a night, and this was not assumed! I am sure that when we'll have opportunity to plan a new trip to Venice will choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a 3 night break at Hotel Abbazia booked through Bath Travel and found the hotel to be in a perfect position just a short stroll from bus and train station. Hotel is also located just tens of metres from Grand Canal water bus stop and a main street with restaurants, shops and bars. The front entrance is not picture postcard but don't be fooled as once inside the friendly staff and general ambience are great. Room was clean and tidy and plenty big enough. Breakfast provided plenty of fresh food and juice options. The only drawback is the lack of a decent cuppa first thing as there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom - though I am advised that this is not available in any hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you abbazia!”
Reviews.Author: Kevfromle
Reviews.Content: Well...this was our second stay at the abbazia and as on our first visit, we were delighted. Most of what I would put in a review has already been said but it is worth emphasising two things in particular. Firstly the location....if you are on a short break or don't really want to lug cases or get a water taxi. Then this hotel is perfect for you. Less than one minute from the railway station and only two minutes walk from the bus station. Perfect....just get on with your holiday and when the time comes to leave then it's painless to get to your transport. The second thing worth emphasising is the excellent level of service. Mirko and the team on the front desk are fabulous. They are so helpful and so funny. Nothing is too much trouble. So...thanks to all at the Abbazia for a fabulous stay. We will definitely be back later on the year.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable No-Frills Room in Venice”
Reviews.Author: billvfitz
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3-city package through Gate1 Travel (very good to work with) that included Venice as our first stop. We were able to find the hotel easily since it is right around the corner from the train station and an easy walk from the bus depot. As others have posted, the hotel is in a location that is ideal for tourists and reasonably (for the area) priced. The front desk staff were all very friendly, extremely helpful, and knowledgable. We were relieved that language was not a problem - English was fluently spoken. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. The breakfast that was provided far exceeded our expectations (I will take exception to the comment about bad coffee - it was strong and delicious!). The only downside is that there are no elevators, but walking up the stairs helped us work off the extra calories that we consumed. Should we return to Venice, the hotel Abbazia will be our first choice!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: ZAMPANOBath
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at last year's carnevale. Great location,good breakfast and friendly staff. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at Hotel Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen1819
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Abbazia for the second time in January 2012. My first stay was in March 2011 and I enjoyed the hotel so much, I wanted to stay there again. The front desk staff is incredible - always friendly, helpful and cheerful. E-mails are always answered promptly and completely. One of the major advantages of this hotel is the location. Mere steps from the train station and just a short walk from the bus terminus where the airport express bus stops. You will appreciate how close it is to the train station if you have a lot of luggage. The vaporetto stops are located steps away from the hotel so traveling around the city, and to the outlying islands, is convenient. Breakfast is filling and plentiful with meats, cheeses, fresh fruits, a variety of drinks and wonderful pastries. I had a double room for single use and it was nice to have room to spread out. Housekeeping is excellent with towels changed daily. Lots of hot water and great water pressure in the shower. I want to thank the staff for a great 2nd stay at the Hotel Abbazia.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: focus58
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with friendly staff lovely building inside dont be put off by front off building as there is only a door way plentiful continental breakfast close to station and water buses lovely and warm bar area with nice garden would recommend if i return to venice will stay here again my wife enjoyed her 50th birthday break at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I have fallen in love with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AssiaMoscow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pleasant to me most for my last 10 day travel across Italy. It is very convenient to reach from station (any bridge on the way)) Probably that I reserved hotel as the user tripadvisor has been given me room of the best category is there was improved room though I reserved the standard. The room was big, pure, silent and convenient. The Internet a bit slow, but free. The bathroom was simple, but very pure and warm. Good means for a bathroom - gel, shampoo, a cream. I woke up in the morning under a sound of bells (I the inhabitant of a big city, therefore it is much more pleasant than to wake up from noise of cars)) and under a delightful smell of newly-baked rolls (it is possible, from a hotel bakery?) The breakfast was plentiful and it was possible to come 15 minutes prior to its termination and to be assured that it is enough meal. I felt in this hotel as at home. Employees were very lovely, always with a smile. A fine hall for rest where it is possible to spend time if you have already released a room, but still wait the train. A wonderful courtyard though in the winter unfortunately it was not possible to sit there. To us has very much carried with weather in this trip - all 2 days were a shining sun and the clear sky. There is only one nuance which should be considered for this hotel - in hotel there is no lift and if you are limited in physical possibilities to you it will be difficult. Though the kind personnel helps with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: dima b
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) stayed there for 3 nights. This was probably the best choice. The place is clean and very convenient to get to, especially if this is your 1st time in Venice. No need to take a watertaxi or go for an hour through labyrinth of streets, like it is a case with some other places. Breakfast is OK, rooms are large enough. Staff is efficient and pleasant. Another perk is that we could go to the "tourist Venice" or to into less "touristy" parts, where it is as beautiful, but very calm.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we ever had in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Asenka
Reviews.Content: First of all, hotel is just perfectly located. You can reach it easily from the train station (3 minutes walk) and bus stop. The stops of most useful vaporetto can also be found nearby. In the same time the location is quite calm (the only noise you can hear is the bells in the morning). Perfectly cleaned and comfortable rooms which are notably large (in comparison with those in other hotels of the same range). Diverse breakfast. In winter we could not benefit at full of the interior garden of the hotel, however in warm weather this should be also be a special pleasure. And the most important feature of the hotel is its staff: all of them were extremely polite and helpful! One more pleasant detail: we arrived on December 24th, and were very pleased to find a Christmas panettonne in our room. Such details make the travel specially pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Easy hotel for cruise departures”
Reviews.Author: Karen408
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia is a gem of a hotel that is easy to get to and for getting to the cruise terminal. We took train from Florence and it literaaly was 3 minutes out of the Venice train station to the hotel door. A very easy stroll even with suitcases. The hotel is very accomodating and the front desk personnel very helpful. The hotel is beautiful inside and we had a very large room on the ground floor overlooking the courtyard garden. The breakfast was plentiful with some very nice baked goods and a nice array of typical European breakfast items. We walked from the hotel over the new bridge to the Plaza Roma and caught the people mover to our cruise ship. You can also catch a vaporetta at the train station to the Plaza Roma stop with your luggage if you have too much to carry. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice as it has easy access to walk the rest of the town or take the vaporettas from in front of the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Most Beautiful City in the World”
Reviews.Author: 21Linda21
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Abbazia in November of 2011 for 3 nights. The hotel room was the largest room I have ever stayed in and it was extremely clean. Bathroom was equally as large. The front desk was extremely helpful. Breakfast was adequate, maybe a little crowded depending on the time but, who cares, you are in Venice! Lots of atmosphere in the hotel and also surrounding it. Steps from the train station, steps from lots of shopping and most important steps from the vaporettas. Venice has a very sophisticated system of water transportation that makes getting around a snap. Will definitely come back and will definitely choose Hotel Abbazia again. A very good value. Linda Garbaccio

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn007_7
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. Initially we were disappointed by the outside but once inside we were delighted. This is an old monastry and has all the aspects of what you expect and need by visiting Venice. The reception staff were very helpful and even gave me an umbrella to keep on leaving as the rain was teeming down. The rooms were large with full bathroom suite and all very clean. The breakfast was more than adequate. This hotel is no more than 100 metres from the train station, perfect. I would recommend this gem to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our family. It is located right next to the train station but on a very quiet alley. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They were very friendly and outgoing with my 4 children (all who loved Venice). Most hotels in Europe roll their eyes when they see us come in with 4 kids. Breakfast was good and slightly above average by European standards. (Come on people, stop expecting the Denny's Grand Slam breakfast). The Vaperetto stop is no more than a 100 yards away which is a great starting point - to take a canal cruise down to St Mark's square. The rooms themselves were OK - comfortable and functional and clean. The reviews are correct. The bells will wake you up at 7:15 in the morning. I think it adds to the charm. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and the prices was much more reasonable than other hotels closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: KenCharb
Reviews.Content: This is a very interesting place to stay. Lots of charm and character. Its location is ideal if coming in by train or bus. Both are only minutes away on foot, less then 10. If you are leaving on a cruise out of Venice then this is also a great location. Less then a 10 minute drive to the dock. It is located down a quiet alley but not far from all the great sights and it is very easy to get around. I would suggest a map as Venice can be tricky with all the canals and bridges. The desk has maps available and will highlight all the sites if you need. The staff were excellent and friendly. spoke many different languages. Would stay here again next time I am in Venice. The room we had was a good size and our window opened on the court yard. They had a great breakfast available each morning. The only negative would be the church bells in the morning. But we found it as part of the charm the place has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception staff”
Reviews.Author: LittleHel
Reviews.Content: simple hotel, but very clean. If you only see this hotel for the outside maybe you will fell like you made a bad choice, but rooms are very clean, staff is great and is always ready to help you out with tips for tours mainly Mirko, that helped us a lot. Another good thing is that this hotel is so close to the train station and vaporetto... so convenient!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Donati
Reviews.Content: After reviewing hotels on Tripadvisor, I chose the Hotel Abbazia. We sayed here 3 nights in late Dec. We arrived on the train, and found the hotel to be just minutes from the train station. Thus said, it was tucked away on a quiet street so that it was very quiet and set apart from the ususal station hustle and bustle. The staff were fabulous--friendly and helpful in everything. They set us up for a free water taxi to Murano where we got a tour to a glass facotry. From there, they got us another taxi to Burano for lace! Really special! They recommended excellent and not touristy places to eat and were just a great resource for any info we needed. As said, the hotel is in a great location--minutes from either the train station or the bus that goes to and from the airport. You can also get the vaporetto (water bus) to any part of Venice from there as well. We are a family of 5 and so we had to have two rooms. The rooms were spacious and clean....one had a bath the other a shower. Each day they were perfectly cleaned up. The beds are typical European in that they are a little hard---but that is the way they are in Italy.The breakfast was a VERY complete European continental with a large variety of things to eat. I have seen MUCH worse in my travels! They had fresh donuts and corssaints, crostata, yoghurt, cereal, eggs and meat. In addition to having spacious rooms, they had a large common area with sofas and a bar for drinks. They had daily newspapers from around the world and was a great place to hang out. The value was excellent and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveler67
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff are the most helpful staff ever. They will do anything for you - call to see if something is open, help you navigate via maps, answer e-mails before you arrive (they answered all of my questions promptly and efficiently). The place was an abbey (that is what Abbazia means) and the pulpit in the lounge provides great ambience. I had many requests regarding rooms and the staff managed to meet them all!!! We stayed there December 17 for 4 nights which is a slow time of year. They gave our family 2 rooms on the second floor (there are no elevators) that were both behind an outside door so we could shut that and get between our 2 rooms very efficiently. The rooms had burgundy silk walls - you felt like you were in Italy! We had a great tiled shower with doors - my one suggestion to the staff is to hang a shower basket from the door for guests to put soap and shampoo in (not a big deal but easier for use). The beds are nice and long but a bit hard - the way it seems Italians like their beds. The breakfast was wonderful with boiled eggs, juice, hot chocolate, various coffees, croissonts, buns, ham, meat, cheese, yogurt, cereal, toast, fruit - a full selection. Everything was tasty and good. The location was right around the corner from the train station and easy to wheel luggage between there and the hotel (they even tell you where to turn that avoids the steps). Coming from the airport we took the Aliguana boat because we thought a boat ride would be scenic but I recommend the land bus (I think it's the ACTV - if you e-mail them they will send you directions from the drop-off to the hotel which you need because it is easy to get lost in Venice). The bus is 5 euro a person and the Aliguana is 15 euro/person and the bus is quicker and picked up right outside the airport whereas you have to walk quite a way at the airport to catch the boats. It's a nice walk to St. Mark's (maybe 25 minutes, I'm a slow walker) past lots of shopping so it's fun to stop and look. I recommend going in the off-season because rates are cheaper and you can even bargain on a gondola ride for your family (I think we paid about 80 euro for a 50 minute ride for the 4 of us that went all around the grand canal, under the Rialto bridge and in side canals). The best is to bargain to 60 euro and tell them you will give him a good tip if you like the ride - he even sang and whistled). The weather was cool and we wore 2 layers of light jackets so we could take one off when it warmed up. We took the train for a day trip to Verona and it worked well . We took the local trains which stop more but are cheap - but know that you have to validate your ticket at a machine before getting on the train for the local/regional trains - or you can get a huge fine. I highly recommend the Hotel Abbazzia!

Reviews.Title: “Great reception staff”
Reviews.Author: webbsm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights whilst in Venice (my tip, stay longer if you can). The staff, in particular Mateo, were very helpful and gave fantastic dining recommendations. The room wasn't amazing but the staff and location made up for we. The room was very cold and we couldn't figure the heating. Breakfast was what appears to be the norm for a three star hotel. Don't hesitate in booking this hotel especially if travelling by train

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: a5150mom
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner from the train station in front of Grand Canal. Beautiful Hotel helpful and friendly staff . Everything was great . Will stay there again when in Venice .

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Jon G
Reviews.Content: What can I add that hasn't already been written in the numerous positive comments regardng this hotel. Our stay was as good as advertised with a very accommodating staff that offered dining suggestions and then provided directions with a fine complimentary map. The problem is that even a good map can't assure you won't get lost in Venice. Actually, getting lost in Venice can be fun. Quaint rooms, clean bathrooms and that amazing church bell to provide a daily wake-up call for those who aren't already up and enjoying what proved to be a very tasty and more than ample breakfast. The location, while a bit hidden down an alley, is ideal for access to the train station, the vaporetto (public transportation) and the all-important Piazzale Roma. All-in-all it was a wonderful four days spent in Venice, enhanced by the Hotel Abbazia.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommyh88
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice staff very helpfull and polite . Spacious rooms nicely decorated. everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Venice by train at noon on Wednesday May 11th for a five night stay. From the train station to this hotel was three minutes flat! The front desk agent was very friendly, checked us in quickly and walked us to our room on the 2nd floor. The room was small but well appointed, as was the bathroom. Everything was clean and comfortable, and the room overlooked the beautiful courtyard. The entire hotel is very nice, having once been an Abbey and still attached to a church it is well taken care of. A huge breakfast is served every morning, and drinks are available at the bar, in the sitting room, or to take out to the courtyard. The location was perfect, surrounded by shops and restaurants, and only a minute from a Vaporetto stop. All of Venice is amazing, we can't wait to go back, and we will certainly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, close to train station, clean, comfortable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: N S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a renovated monastery, and the common areas are pretty stunning. The room was small but comfortable. The bathroom was modern and excellent. Both were clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was fairly extensive -- hard boiled eggs, cheese, meats, yogurt, croissants, pastries, coffee, tea, juice -- there was an assortment of food and drinks. The hotel is located just minutes from the train station, and a water bus stop, so it was very convenient. We enjoyed walking through Venice to our various tourist destinations, and liked the location a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: NP57
Reviews.Content: We have just ended nine wonderful days at the Hotel Abbazia. The reviews provided were very accurate. We had three single superior rooms. As two of us have difficulty with stairs, rooms were provided on the ground floor. Every request was attended to with good humor and thoroughness. The breakfast was generous and unrushed. All the staff were friendly and my 81 year old Mother found the Hotel comfortable and easy to negotiate. Heating was excellent and thr roms spotlessly clean. Every assistance and advice were given when required. The Hotel arranged airport and cruise ship transfers for us which were much, much cheaper than those provided by our travel agent back home. Thank you to Fabio and the other staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think you can go wrong”
Reviews.Author: fiddlebike
Reviews.Content: This place is an easy 5 minute walk from the train station and is just a hundred yards off the Grand Canal. Yet, being back in a tiny alley, it is quiet and pleasant. The staff was very friendly and helpful with storing our bags and providing answers to our questions. The room was decent sized with a high ceiling and new bathroom. It was so quiet we could open the window a bit to let in fresh air. The common room/bar was mostly emptyt and we used it to play cards one night with our friends by pulling two sofas in close to a coffee table. The bar was right there for handy drinks. They have a large breakfast room and serve quite a diversity of items for their continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jane L
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hidden hotel. We had a triple, and it was quiet and cozy. the staff were really helpful, and it was right near the train station. Heard one reviewer mention that breakfast was "just" continental. Well...THIS is the continent...and that's a typical European breakfast. The one surprise was that 2x in the morning some bells would ring quite loudly..but we loved it. Part of the charm.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Rizzm0m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in July. The staff could not have been nicer - even offered to allow us to come back on our last day of travel to use the facilities free of charge as we waited for our flight. Our room was quiet and comfortable and the breakfast was well rounded. We chose this hotel because we were traveling by train and it was so convenient to be able to walk to the station (and not have to drag your bags through the city). The hotel is down a narrow street which makes your stay feel anything but close to a train station.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to give a great review but unfortunately our stay was not so comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KariJazz
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights and have mostly good things to say about this hotel- staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good and the hotel has a great look and atmosphere. Unfortunately the most important things to us is to be able to have a comfortable sleep and a relaxing shower, and none of those were possible. The bed was not a king bed but 2 twins pushed together. They were so hard we struggled to sleep and the pillows were incredibly hard too. The bathroom really had seen better days; there was no shower curtain which left our bathroom quite wet after showering, and there was also no fixture to keep the shower up so it could only be hand held. For some guests these will only be minor issues, some people might in fact like their bed to be firm, but for us it meant that our stay was less than comfortable. We also found that although the temperatures outside were turning fairly cold, inside the hotel was so warm it was bordering on the uncomfortable at times. We had no choice but to sleep with both windows open even after trying to turn the heater down in our room, which meant that the sounds of dogs barking and church bells ringing also did not help us sleep very well. It is a great shame that we can not give this hotel a better review as it has got so many things so right! And the location is fantastic! In many ways I would recommend it, but personally I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bocadey
Reviews.Content: We have already been telling everyone we know about the wonderful hotel we stayed in during our recent trip to Venice. Hotel Abbazia has about everything you could possibly want for a great home base in the city of canals. Our room was large, clean and well appointed. The bathroom had a two-person shower, with separate rain shower heads and a heated towel rack. We even had both north-facing and south-facing views. The staff are charming, helpful and multilingual. Breakfasts offered a lot of food variety, and it was fun to have our morning meal in the little united nations of the Abbazia breakfast room. The courtyard was also available for breakfasts. The bar lounge is in an old chapel and still has a few architectural details left from its former life. We enjoyed a glass of prosecco in it one night after a traditional Venetian wine bar crawl. The location is great: practically next door to the train station and very close to the old Jewish quarter. It's a ten to fifteen-minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and, depending on crowds, almost a half-hour walk to Piazza San Marco, but Venice is all about walking and the routes are well marked. It's nice being a bit away from the tourist crowds but still in the thick of things. Now the church bells mentioned by other travelers could be a bit of an issue to some people. They sure shook us out of bed that first morning. We just considered it a reliable alarm clock set to 7:15 in the morning (with an hour long "snooze" function) and didn't worry about programming the alarms on our phones the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Venice, great location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Jakilu
Reviews.Content: This great hotel located close to the station, but quiet was easy to find. Staff are all multi-lingual (4 languages) and can jest in every language. Nice breakfasts, with hot and cold buffet, fruit, etc. A nice bar lounge with plenty of room, rare in Venice. Not too far from Rialto, Vapporetto stop about 200 meters away at the station. Pretty courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely my choice if I travel to Venice again”
Reviews.Author: ChunChieh W
Reviews.Content: I've traveled with my whole family in November and we've booked 5 rooms. All 5 rooms are clean and quiet and my room has a nice bathtub. The location can't be better: near the train station and you don't need to cross any bridges. Near the first stop of vaporetto stop so it is easier to get a good seat to take photos. It is near the cannaregio area and easy to find a good restaurant as well. The staff are friendly and provides good recommendations for restaurant. I've booked the hotel from Venere but it may be cheaper if you book the hotel via Abbazia website directly with trip advisor coupon code. I would like to stay here again if I have a chance to visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MMMSebastopol
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia, a former abbey has real charm and beautiful touches. The main lobby is one of them, as you can see from the website photos. The standard room was a comfortable size with a closet, en suite bathroom, tv and refridgerator, safe, wood floors and upholstered walls. Breakfast was included and had warm pastries and cakes, cold cuts and breads, and cereals and juices. There is an all-in-one coffee/cocoa/tea machine which I would avoid--whichever drink you choose comes out tasting like all three combined--BUT during breakfast hours they will make you an espresso or capuccino at the bar for no charge. All of the staff were wonderful, including the night clerk who found me a fan at 3 am and brought it up to the room. The towels are large, there is a double set of pillows and plenty of electrical outlets for charging electronic devices and cameras. It's location is extremely convenient--close to the train station but quiet and also close to the bus to the airport. No canal view, but close to the Scalzi Bridge over the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in a Venetian Abbey”
Reviews.Author: IngridaMargareta
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were travelling by train and it proved to be very convenient - a 5 minute walk to Hotel Abbazia with our luggage. We were given a friendly greeting, highlighting that our luggage was now theirs to carry for us - we breathe a sigh of relief, what have we got in those bags of ours that is so heavy!! Anyway, our room is very spacious and comfortable and to our delight overlooks the beautiful garden across the old tiled roofs of the Abbey. The bathroom is also fine but we have a bath with a hand held shower, our preference would have been a 'shower' shower. You can't have it all I guess, so we were happy with the view of the garden and the bathroom the way it was. The bed was great, very comfortable and it was lovely to hear the church bells toll at 6pm (I think). The ambience of the hotel is truly 'Abbey' style and as we climbed the beautiful staircase I was trying to imagine the Abbott of Venice being here. The bar and lounge area is a beautiful large room with the statues of a time gone by -it is beautiful. A delicious buffet breakfast is also served in another large room. As the weather was so lovely during our stay, we enjoyed our breakfast in the garden and a delicious glass of Prosecco from the bar, was sipped in the garden after a long day of walking through the maze of canals and streets of Venice . The hotel is also situated close to some great restaurants - venture across the Scalzi bridge too. The piers for the boats (Ferrovia) which take you to the various islands e,g, Murano, are also situated nearby. Always keep a map with you though and when you stray, as you venture through Venice, look for the signs to 'Ferrovia' which will always lead you back to the area near the hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: suejack100
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from most attractions with easy access to water bus by Scalzi bridge. Very good breakfast,friendly helpful staff. Comfy beds and although we didnt have a room overlooking the garden it was very quiet and stylish. Good value and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: fawkolgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of charm. We had a large room, with modern bathroom, on the ground floor. The decor was "old world", but nice and simple. The beds were very comfortable. We had a continental breakfast daily, which was very good, and quite a large variety to choose from,this was included in the rate, which was quite reasonable. The Hotel interior is quite light and airy, and has a large lounge/cocktail bar for it's guests to use. The young men on the desk were all very cheerful and helpful. The Hotel has a lovely courtyard, off the breakfast room. The Hotel is only a few steps from the Railway Station, and only five minutes walk over the bridge from the Bus Depot. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Pauline2006
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Everything has been said before: hotel has lots of character - beautiful bar area - staff are extremely welcoming and helpful and location is superb. We had room 409, small but very clean and comfortable. Large tiled bathroom with jacuzzi bath. Good choice at breakfast. Breakfast hours quite long. Lovely garden which unfortunately we did not use due to inclement weather. Reception staff truly wonderful - helped with restaurant recommendations, weather forecasts, trip advice etc. Location is great: 10 mins. walk from bus station (bus from airport takes 20 mins. and costs five euros) and close to water buses. Nice enough surrounding area with lots of shops and restaurants. Area feels very safe. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of character, top notch service, and clean, updated rooms”
Reviews.Author: phiberoptik
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location to train station and Piazza Roma, service, friendliness, great English speaking front desk, clean, big bathrooms, updated rooms, great charm and character. Cons: No elevator, bells ring for two minutes daily at 6:15am and 8:15am at next door church, no shower in room We took the train in from Rome and with 150lbs of luggage, it was nice to only have to go two streets from the station. Huge plus for us. Also only minutes from the the main vehicle lot, Piazza Roma, where a taxi or bus would bring you in from the airport or ship port. The service here was great. I cannot remember everyone's names at the front desk but they were all super. I appreciate that their name tags have flags on them to show what languages they speak. Which is great for incoming guests. The courtyard is beautiful with a mix of modern and vintage furniture. Unfortunately it was cold and rainy so we didnt use it. Breakfast was traditional Italian continental breakfast with no notable high or low points. The common area of the hotel is spacious, has tons of character, and seemed to be popular in the after-dinner hours. For reference, we stayed in room 312. Keeping in consideration that European hotel rooms are always small, our room fit a nice newer queen bed with frabic covered headboard, pin lighting, built-in storage, and a desk in the living space with a surprisingly spacious bathroom. We liked the fabric lined walls as well. The only negative of the whole hotel was that the bathroom did not have a shower. Just a tub with a faucet and sprayer on a hose. We like our showers so this was a bit out of our comfort zone. This is our only hotel experience in Venice but for the price, I am not sure we could have gotten much of a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, no problems.”
Reviews.Author: PWJT
Reviews.Content: Hotel location, service and value fully met my expectations.These were set as a result of "internet research" and I was not disappointed. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and relaxing interlude in our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Valorie O
Reviews.Content: Really loved staying at this hotel. Close to the port, the water taxis, vaporetta service and the train station but located in a quiet little street away from all the noise. Wonderful garden area to relax in and very friendly staff as well. Enjoyed returning every night to the peace and calm. My husband and I would highly recommend staying at this location. Good rates as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lots of history and good location.”
Reviews.Author: WillieVancouver
Reviews.Content: Abbrezia Very clean, quiet and comfortable hotel easily qualifies for its 3 star rating. It is about 5 minutes walk and only one bridge away from the airport shuttle drop point. If you are using Santa Lucia train station it is half a block away. It would be hard to beat the convenience of this hotel. Be aware that the entrance is about 30 yards inside a narrow alley, at night Â it can appear a bit intimidating but the alley is well lit and there are usually other people walking through it. Also the crime rate here is very low. It is also located at the end of a quite busy network of winding shopping streets and canals.Â  The hotel building is full of history, and is immaculately preserved. The bathroom was very modern and finished in lavish amounts of marble. Our modest sized room was old style Venetian and quite charming, padded silk covered walls no-less! The church bells that others complain of were not at all annoying, they actually added to the ambiance and only lasted for a few minutes. The only minor problem was the lack of an elevator but this is a historic building and the stairs are wide and not too steep. In our case the night clerk was sympathetic to my age and decrepit physical condition, not only did he give me a bottle of water he also cheerfully took our very heavy bag up to the third floor. I look forward to staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: typicalcustomer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights as part of a train journey around Northern Italy and chose this hotel because of its proximity to the railway station, but it turned out to be a great location for other reasons too - very close to the water buses (which we used to visit Murano and Burano) and their ticket office and lots of eating places and shops, with perhaps a 20/30 minute walk to St Marks Square. We really liked our room which was very spacious and comfortable with a lovely bathroom ensuite. The staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke perfect english. Breakfast was good and as the hotel as a lovely rear enclosed garden some guests ate theirs there in the open air. All in all we were very happy indeed with our stay in this hotel and would book again if we return to Venice It is nice to give a hotel a positive review without adding any negatives Thanks for the stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Hans B
Reviews.Content: We choose the hotel through a recommendation, and were very satisfied with the accommodation. Especially the helpful and friendly staff made a big difference to our other expieriences in Italy. The room was large and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious. Especially in the enclosed garden. Thanks for a great stay in your Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient to the train station”
Reviews.Author: ks4pu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia is a lovely hotel. The staff is friendly. The breakfast was great. The location is extremely convenient to the train station. It isn't as convenient to the main tourist sites, but you can reach them in about 25 minutes on foot or likely the same amount of time by the water bus (vaporetto). There is vaporetto stop conveniently located near the hotel. Having to walk a bit to reach the sites is really okay as "getting lost" in Venice is part of experiencing Venice. A map is almost useless in Venice. The hotel provides a decent one. There are signs posted everywhere telling you which direction you need to go to reach the nearest site. Having an idea of which sites you want to head toward to reach your final destination is the key to getting around. We had some trouble with the hotel's wifi. It wouldn't work in our top floor room. We were able to get it to work just fine in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Schnapper3
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this charming hotel (converted refectory) which we booked after extensive search on TripAdvisor. Located very close to Venice train station. Clean comfortable room; delicious breakfast included; very nice outdoor enclosed garden...tranquil place to eat breakfast or enjoy cocktails in the evening; very helpful staff. Can't beat the price (210 Euros/night for superior room) for this level of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with charming staff”
Reviews.Author: rocklake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - choose it for the location - close to the train station, very close to two water bus stops. We were pleasantly surprised - the staff were humourous, very helpful, the room was large with a large bathroom, windows opened up to a lovely courtyard with wonderful church bells to wake you early in the am. The buffet breakfast was a bit crowded in the small dining room - but we took ours outside to the courtyard and it was very pleasant. No elevator - but if that's a problem ask for a room on the first floor. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot for your stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Paulo2001London
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel based on previous Tripadvisor reviews and was not disapppointed at all! The hotel is located just a short distance from the main train station and most of the Venice attractions are walking distance. This hotel is in a building which was previously a convent, so have lots of lovely architectural features. The staff was very courteous and helpful and the hotel offers a good free wi-fi. The hotel have very confortable rooms and all very quiet with areas to relax. The continental breakfast is really nice and best of all, all rooms are air conditioned( specially when Venice is really hot this is a big +++). They also offer an outdoor area with very comfy chairs and tables, if you like to unwind a bit with a glass of wine after a long day in town thats the place! To be honest I have travelled half of the world and can be very picky with hotels I stay, however Abbazia surely did not disappointed me ad would return there again and again! One tip is when arriving by plane its easier to take the boat service to Guglie as its not far and have only one small bridge to cross ( with suitcases), If you arrive by bus, its a bit far to walk and you have to cross a very big bridge. If you arrive by train, the hotel is almost in the street beside the station. The hotel doles not have lifts, so if someone cannot climb stairs, ask for a room in the ground floor and enjoy your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice, Loved Hotel - mostly”
Reviews.Author: MinxyMeg
Reviews.Content: It took me ages to book a hotel with a location that would be perfect, it turned out to be just that. It was close enough to the bus from the airport, short walk over the bridge, the station and the water bus. We stayed in room 314, good beds, good shower, nice enough view over the gardens. Reception staff in the main were lovely. Hotel staff were helpful, some couldn't speak English but hey we were in Italy so some hand signals had to be used and we all smiled. Tips: Don't pack for a month if you are away for a few days, you have to get your case up and down bridges, make sure you iron everything before you travel, no irons available in venice and pack ear plugs as the bells start at 7.20. It proves to be a great alarm clock so no need to pack one of those either.

Reviews.Title: “really handy for railway station”
Reviews.Author: NCH23
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by train and the hotel could hardly have been closer - just a couple of minutes walk from the station. The room was large and clean, as was the bathroom. There is a pleasant garden in which you can sit for breakfast (if you get there early enough - everyone has the same idea!). The hotel was formerly a monastery and the chapel is now a large airy room with a bar and comfy sofas for sitting and relaxing in (although it feels a bit wrong sitting with a drink beneath the pulpit which is still in place!). At night the area is very lively with families and couples wandering about and plenty of nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great place.”
Reviews.Author: mlcAlrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days and two nights at the hotel abbazia. We got into Venice late at night and had been told to take a water taxi by some other travelers. When we got to the water taxi line at night we found that it was a ticket machine, not a person, something had happened and it was not working. There were a lot of people who were really lost, luckily we found a map and realized we didnt need a water taxi because our hotel was a few blocks away. It was also very close to the train station. A beautiful hotel was waiting for us. We got a room for three and it fit us perfectly. We were able to walk to a lot of places to eat without walking far at all. the room was clean. the only thing that was a little unfortunate for us was the shower was a handheld and was hard to use, my friend had to sit down, little weird but nothing that would keep me from visiting again. The breakfast was good, and the seating for breakfast was very nice. the staff was polite and always willing to help. One thing that was really nice was that they were willing to hold our bags for us when we stayed during the next day. we were able to spend more time in venice without worrying about carrying around very heavy bags.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl at the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Pond
Reviews.Content: A fabulous and beautiful hotel in the vicinity of the railway station. We had a small, but nice and clean room facing the peaceful hotel garden. Great, friendly service. You get everywhere by walking or taking a vaporetto. We'll stay here in the future too, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan118
Reviews.Content: We were exceptionally surprised by the size and the beauty of our hotel room! It it steps away from the train station and every other main attraction requires a long walk. However, it is a great way to see the city and explore. Take breaks along the way. The hotel staff was also very hospitable and attentive. The only negative would be the breakfast. It consisted of cheese, coldcuts and cereal and the biggest disappointment of all was the coffee. It came from a instant machine at breakfast. All I need on vacation is a good cup of coffee, and unfortunately we had to go out in the morning to get it. But in life you take the good with the bad and I most certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again if ever in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and excellent location for us”
Reviews.Author: PGK8
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff and excellent service. We had a quad room for my husband, two daughters and myself. It was a very big room and so Venice like. The porter brought our bags (4 big bags of luggage) to us. There are no elevators. I felt really bad for him but he did a great job and we gave him a tip (you don't have to but we wanted to). The buffet breakfast was excellent - fresh meats, cheeses, fruit, coffee, cereal. The outside garden was great - a nice place to unwind after walking the streets of Venice all day. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. We arrived at the airport, purchased bus tickets for 6 euros each; the bus was very easy to find - right outside arrivals. The bus ride took about 20 minutes to Piazzale Roma. From there you can literally walk 8 minutes to this hotel. It was easy to find but do a google map search with pics and you will have no problems. Just beware of the gypsy men! You have to walk over the bridge and they will grab your luggage to help you and won't stop until you are over the bridge and they expect money. They won't leave; they will yell - so if you want help, let them help but it will cost you, otherwise don't let go of your luggage. Venice is beautiful and it is a very long walk to Piazza San Marco from this hotel but just go with it. We took a water bus back. If you don't care about money, take the gondala ride. We cared - family of four, they wanted almost 500 euro. Maybe it's cheaper off season - doesn't matter. We chose this hotel because it was also close to the train station - literally a 5 minute walk. We were going to Milan afterwards, so again it's all about the location. There's a supermarket we shopped at for munchies and water which was really convenient and the restaurents are all good. Just check the menus! Overall, I would stay at this hotel again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mirtle2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Abbazia. The room was lovely, the staff were exceptionally helpful and the breakfast buffet was amazing. It is a beautiful hotel in an old monestary. It is very close to the train station and water bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: xCharlottex1
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. It is a complete jewel. Where do you start.......location. It is a block from the train station.......close to the cruise ship port and just and ideal spot. Breakfast buffett was good, pleentiful and nice....there is an outdoor court yard across the hall that you can eat in as well. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. A special thanks to Aluise, Mirko, and Fabio. You were all delightful to talk to and so very helpful. I especially liked Mirko's sense of humour although Aluise thinks he is the ugly one. This is without a doubt the best hotel we stayed in in Italy. Would I come back.....you bet...in a minute. You can't go wrong with this place. It oozes charm (it is part of a monestary). I would highly recomend a stay there and definitlely would book it again. Al and Charlotte Lawrence Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mellyfootprints
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely in a great location, near to the train station - no bridges to cross while towing your luggage from the train station to the hotel. Mind you - there are steps while crossing bridges. You def want to climb as little bridges as possible while you have luggages with you. There is also a vaporetto stop just 50m or less outside hotel. Makes going around Venice so easy. Hotel is great, breakfast outdoor area is cosy and beautiful. A different feel compared to other hotels I stayed in Italy. Free WIFI is awesome!!! In these modern days, I can say I cant do without wifi... And I also do not wish to pay the horrible mark-up internet prices other hotels are offering. Staff is great too, friendly and polite. They never fail to greet you with smiles day and night. :) Room wise is adequate, big enough for us. Love the chandelier hanging on top of the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rayl33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good deal. As many reviewers mentioned, it is clean and very close to the train station. We did not, however, find it very convenient to other places- - although this was partly because we only stayed 2 nights (1 day and a half) in Venice and were still trying to navigate our way around. I actually thought the breakfast was pretty decent. I loved the cappucino machine and the packets of crackers/cookies and nutella to go. It was the only place we stayed with bananas, strangely enough. I also appreciated the hard boiled eggs and croissants. The room was small; there was only a very narrow perimeter around the bed, making the suitcases rather cumbersome. The bathroom was actually quite large-- almost the same size as the bedroom as my boyfriend remarked. The double bed was of course two beds pushed together and my boyfriend found it rather too hard. The staff was friendly and the place was clean and the outdoor garden area was very pleasant for eating breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BrittanynYuvi
Reviews.Content: The front was very helpful, very friendly, and very accommodating. Free wifi a bonus. Complimentary umbrellas offered when it rains. Breakfast was just enough...not american but so what were in Italy u eat quick and light and move on. Location is just over the bridge down a quant little alleyway. Rooms were cute, nothing special, but really makes you feel like you're in Italy. I would definitely go back if I make it to Venice again!

Reviews.Title: “Initial Impressions from an Australian.”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear789
Reviews.Content: I have been in the hotel some 2 hours.My initial impressions. Easy access to hotel and easy to find. Excellent and friendly and helpful reception on first arrival. I travel extensively and have not had such a good experience in other Italian hotels. Garden and bar area to be seen to be believed. Room is a good size and has all the right facilities. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Good impression so far, will report back after my 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: polo-p
Reviews.Content: Who would have known a hotel like this existed in the crazy backstreets of Venice and for such a reasonable price? What a delightful surprise it was to land at this oasis when we were completely exhausted and dripping from the heat! Loved the inviting common room areas, courtyard garden and certainly appreciated the free cappucino in the middle of the afternoon. So the breakfasts are far from home cooking. The settings, rooms and front desk service are perfectly lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. I hope to return.”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the station but still in a quiet backwater. Perfect for exploring Venice. Friendly and helpful staff - the free map was very welcome! Small but perfectly adequate room - no view but then I wasn't paying for one! Charming garden for breakfast. Air conditioning very welcome during sizzling August.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this not 4 stars?”
Reviews.Author: Abi B
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 wonderful nights at the Abbazia and highly recommend this hotel. So what's good about it? 1. it is located about a 2 minute walk from the station, just off a busy strip of restaurants, shops and by one of the 3 bridges which cross the Grand Canal. 2. Even though it is in a busy location it is so calm and quiet inside the hotel, especially when you sit in their beautiful garden. 3. It is extremely clean and the staff work hard to keep it that way (they were always cleaning!) 4. Welcoming and friendly staff. 5. High speed internet access in the rooms - all free! 6. Nicely decorated rooms which enhance the existing features of the monastery. 7. Brilliant double showers. 8. Lovely breakfasts, especially the sugar doughnuts. 9. Reasonably priced compared to other Venice hotels. The only thing to note about this hotel is that it does not have a lift and our room was on the third floor (this was the top floor for this hotel). There are rooms on the ground floor and the hotel staff happily carried our bags up the wide staircase. Overall this has been my favourite hotel that I have stayed in on my Italian adventure so far (the others were supposedly 4 star hotels).

Reviews.Title: “I loved Alvise and this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: desiree1022
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I want to thank the staff Alvise and Matteo for making our stay so pleasant. The two of them were absolutely wonderful and I looked forward to seeing their smiling faces each time I passed the front desk. (They have the same barber. lol) The place itself is a renovated convent with lots of charm. I loved waking every morning to the sound of the church bells. It is very close to the main train station and the vaporetto. It is tucked away in one of the cobblestone streets, so it is very quiet. There are many restaurants and stores a few feet away. The pictures noted are accurate depictions. The breakfast was the usual European-style continental breakfast: breads, lunch meats, hard boiled eggs, croissants, and other pastries. Please do not expect an American style breakfast. I had a triple room and it was adequate in size, as was the bathroom. Actually, it was large by comparison to other rooms I've had in Italy. The bathroom was equally large and well equipped. The room was cleaned well every day, and the bed was comfortable. No complaints about the accommodations at all. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here and I would definitely return. Venice is very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Almost felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: annad55
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. No, it's not on the canal and you have to walk down an alley to get there, but it was worth every step. I traveled with my husband and two grown children. We had two rooms towards the end of what they called the first (but I would call second) floor. The rooms were next to each other, but the doors did not open out to the hallway, rather they faced each other in a small alcove off the hallway. Both rooms were spacious (especially by Italy standards) and the bathrooms were also a good size. The hotel was once a monastery and it still had that Old World feel to it. The floors and woodwork were beautiful. It also had an unusual feature for Italy - screens on the windows! The screen were like shades that could be pulled down if the windows were open - and the weather was nice enough to keep the windows open at night! After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I thought the bells might be annoying - but they were not as loud as I had expected them to be. In fact, the sound of the bells was the perfect alarm clock -almost like you hit the snooze button because they would toll every fifteen minutes from around 7 to 8 in the morning. This was fine because breakfast started at 7:30 and lasted until (I think) 11:30. What set this hotel apart was the service. The entire staff was friendly and helpful - from the front desk to housekeeping. All were willing to spend a few minutes talking with us and pointed us towards good, reasonable restaurants. What I liked most was that it felt like we were in a more residential spot than a tourist spot. It's location was around the corner from the train station, at the Ferrovia vaporetto stop. which was quite convenient. Breakfast (included in the cost of our room) had a good variety of food (the fruit was excellent) and we ate in the courtyard everyday. Internet was free. The only complaint I had was that the beds were hard - but I found that to be true in all the hotels I stayed in in Italy. This hotel had a positive chi for us - and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Historic, Convenient, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Gohtravels
Reviews.Content: Just 5 minutes away from the train station, it was such a relief not to have to drag our luggage across all those bridges just to get to the hotel. Not to mention the rain. Oh yes! did anyone mention it rains quite a bit during this time in Venice? And the flooding. It does add to the charm of the city though. First person to greet us at the hotel, Elvis, made us feel so delighted and at ease. We could even borrow rain boots from the hotel but we preferred to buy them from the stores as there were so many attractive designs to choose from and relatively inexpensive (20-25 euros). They accomodated our booking request for 2 side-by-side rooms and both rooms overlooked the beautiful courtyard. Each room was comfortable for 2 and the toilets were clean and well maintained. Breakfast spread (breads, hams, cereals, eggs) and variety was fabulous, with the staff being so friendly and accommodating. Every morning, we requested for hot water for our thermos so that we could bring along to keep warm and by the second morning, the service staff at breakfast remembered and brought it for us, even without being asked. If we ever land in Venice again, we would most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat”
Reviews.Author: Stevestrumpet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet location away from the foot traffic but still very accessible to the rest of the city. It was nice to have a garden courtyard to relax in. Staff was fun, friendly and caring.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: t0rtiz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights while in Venice and thought it was a jewel of a hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room overlooked the garden, was quite large and very well kept.The hotel is conveniently located near the train station so we were quickly settled into our room and off exploring in no time. Great shopping & good restaurants just steps away. The breakfast was nice; we enjoyed ours in the covered dining areas in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 3 star - so no shocks”
Reviews.Author: Knickerscat
Reviews.Content: Booked by my sister for a family trip to celebrate mums 70th. My sister was a repeat guest. Not being snobby but iam more used to staying in 4/5 star hotels, but knowing how expensive Veniceis and wanting to really spoil mum, we budgeted on the accommodation. You get what you pay for!!! Hotel in a quiet side street and yes the bells do sound out early - 150 chimes a time!! We had a superior room and it was very comfortable. Bathroom basic but has a good pressure over bath shower and plenty of hot water. No shower curtain, did however leave to a soaked floor!! Breakfast ok but adequate. Pleasant sitting outside but the Pidgeons are annoying and do make a mess all over the chairs. Reception staff were brilliant!! Charming, funny, helpful and made my mums birthday. They upgraded her room free of charge and put an ice bucket with glasses, Bellini and prosecco in her room which was a lovely touch. They rang to confirm restaurants for us and were just great! Stay here again? Yes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every respect”
Reviews.Author: billmcmurtrie
Reviews.Content: Ideal situation - close to railway station and waterbus piers. So close to the main transport points, it was amazing to find such a quiet gem (apart from the adjacent church's morning and evening bells). Accommodation - comfortable, though the room's wallpaper (dark red) should have been brighter. The staff were welcoming, friendly, and very helpful, and the breakfast room was right beside the door out to the garden. Eating the dayâ€™s first meal in a secluded garden was the perfect way to start a day of exploring Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Kicatze
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room. room was good but bathroom very basic, no proper shower and no shower curtain. Breakfast was very basic for the room price and could have had better selection. the bells from the church next doorn will wake you up early unless you are a heavy sleeper. The location was very good being 100m from the train station and 200m from the bus station but very quiet (except for morning church bells) Venice is very expensive !

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel -- hot. also -- bells.”
Reviews.Author: charmed3687
Reviews.Content: Starting off with the pros: Hotel Abbazia is very conveniently located -- just a few steps away from the train station, but on a side street that makes it feel much quieter and more isolated (a definite plus in mobbed Venice!) The staff were always extremely courteous and friendly, and their policy of letting you leave your bags post-check out (they have a nice "luggage room") is great. We actually sort of hung out in the lobby before catching our night train out of the city even though we'd officially checked out hours earlier, and no one gave us a hard time about it. The room itself was very cute, nice bathroom. The included breakfast has all the essentials and there's a great garden. Plus, free wifi can't be beat! A few cons, however: as we were warned about, the churchbells (at around 7:15 and 8:15 am) are amazingly annoying, and last longer than you'd think! At least a few minutes each of nonstop ringing. The other big issue we (and many other guests at the time) had was with air conditioning -- although our room (and all rooms, I imagine) have individual A/C units, it was basically glorified wall art that emitted vague puffs of cool air. If you were standing directly under it and stayed very very still you could feel the temperature drop a few degrees, but that was about it. While we were in Venice temps were in the 80s and it was very humid and unfortunately that made it pretty difficult to sleep at night. Even with the window open our room stayed quite stagnant.
