If A/C is a big priority I would probably not book Hotel Abbazia, especially if you're travelling in the hot summer months. However, overall it was quite a pleasant stay, made even better by the very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anni099
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, down a side road so away from the noise of the main drag. Staff helpful and knowlegable. Rooms clean and comfortable although basic. Garden a wonderful addition and great place to relax with a glass of wine. Bells do ring - but not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MargGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Once you walk in the door , you feel the calm & peace in this one time monastery. Staff so welcoming and friendly . The garden area was an oasis to come back to and recharge before heading out into those magical streets. Buffet Breakfast excellent . Would Definately return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel, the service and location. Can' be beat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Armstronglc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within walking distance to the train station & the Ferrovia Water Buses (Ferry). Easy to get everywhere. The breakfast is generous & long (7-10AM). The rooms are nice, showers & bath rooms were the best of all the hotels we stayed at in Rome & Florence. Rooms were cool, the Hotel was very nice and updated. The front staff (especially Mateo) greeted us when coming,going & very easily provided information, guidance & arranged tickets to events our family wanted promptly. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Delightedtourist
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia is a great place to stay in Venice. We arrived by train and we were at the hotel in less than 5 minutes. I was a little worried about staying so close to a train station but the area is beautiful and the main entrance to Venice. We were able to check in immediately upon arrival at lunchtime. The rooms are exactly as shown in the photos. The bathrooms are very clean, modern and provide lots of soft towels. The bedspreads are beginning to wear and could be replaced. As in all hotels in Italy, the pillows are hard. Each room is equipped with a bar fridge. Our room opened into the courtyard which was beautiful and lush. There is an area to sit and enjoy a park-like setting which is rare in Venice. The breakfast was one of the best we had at any hotel as we traveled around Italy. There is lots of variety - fresh fruits, meats, eggs, toast and pastries, etc.... We enjoyed sitting in the common area in the evening after dinner where there was bar service. We would definitely stay there again despite the very high price as it was so convenient to get to anywhere in Venice and the train station. The area had lots of shops, street vendors and we felt very safe walking anywhere in the evening. There are many restaurants- none of the ones we tried were terrific. However, the pastry shops are great as well as the gelato!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: MTMama1960
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close the train station, only about a 5 min. walk. It's down an alley next to the church. It appears to be a renovated monastery or convent connected to the local church. It's beautiful inside. The main room is huge with lots of comfy chairs, an elevated pulpit and a bar. No elevators, but the staff brings your luggage up to your room. Each of us had beautiful rooms with comfy beds, windows and a good size bathroom for Europe's standards. The courtyard was cool and breezy with three different sitting areas. The church bells start ringing about 7:15 in the morning but they weren't that loud and kinda nice. The staff at the front desk were great! The guys were full of suggestions and recommendations. They helped us with all of our concerns regarding buses and taxis and the airport. If we make it back to Venice, we'll definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Lainee_L
Reviews.Content: Initially I found it really hard to find a decent hotel in Venice at a reasonable price with good reviews on tripavisor as well. The reviews for this hotel were good across the board and I was pleasantly surprised that the hotel was as described in the reviews. I was due to arrive late at night and had contacted the hotel before travelling to find out the best way to get there especially as I was travelling on my own. The hotel swiftly replied with details of public transport. The hotel is only a five minute walk from Piazzale Roma, the bus terminal that you arrive from if you get the airport buses. The room was a decent size, and both the bedroom and bathroom were very clean. The breakfast was adequate and the free wifi in the hotel was a bonus. The staff were polite. Once you get to know the main reference points in Venice - Piazzale Roma, the Rialto and Saint Mark's square, you really don't need a map!! Just walk and you get to all three places at some point and find a lot of interesting sights, cafes, restaurants etc on the way. I would also recommend a 'Skip the Line' tour if you are intending to visit the Basilica as the queues are often ridiculous. The Doge's Palace and the Peggy Guggenheim Collection are also well worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Lucy16413
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia is located within easy walking distance from the train station in a quiet street. We were 2 women traveling, one of whom could not carry her big luggage, even though it was on wheels. Her assistant could not handle all the luggage at once, so it was important to find a good hotel near the train station and on the same side of the canal, as the bridges are very steep. Hotel Abbazia was clean, comfortable and served a nice breakfast. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. The only negative was that they had no lift. However, the staff handled our luggage so it was not a problem. It was a joy to stay there. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Travelers from Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prosier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two teenagers stayed in a quad room, which was roomy and comfortable; it had an excellent bathroom. But the hotel is more than the room -- it has a very comfortable courtyard for reading or eating the excellent buffet breakfast, which is included. The staff is outstanding; they recommended several very good restaurants and provided other essential information. That's their job, of course, but they are very charming. It is right near the train station and grand canal yet very quiet. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabby”
Reviews.Author: Marsha213141
Reviews.Content: Good location close to the railway and bus stations, Vaporetto stop adjacent to the hotel. Multi-lingual Reception staff extremely friendly and helpful . Room fully air -conditioned with large en-suite bathroom with walk in shower. Really loved the quirky features and breakfast in the walled garden was delightful. Absolutely perfect for our stay !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and great value”
Reviews.Author: primerib74
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for three nights. Had a room overlooking the courtyear and it was charming. Would get our breakfast and eat it in the courtyard. The staff at the front desk is outstandiing. Very friendly and helpbul. This is located very close to the train station but far enough away from the noise. Down a side street with very little traffic This hotel is a great value in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for venice”
Reviews.Author: Markandrew_7
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. We prefered all the restaurants in the area around Santa Croce than San Marco. The hotel gave us some excellent recommendations for restaurants. The hotel is a bit of walk from San Marco but it is really not an issue as the best thing about Venice is to walk around through all the thousands of little streets and therefore the walk is all part of the experience. I would stay away from the ferry in Venice, it was terribly crowed and overrated experience. The hotel has an excellent outside area and a nice breakfast as well. I would definately recommend this hotel. As a side point, I never done this before but I feel that this is warranted. I noticed a review by someone else while I was at the hotel who mentioned that they could not sleep because of a smoke detector that had a red flashing light. Everyone is entitled to their own opinion and I cannot comment on the specific room but after seeing this review I had a look in our room and we also had a smoke detector and it also flashed red but this light is so minute and inconsequential that I have to wonder about anyone who makes a comment like this and caution people about reviews of this nature. If you cannot sleep because of that light it is probably not the light that is keeping them awake it is because they did not have their eyes closed. I also do not think that birds in a garden can be seen as the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “very nice/perfect location”
Reviews.Author: princess_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Letâ€™s just start that Abbazia happens to be the most expensive place Iâ€™ve ever stayed in and it is only a 3-star (but thatâ€™s Venice for you). Weâ€™ve picked this hotel for location and good reviews, since we wanted to enjoy our stay, rather than suffer through it. The location is really perfect; very close to train station/vaporetto stops yet it was secluded enough from the tourist noises. The room was spacious enough with no view (back of the monastery), but we liked the quietness and clean air (I imagine the rooms that face the pretty courtyard must get some tobacco smoke). There is AC/heater unit, so the room is comfortable during the afternoon heat. In addition to two beds w/nightstands the room had a big armoire, a desk and two chairs (more than we used to). But the best part was the minibar (so we shopped at the local grocery store a lot â€“ big one is at Roma station). There is a small TV. The DÃ©cor is nothing fancy, but all that damask on walls makes one feel grounded to old Italy (I prefer that than a Florida hotel next door, itâ€™s not Miami â€“ it is Venice!) The bathroom is spacious too, clean and tasteful. However, I would advise for the hotel to add a shower curtain and a higher hook for the shower head. The breakfast is fabulous with great selection, but get there earlier for a better seat. No elevator, but we did not mind. The bells at 7:15 are actually a good alarm clock. One disappointment was that there is no computer access, only wireless internet, since previous reviews indicated that front desk would loan a computer (I do not know what happened, but we had to find an internet cafe about 15 min walk)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in our Italy trip”
Reviews.Author: Happycamper888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best one in our italy trip. Great location(one block from train station), very clean room, good breakfast, free Wifi, very friendly & helpful front desk. Only downside is church bell wake you up in the morning. But you need to get up anyway so we don't mind.

Reviews.Title: “'open my heart and you will see graved inside of it - Venice'”
Reviews.Author: paulytheyounger
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel. The staff are friendly and warm, the breakfasts are delicious. Fantastic location, but incredibly quiet (apart from the bell ringing at 715 and 815am!) The garden is a perfect location for relaxing throughout the day. Overall - highly recommended. I would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Great beginning & end to each day”
Reviews.Author: Judau
Reviews.Content: Great location - about 10 min easy walk from bus station & round the corner from train station and waterbus stations (most lines one needs). Staff are terrific - very friendly & helpful. Room spacy enough, large comfy bed. No bath unfortunately, only shower. Missed not having equipment for making coffee/tea. Lobby is comfy with reasonably priced coffee Maybe a bit expensive. Lovely to start the day with breakfast in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Forget breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Alfkonan
Reviews.Content: Situated just outside the train station, there is plenty of husle and bustle at your doorstep. However, the breakfast buffett leaves much to be desired. The positive point the hotel's buffet has is the fresh banana and apples. The coffee and rest is pretty grim. Rooms pretty clean, although no shower curtain is provided. Beds are hard, so adjust or check out.

Reviews.Title: “great room room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mcabouli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet street one block from the railroad station, which is convenient though not the most glamorous. There is a lovely garden where you can have breakfast, a drink, or just sit around. The staff, particularly Mirko, are all very helpful and provide good advice. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “A great place...highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BillMonas
Reviews.Content: Easy walking from the station. Easy access to water taxis and gondolas. Lots of eating places nearby....a bit cheaper if you dont choose a canal view...and the food is just as good. Staff at the hotel were excellent with our checking in/out, provided info on eating places and means of transport and general advice. Breakfast was great ( as in plentiful ) but not much variety ...still this was a common feature with all our stays at other places in Italy. Rooms were very well laid out ...showers a bit small ...but then again I am not a 140 kg giant , so I fitted ok.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: mjspiegel
Reviews.Content: What can I say from the very moment you arrive, you are greet by the nicest hotel staff I have ever encountered. The hotel is beautiful, with a beautiful garden, breakfaxt was a wonderful way to start the day fresh baked pastries that were delicious. Thr hotel was very close to everything the waterbuses are right out front. Venice was beautiful & I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aljinnie
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the train station and buses to the airport. The location is certainly the strongest point for this hotel as it is extremely easy to get to the train station with bags. The hotel is 3 stars but unfortunately it was the worst 3 stars hotel I have ever stayed in, even though it is the most expensive. The room had a musty, damp smell as did the bathroom. They try to overcome this by using a plug in airfreshener which I personally think just makes things worse. The furniture in the room is very old and needs changing/repairing. The mirror was cracked, the shower leaked and the wooden furniture was chipped in several places. Some of the ceramic tiles in the bathroom were cracked as well. The bed cover had an unpleasant stain. The bar area was beautfully decorated and the rooms probably were beautiful when the furniture was newer. We did not get a very good night's sleep as when I switched off the light the smoke alarm was flashing red lights in my face (batteries need changing?). Also, if you are a night owl, be prepared for the loud church bells to continuously disturb your slumber starting from around 7am. Breakfast offered a very poor selection. No hot food (except for warm boiled eggs) and no fresh italian cheeses. You are in luck, however if you like burnt croissants, cold meats and dry cake. The orange juice was synthetic and sickly sweet and the fruit was from a tin swimming in its sugary syrup. We thought about sitting outside in the Garden area but quickly changed our minds when we saw that the chairs were covered in pigeon droppings! Breakfast waiters are few and therefore slow to clean up tables. WIFI was OK but a chore to use as you had to get a new ticket every day with a new password and the signal was weak in my room. Overall, it wasn't quite the experience I expected after reading the reviews but I have never stayed in Venice before so I cannot compare it to others in the area but certainly the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BLT53
Reviews.Content: Even though prices are slightly on the higher end compared with other 3 star hotels in Venice, this is really bang for the buck. At first it is close to the railway and bus station, so that you easily can reach the hotel without any boat trip - especially useful when arriving lately. Else the location within the restored remains of an old carmelite monestary speaks for itself.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abbazia - great location with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: noshirm
Reviews.Content: On holiday with family in Venice early May'11. Found this little gem of a hotel online thru TripAdvisor. Great location - just next to the Station, but in a quiet alley. So no trekking with suitcases over bridges, no paying extra for luggage on the Vaporettis (water taxis). In your hotel room 3-5 minutes after the train pulls into Venice - what could be better! Fabio at Reception was magnificent - from giving directions to the hotel, to alloting us the rooms we wanted, to recomending restaurants that were superb. Thanks, Fabio. This hotel was earlier an Abbey, so quite an experience to stay. Lovely central coutyard with sit-out. Great breakfasts daily. Free internet. Morning church bells and the aroma of freshly-baked cakes & cookies for breakfast were the best morning alarm. Our double room on the ground floor was VERY small but our triple room was nice and airy. Some of the rooms on the first and second floors are more spacious. No lifts and no airconditioning till summer, but the outside temperatures cooled the room adequately. Just outside the hotel lane is the main Vaporetti station for the boats to all the attractions, San Marco, Rialto Bridge, etc. Day-pass is best option to take. Lots of lovely bars and restaurants all around, and a beautiful church to see just next door. This was the ideal location and if ever we are in Venice again, it will be at Hotel Abbazia only!

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hastingstraveler
Reviews.Content: Central, comfortable, spacious, affordable3* hotel, converted from a convent. Lots of stairs and no lift so go for 1st or 2nd floor rooms. Easy to get to from bus station with bags! Handy for main water bus routes and station. Good to have a garden. Good size bedroom and bathroom(shower) Help yourself from a not very exciting "continental" breakfast choice but good coffee from machine. Friendly and helpful multi-lingual staff. Very popular hotel, must book well in advance. French tourists seem to favour this hotel when we were there. A bit of updating would make this a really good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...as always!”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler14
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Abbazia every time I have visited Venice for the past 5 years and it is always a wonderful experience. The location is great...the staff is wonderful...and the value is excellent. I will return again next year....Bravo Abbazia!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: decca_11
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent, comfortable hotel with good rooms and a lovely garden. It was nice to have a choice of bath or shower, but the best thing about the hotel was the excellent,helpful staff who seemed genuinely interested in making our stay a good one

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super staff”
Reviews.Author: tomotten
Reviews.Content: A beautiful old abby is the setting.The location couldn't be better.Right next to the train station,water taxis and bus terminal.The free breakfast was more than adequate with meats, cheese, rolls,cereal,yogurt,juices and coffees. An outdoor garden with seating and an indoor study with bar gives the visitor plenty of room to relax. We stayed in a junior suite which was twice the size of our hotel on the canal.But best of all was the pleasant and helpful staff. Mirko and Matthew we very helpful in getting us around and planing our sight seeing,including a trip to "THE" Murano glass factory.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful with advice on getting around.”
Reviews.Author: Clementine5
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, close to train station but no noise heard. Vaporetta stops very close. Room small but comfortable. Great shower. Interesting interior - used to be an abbey and the pulpit is still in place on a wall in the lounge. Good restaurants nearby. Good advice about walking to places rather than using the water bus and recommendations for eating places we would not otherwise have found. Only irritating thing was pigeons in the garden - breakfast with a pigeon in your muesli is not fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sissy2007l
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is VERY close to the train station and vaporetto.The hotel staff are very kind and willing to help.Rms are nice I was on second floor,however there is no lift. Courtyard is also very nice.Breakfast is enough to get you started for the day.If you come in on the train this is the place to be,however if you want to be in the hub of things this is not the place. also if you are going on a cruise this is a great place to stay,it's very close to pizza roma where you take the people mover for 1 euro and your there.Will stay here again if I go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “they insisted to keep the Air Conditioning closed”
Reviews.Author: uriroz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beutiful. Great inner garden for breakfasts, nice rooms, very clean bathrooms (even had a Jacuzzi). HOWEVER, we hardly slept at night, since they refused to open the air conditioning and the room was hot. We opened the windows, but the street was very noisy, even at 04:00 AM due to the central location. Bottom line: A venecian hotel must have A/C, even in May. If they are too cheap and keep the A/C close - skip the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cute”
Reviews.Author: becky_boo66
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very kind and helpful. Our room was large but a little sparse. The garden is really nice in the courtyard. The location is perfect, next door to the station. There are no stairs to the hotel but quite a few in the hotel. restaurants right outside the door. The only problem would be for people who are not early risers, the church bells go early (about 7am) are LOUD and go on for a while (a few minutes). We used it as an alarm, which was fine for us but some may not like it. The breakfast was a little adverage but no un-eatable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Venice”
Reviews.Author: lystra
Reviews.Content: Even though we only stayed two days, the hotel was charming and just a few steps from the train station. Hotel staff were also charming, funny and helpful with all our questions. Staff suggested what we should do within our short stay and arranged airport transportation for us. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Not on the canal but just a skip away. Thanks Abbazia

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent Location- Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: trippeck
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Abbazia in late March with our teenage children. The location couldn't be better....so near to the train station and the bus station. We also loved the fact that we were away from the crowds around St. Marks Square (nice place to visit, but I wouldn't want to live there :) The hotel provided a good breakfast and there were some great restaurants in the area. "La Zucca" was our favorite but there was another that the hotel suggested (right across and down from the hotel towards the canal...can't remember the name) that was also very good. We also loved the pizza at "Antico Forno" near the Rialto Bridge. The staff at Abbazia are fantastic...very friendly and very helpful. The rooms are more than adequate and very clean. We had a family room that didn't have a stand-up shower and that was probably the only minor negative I can think of (a little tough for my 6' 4" son to cram into the tub) PS Loved waking up to the church bells....no alarm needed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for what you really need.”
Reviews.Author: pegasvs
Reviews.Content: The location is amazingly convenient. Just 3min walk from the bus station or 1min walk from the train station and less than a 100m from the Canal Grande. I liked the fact that it's at the start of the city so that you begin your Venice experience slowly. I recommend walking to the San Marco Piazza on your first time (make sure you wear comfortable shoes). Then you exit the alley and face the magnificent San Marco Piazza and trust me, you will be pleasantly shocked. What an experience!!! :)) The Abbazia rooms are decent and very clean. Breakfast is poor but adequate and wi-fi is free. The garden is very peaceful and offers some very relaxing moments. I was worried about noises from the train station next door but you can't hear a thing so no problem there. The guys at the reception are amazing. Very friendly and very helpful :)) What you want from a hotel in Venice is a decent place to sleep, have a relaxing bath and some breakfast in the morning. From then on you will be spending all your time in town anyway so fo me the Abbazia Hotel was an excellent choice and I will go back for sure. Price is not cheap, but nothing is cheap in Venice anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen16
Reviews.Content: Good quiet location, fabulous lounge area, good breakfast and helpful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveller83
Reviews.Content: Located a short walk from the train station, this hotel was easy to find upon our arrival in Venice. The rooms were spacious, and the staff very friendly at this hotel. They were able to provide assistance with finding local attractions and were happy to help us. Free internet access and computers in the lobby, plus a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: egyptitaly
Reviews.Content: To say i was happy with Hotel Abbazia is an understatement. I travelled in a large group and we previously had been to egypt where unfortunately I got terrible gastroenderitis before arriving in Venice. Despite how sick I felt, the reception was absolutely beautiful decked out with an enormous christmas tree and the rooms felt like absolute luxury after coming from Egypt. Unfortunately I was admitted to hospital for the next 9 days, however I was released on night pass for 5 nights and coming home to Hotel Abbazia was an immense relief. The staff were amazing, especially the manager Alvise, who took time out to constanly make sure i was feeling ok, and they had no quarrels at all with dealing with the insurance company as my mother and I had to stay an extra 7 nights whilst the rest of the group moved on. As we were unsure on when i would be able to check out, they were completely understanding and told us we could check out at anytime we liked, or stay another night without hassle. I wasn't able to try the breakfast until I checked out of hospital and even though the breakfast bar closed at 11am and we got to the hotel after 12, they re-opened it just for us which was absolutely delightful. The free use of laptops were also great for contacting back home, and the outside courtyard was just beautiful, especially covered in snow. The location, staff, rooms, and service could not have been better and I would recommened Hotel Abbazia to anyone! I'm desperate to return to Venice just to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen1819
Reviews.Content: Before deciding on staying at the Hotel Abbazia, I sent several e-mails to the hotel asking questions and what was the best way to arrive from the airport. All my e-mails were answered quickly and thoroughly by the manager, Alvise. I loved this hotel! If I return to Venice I will definitely stay here again. Arrival at Marco Polo airport - purchase a ticket on the ATVO airport bus for 3 Euro. The bus will leave you off at Piazzale Roma - the main bus terminus. Then it is just a short walk across the bridge over the Grand Canal, past the train station, and make a left down a narrow passageway, and the hotel is on the left. Don't drag a lot of luggage with you anywhere in Venice. You really don't need that much "stuff." The hotel is a former monastery. I had a single room which was quite roomy. The church bells were a great way to start the day. Several previous reviews complained about the church bells. You are in Italy - you are going to hear church bells. Besides, do you really want to sleep in while in Venice? Nice bathroom with fluffy white towels that were changed daily. Plenty of hot water. The room and the bathroom were extremely clean. Breakfast - magnificent! Lots of meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, breads. And, oh my goodness - the pastries! Several times I was able to have one of the chocolate croissants that just got out of the oven. I am still dreaming about the pastries. The front desk staff was professional, extremely helpful and full of good advice and information. Their professionalism was greatly appreciated. There are 2 laptops to use to check your e-mail, etc. (No printer.) Because I am a budget traveler, I filled up at breakfast and was good to go for most of the day. The front desk recommended a restaurant called BREK. This restaurant is cafeteria style and the food was very good. Go out to the main street, make a left, and then it is just a short walk and the restaurant is on the left. The front part of the restaurant has sandwiches and drinks. Go a little further back and you will find hot meals, salads, a good wine selection and desserts. I was able to purchase a bowl of spaghetti, a huge salad and a small bottle of white wine for 11.40 Euro. The food was excellent. If you are going to use the vaporetto, check into buying a ticket for several days. It is much cheaper than 1 single ticket. I took the vaporetto to Murano and spent a short time there. But the real treat is to take the vaporetto to Burano. Brightly colored houses - pinks, yellows, blues, greens, etc. - with laundry hanging from the windows. You cannot take a bad photo on Burano. And don't forget to have gelato. Plenty of gelato places within a short distance of the hotel. You will do plenty of walking to burn off those calories. In closing, I would like to thank the staff of the Hotel Abbazia for making my first trip to Venice a dream. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, abundant breakfast spread”
Reviews.Author: GramyTnUSA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Abbazia for 2 nights. We were greeted warmly and offered breakfast immediately and hints about sights to see while we waited for our room. All the front desk staff we met were helpful and polite and spoke English well enough. The room was not cramped, the shower had doors but was small. The facility seemed very clean. We flew into Marco Polo airport, took the ATVO bus for 3 euro each to Piazzale Roma, walked less than 5 minutes to the hotel. From Venice we took the train to Rome, and the train station is between the hotel and the Piazzale Roma, about 2 minutes walk. The location could not have been better, close to the most important places for us, yet down an alley which helped the room and hotel seem quiet. There is a lovely courtyard where you may eat or sit and relax, it was too chilly in early March to sit there very long. Our favorite part about Hotel Abbazia was the amount of options at breakfast. Not just the typical hard rolls and croissants, but meat, cheese, and bread, boiled eggs, cakes and fruit tortes, yogurt and cereal, cream cheese and Nutella, jam, and whole fruits. The only areas I might have disliked are the same for most European hotels, so I really have only positive reviews for this hotel. I'd stay there again without even shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, brilliant location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MistHammer
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for 3 days and used the very good reviews of this hotel on trip advisor to select the hotel. We were not dissappointed. Very handy for the bus from the airport. Hotel was a very nicely decorated and rooms a good size, ours overlooked the beautiful courtyard. Breakfast was very good and plenty to choose from. I would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers to venice.

Reviews.Title: “Superfriendly, nice bar, good location”
Reviews.Author: LISE54
Reviews.Content: One of the best 3 star hotels that I have stayed in, in Venice. Perfect location, very friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast. Rooms were clean and bathroom nice and quite spaceous. I would definately stay here again. Nice and inexpensive bar in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: virenb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights on 24th and 25th Feb 2011. The hotel is ideally located just minutes away from the Santa Lucia Train Station and Ferrovia Water Taxi Station. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and cooperative and never showed any disappointment with our requests. The hotel has a very good spacious sitting area for guests. The room was of pretty decent size - I had actually expected that it would be very small but it was very spacious. We were able to accomodate our three suitcases easily. The breakfast served was pretty much standard but decent. Though they did not serve omelettes, baked beans or hashbrownies. Maybe I was expecting too much. The staff guided us on the places of tourist interest and how to take the water taxi that is the means of transport in Venice. Overall our stay was very comfortable and I would certainnly stay at this hotel again if I visit Venice in future. I also strongly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have good value for money and does not want to splurge money on five star amenities which they may or may not use. Thanks to Abazzzia hotel for making our stay comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter0749
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abazzia was a great location at a competitive price for exploring Venice. My wife and I spent 4 nights there and could not fault the service. Check in was efficient and all the front desk staff were helpful and showed a real interest. Rooms were very good (for a renovated building) as were the facilities. Breakfast was more than adequate if a little shambolic in comparison to the rest of the service, but in a amusing, endearing way. Location is excellent for for arrival/departure by bus or train and there is a vaporetto stop 100m away taking you anywhere in a Venice. Happily recommend to anyone looking for a quality stay in Venice without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm in Venice”
Reviews.Author: worldisabook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Hotel Abbazia based on wonderful reviews from different sources, its location and a good price for Venice. This old monastery is very close to Piazalle Roma(bus station), the Sta. Lucia train station and Lista Di Spagna that has an abundance of shops and restaurants. We took the bus from the airport into Piazalle Roma. The rain was pouring hard and we were so glad we didnâ€™t have to walk very far to get to the hotel. We crossed the Ponte di Calatrava bridge (modern-looking glass bridge), passed the train station and made a left on a little alley street â€“ all in about 5 minutes. We were leaving Venice a few days later on a very early the train to Rome and this was an ideal location. The vaporetti station was a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. We also walked from St. Markâ€™s Square to the hotel one night which took about 45 minutes with some window shopping and stopping at a grocery store. The hotel is very rustic with a lot of old world charm. The standard room we had was quite small with a window looking out into their garden and the church. The church bells were our alarm clock in the morning and didnâ€™t bother us. After all, itâ€™s not every day you get to wake up to church bells while sleeping in an old monastery in Venice. The room was very simple with a desk and a closet for hanging things. There really was not enough room to for storage and it was a bit challenging with only two carry-ons. The bathroom was pretty big with terra cotta colored tiles everywhere and a decent size bath tub. The room and bathroom were kept clean. Free-wifi was available but they also had two laptops we were able to borrow provided you stayed in the lounge. There were plenty of comfortable couches for lounging and a bar in the lounge/sitting area (even had a raised pulpit). The staff we encountered was all friendly and welcoming and helpful with suggestions. They even made sure we were escorted to our rooms and helped us with luggage upon check-in. The complimentary breakfast was great with plenty of Italian pastries, cereal and fruit. My husband was happy they actually had eggs and meats. Their breakfast room was also pretty spacious and accommodated a lot of people. If you want to be in the center of Venice, this may not be for you. But, if you want a great value near the transportation hubs while in transit through Venice, then this hotel will fulfill your needs. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much closer to the train station”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at this hotel in anticipation of an early train. I did no research just picked the hotel on the map I had that was the closest to the train station. It's still the distance of a couple of blocks or so. Convenient to both the train station and the water bus stop. The staff was nice. It's bigger on the inside then it appears from the outside. Used to be an old abbey so it's a pretty interesting space. The room was surprisingly big for Europe. High ceilings with exposed rafters, murano glass light, tasteful simple furniture, big windows with no view, artwork was pretty cool, mini bar fridge with very limited drinks, dated linens but they were clean, small flat screen tellie. The room was relatively quiet but I did hear the people walking upstairs. The air freshener diffuser was a bit strong but smelt nice. The bathroom was good sized. Toiletries were good. Shower was Italian style: a tub with a spray nozzle but no shower curtain. The breakfast was very good and they had someone constantly cleaning and restocking. Cute outdoor patio area that I bet is nice when it's not winter. Not a bad deal at all for Venice and right by transportation.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with friendly staff. Would definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewNg10
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. It's conveniently located and the staff are really warm and friendly. Would definitely stay there again when we are in Venice!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: justretired_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just like the pictures and close to bus and train station. good breakfast. Small rooms but adequate (no tea making facilitie) ate at Brek in the eveningswhich is a couple of doors away .good solid cafe food good prices. Walked most of the city felt very safe.Great atmosphere in the student area for a drink in the evening Had a wonderful time Great time of year to visit this place, warming your hands on mulled wine by the grand canal

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 06D123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of January. The hotel had been recommended by a friend who stayed there last year. Great recommendation which I'd pass on to anyone. The hotel is located up a small street, 100 metres from the Grand Canal - at the Ponte degli Scalzi. Another 50 metres or so brings you to the main Railway Station, and a couple of hundred more to the Piazzale roma bus terminus (where the Airport bus arrives). Most of the water buses stop near the Ponte. The hotel is a former convent, which has been extensively refurbished recently. Just one minor drawback - there is no lift, so if you have mobility problems, ask for a ground floor room. There is a nice garden, which would be lovely in warmer weather. The staff are very friendly. Good buffet breakfast in the morning - best I've had in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Susie91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the railway station and a vaparetto stop but manages to retain a calm and quiet atmosphere. The staff is very friendly and helpful with useful advice and recommendations for dinner locations. The rooms are comfortable and the only complaint we could find was that there was no kettle in the rooms for making late night/early morning cups of tea/coffee. We got back late one night, after attending an opera, and the bar was closed but a very helpful member of staff provided us with a tray of hot water. cups and tea bags to help us warm up. The breakfast is excellent with a good choice of fruit, cereal, pastries and cheese/ham. I would certainly return to this hotel for future stays in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic fantastic”
Reviews.Author: holiday1017
Reviews.Content: fantastic fantastic stayed for 2 days beautiful hotel and staff are great ,Mateo is one of the nicest members of staff in a hotel you can meet would def stay again planning to book for july . angelina deb steven rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JAMPerth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's stay at the Abbazia with our 16yr old daughter. Reviews from other travellers on tripadvisor had helped us make our choice and we were not disappointed in any way. The location of the hotel whilst without views and down a tiny calle is more than compensated for by it's proximity to the train station. finding our way back "home" and to the train for a day trip to Cortina were a breeze. Our room was spotless and perfect in size for the three of us. The spacious, warm, comfortable lounge was welcoming to return to and a place to chat with other guests. Breakfast was generous and varied and staff were keen to offer advice and help with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Rico-N-Debbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is EXCELLENT!! Found it on Tripadvisor and after reading the reviews decided to stay here, and I'm so glad we did. The staff were so friendly, welcoming and helpful, the hotel was spotless and the rooms comfy and clean. The breakfast was fantastic, plenty to chose from...cereal, toast, croissants, yoghurt and fresh fruit. The hotel itself was so easy to find, being only five minutes walk from the Piazza Roma bus station. We would like to return to Venice soon and I will definetely be returning to the Hotel Abbazia, I wouldn't need to look at any other hotels as I really enjoyed my short break here!! Besides we would like to go back and see Matteo...funny guy!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: jareynolds
Reviews.Content: If travelling to Venice by train then the location of Hotel Abbazia could not be closer with a mere 5 minutes walk from the station. But unlike most station areas this is as good as the heart of Venice. A beautiful old building that once was an Abbey and still retains the 'quiet aura' with buckets of charm and style. This can also be said of the wonderful staff [especially Merko] who all speak excellent english and have a good sense of humour to lift the mood of any weary traveller. The food range at breakfast was excellent apart from cold coffee from a machine. In January, this was the only meal served at the hotel but it gives the opportunity to try any of the many hundreds of restaurants nearby. Beware of the ones adjacent to the Grand Canal which are a bit of a rip off. Expensive, minimum of half bottles of wine and with added cover change even in a quiet season. Anyone with a love of old towns full of history will not be bothered by the daily chime of nearby bells in the morning. It's all part of the character and something more to remember it by. The water bus is 2 minutes walk and costs 6.50 euros to travel the whole length of the canal to San Marco. It is only a half hour walk back via the Rialto Bridge and without getting lost. Don't use the water taxis unless you have won the lottery. Will definitely stay at Hotel Abbazia every time we visit Venice. Angie & Jim Reynolds, Brentwood, Essex, England

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Jade12Craig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November as a surprise birthday present and I loved it. We stayed in a superior room; my boyfriend chose this room because it says on the website that it has more space and fine furnishing. It didnâ€™t really have as much space as you would think a superior room would have considering we paid more than a standard room, but it was still lovely. The only fault was that there wasnâ€™t anywhere to do my makeup, there was a dressing table but no mirror, so I had to sit on the floor and do it in front of a mirror. My boyfriend told me one of the reasons he booked the superior room was so I had a dressing table as seen in the pictures. But it was still lovely. There was plenty to choose from at breakfast, such as fruit, toast, croissants, cereal, rolls with cheese and ham, cakes, coffee machine ect. In the evening we went to the bar and had drinks before we went out, the barman was really friendly and very generous with the drinks, and he didnâ€™t even charge me for my baileys. Drinks by the bar were cheaper than I thought it would be. The bar area had sofas and tables and it was always busy in there. We often came back from our meal and had drinks in this area, although the bar shuts quite early, think it was 11pm. There werenâ€™t many English guests in this hotel which I liked because it felt like we werenâ€™t in a tourist hotel. The guys at reception was really helpful aswel, they recommended what we should do whilst at Venice and showed us a map and pointed out where we should go. The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk from the train station and ideal location. Had a great stay and this hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning intro to Venice”
Reviews.Author: joybAuckland
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, and very quaint hotel, quiet and tucked away of the main throughfare.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice to stay in Abbazia.”
Reviews.Author: kyllikkielina
Reviews.Content: The staff was kind and very helpful which is very important. Then people are ready to ignore smaller things like lack of cleaning work in the room... Some of the rooms were quite small - we were lucky to have a bigger one. Breakfast could be better organized: now people who wanted to get granola (muesli) had to stay in the same line with those who wanted to get their coffee. The corner is very narrow and tight. Anyway I'd recommend this place very much.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest, most helpful people we met in Italy were right here.”
Reviews.Author: Breitzman
Reviews.Content: We kicked off a self planned tour of Italy in Venice. This was our first big trip, and the first time either of us had been outside of America. Not knowing what to expect (or how well we could communicate), the friendly staff at Abbazia was just what we needed. They were incredibly helpful and made sure we got our feet under us and enjoyed our time. The room was simple and elegant, and had everything we needed. A view of the outdoor garden was splendid. The included breakfast was delicious and filling, which helped save some money on munching when out and about. The hotel offers to arrange private shuttle to Murano and tour of one of the glass making facilities. Taking them up on the offer is highly recommended. The only drawback (wasn't one for us, but) could be not being more centrally located. If you're only visiting Venice, that would be a mild concern. We were moving on, so the hotel's location close to the train station and car access was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - good value”
Reviews.Author: EllenChr
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 night i Venice celebrating new year, and was very pleased with this hotel. The location is fantastic - less than 10 min by foot from the bus teminal and just one bridge to cross. Our room was nice, with fridge and safe. There were two english speaking news channels on the TV. The bathroom was spacious, but the shower was a bit cramped and the water pressure low - but nothing serious. The church bells woke us up in the morning, but as we had read this in other reviews we were metally prepared and went back to sleep again. The breakfast room was charming, and they had a lot to choos from. The staff was friendly, and our daughter loved that she could borrow a laptop in the reseption an log on to the internet. For new year we got Christmas cake in our room as a complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kfizzo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, literally 5 min walk from the train station and grand canal so close aswell. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I have also stayed at Abbazia DeLuxe, and I think they have spent more money on doing up Abbazia DeLuxe rather than this hotel. But this hotel is much bigger, so you can understand why this has not yet been modernised. The breakfast at this hotel was much better than their sister hotel. A lot more variety. Staff are fantastic, they are always so happy and always greet you. This creates a really nice feel for the hotel. Also, the church bells did wake us up in the morning at 7.15am and again at 8am, but we were able to get straight back to sleep. I would recommend this hotel, but if available, I would stay at Abbazia DeLuxe instead.

Reviews.Title: “So easy to find from train - LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: tortugas2x
Reviews.Content: My primary consideration for choosing this hotel was that it seemed easy to find from the train, and it was! It was literally a 5 minute walk tops. But I got SO much more! It's an adorable place, our rooms were immaculate and the bathrooms were a nice size and well appointed. And the service was top notch. The gentleman who checked us in escorted us to our rooms, despite the fact that we only had small overnight bags. They also gave me a couple post card stamps! Breakfast was tasty and a nice variety. If you stay in cold weather like we did, look for the stand just down the main street from the hotel. It's on the left. They sell gelato, but also hot mulled wine to go (vino caldo). BEST 2E I spent on my trip!! OH and YES the church bells will wake you in the morning, so get out of bed and explore Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hquilter
Reviews.Content: Totally recommend this place. Rooms are fine, super quiet for sleeping, extensive breakfast and such nice and accommodating hotel staff. They lent my family boots when it rained! Jacobo made us Venetian cocktails in the evening. And although our train didn't leave until the evening and we checked out in the morning, we used their boots all day and then relaxed in the lounge until departure. They couldn't have been nicer!! No business center but they have two laptops you can use for free.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, charming, convenient - couldn't be bettered!”
Reviews.Author: ColFal
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, the staff were briliant, nothing was too much trouble for them. Hotel was well located, quiet, very clean and extremely comfortable. Breakfast was exceptionally good, and available from 7am to 11am. After asking for a pot of tea on the first morning, I didn't need to ask again, it was there before I'd made my choice from the extensive buffet. I loved the unusual lounge, full of history from it's former life as a monastery. A drink from the bar, was very welcome after a day sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “These positive reviews are not lies!”
Reviews.Author: ayaa1977
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia is just two minutes away from Santa Lucia train station, and the Ferrovia vaporetto (water bus) station is even closer. You can catch a ride on the vaporetto from there any time day or night to San Marco or anywhere you want, or you can just cross the "Ponte dei Scalzi" on Canal Grande and walk your way from there. The hotel entrance is tucked away inside a small alley, and you might have to ask for directions if it is your first time in Venice, but it should be easy for you to find. As for the hotel itself, it is really a charming hotel, and the staff, lead by the manager Alvise Vianello, are the friendliest and most charming staff one would ever counter. They are welcoming and accommodating that you'd feel right at home when you are there. The room itself was very nice and well maintained, it is of a good size, and has all the needed amenities. The bathroom was also clean and of a good size. The Shower handler was a little broken, but that was not really a big deal. The hotel also has Wi-Fi and it's free of charge for the guests. The breakfast was basic, and actually was of the widest variety that we've experienced in our 6 cities Italian adventure, but again, breakfast is not exactly Italy's biggest export. We loved our stay in the hotel Abbazia, and we loved the kindness and hospitality of its staff, which was genuine and puts one at ease. In my rush to catch my train to Verona, I accidentally took the key to my room with me, an actual key not a card, and I only noticed when I was in the train and it was too late, so I called the hotel to apologize, but Mr. Vianello laughed the whole thing off and asked me to keep it as a souvenir, it really put me at ease and I appreciate the place even more. So if we ever went back to Venice, I'd make sure to stay there again, and I'd advice anyone who asks me to do so.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location and lovely atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: californianative0055
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel in Venice we were down to 2 options, 1 near the train station and 1 near the Piazza San Marco. We opted for the Hotel Abbazia near the station and could not have been happier with our decision...especially when we saw so many people dragging their luggage all over the city, trying to find their hotels! The hotel itself is charming and comfortable. The room was spacious and nicely decorated, the bathroom was beautiful. Everything was immaculately clean. The common areas are nice as well, particularly the lounge with the wine/cappucino bar. Unfortunately it was a little chilly to enjoy the interior courtyard but it would be great in the warmer months. The breakfast was good, with lots of choices: fruit, cereal, yogert, hard-boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, baked goods, coffee, tea, juice, etc. They also have 2 laptops for guests' use. Mirka (one of the front desk staff) went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable. He gave us a tour of the hotel and grounds with lots of history of how it came about. He also mapped out an itinerary for us to walk each day, highlighting sites not to miss. His restaurant recommendations led us to some of the best food we had on our trip. I would not hesitate to recomment this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Colwyn10
Reviews.Content: This our 2nd stay at the Abbazia and would stay nowhere else. The location is perfect, close to the railway station and the bus terminus. The rooms are spacious and clean. The reception staff are fantastic, and so very helpful. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Thanks to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Spence_SD
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. My only negative would be the very tacky decor - but that is certainly no deal-breaker. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful - I felt as though they were friends rather than hotel employees. Room was spacious. Hotel very close to the train station, I was worried it might be noisy, but it was not in the least. If you are looking to be near Piazza San Marco, however, this may not be the hotel for you. It is quite a walk (although there are boat services you could take). A walk to the square is a good 20 minutes or so - but the plus to that is exploring the charming little streets of Venice. I had a great time wandering around getting lost among the small streets that open into large piazzas and campos.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Pecan10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a boutique hotel with a few rooms and is partnered with a larger hotel nearby. The rooms were small but very nice, comfortable and very trendy.The bathroom was very nice. The location is close to the parking which was great for us since we had a car. We just had a short walk, up and over one bridge. The hotel is just off the Grand Canal. The cost was good for Venice. There was a water taxi stop just outside the hotel. We enjoyed walking to St Mark's Square. It might be a little far for some to walk but the watar taxi's will get you there quickly. They are very inexpensive and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Daisy3881
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia was perfect for everything.The bus and train stations were just a stroll away, touring the city itself was all possible by foot or water bus whatever was your choice.Staff were exceptional,welcoming and helpful.Breakfast was v good,the hotel relaxing,rooms clean and access to internet complimentary with hotel laptops.I wouldnt look any further for a place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Venice gem”
Reviews.Author: Mediterranean10_10
Reviews.Content: After much perusal of the TripAdvisor web page we decided to stay at this hotel. Like so many other contributors we were extremely pleased with it. Both the location & staff are tops. Prior to our trip we were sending emails across to them and Alvise was always helpful in returning them. We enjoyed hearing the bells in the morning. It was great to be able to walk out the door and down the alley and be part of Venice,either by walking or catching the water buses. We experienced the flooding of the streets( not outside the hotel) and walking on the duck boards? It usually subside by about 11am. We travelled from the airport by bus and then the water bus one stop to the Ferrovia stop, luckly it wasn't too crowded, but to get to the cruise terminal, Alvise arranged for a taxi and it was definitely worth the cost. Alvise, Mirko, Raffaele and the other staff were always very helpful. We checked out the video on YouTube and this really helped us to find the hotel. We had all our evening meals at Poboledo restaurant on the canal, food was good, especially the 18 euro,for 2 course meal. coffee was wonderful ( we looked forward to it all day) and the atmosphere, so Venice. If we are ever fortunate enough to go back to Venice, we would stay there, it's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent positon and hotel”
Reviews.Author: HilsNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel (which is a converted church) for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. The rooms were spacious for Venice and the location couldn't have been better - in a street just along from the railway station. The men at reception where very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again everytime I visit Venice as I love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Abbazia - a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Oldebuffalo
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Abbazia was wonderful. The staff members were particularly helpful and friendly, the location was excellent, and the accommodations were great! We'd certainly stay again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the location, cleanliness, and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: nmckinney1022
Reviews.Content: The hotel was on a side street right next to the train station. The room was small but very clean and updated. Breakfast was great with a wide variety. The staff provided maps and helpful tips as well as a fun speed boat ride to the island of Murano. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: biscohikes
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 5 minute walk from the train station, easy to find. The desk staff were very helpful and spoke English (my only language) . The room was large and spotless. Breakfast (included in the price) was good. The night manager was very good in making suggestions on where to sight see and how to use the water bus system.. Next time we return to Venice we will stay there. I liked the fact they had free internet as well as wifi

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic, lovely hotel great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jandsgodzi
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10 and from word go they could not do enough for us. Rooms lovely and clean and great bathrooms with complimentary toiletries. Great breakfast, lots of character features and had a lovely warm atmosphere. Fantastic location about 5 mins walk from Piazza Roma bus station, lovely area plenty of restaurants and shops and can catch vaparetto 2 mins walk from hotel. If in a group like we were use the private taxi as can negotiate good price about 50 - 70 euros between you otherwise use vaparetto which was 6.50 per person per journey. To get from marco polo airport use bus only 3 euros each or for a real treat take a private water taxi which cost us 130 euros between us but was absolutely amazing. Once out of the centre of Venice it was like being on a speed boat very exciting felt like we were in james bond movie, fantastic way to get back to the airport. Oh and about the bells yes they are loud and they go on for what seems like ages at 7 oclock in the morning however it all added to the character of the hotel. The first morning was a shock and then after that you just get used to them and don't notice them so much so please do not let this put you off.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!! Set the mood for the vacation in the Mediterranean”
Reviews.Author: Sandy37088
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, very helpful and professional. I had some problems connecting to the internet and Mirko went out of his way to help me. This hotel is charming and in a good location to see Venice. Very quiet and comfortable. The history completed the ambience of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to start for your cruise”
Reviews.Author: mrbeco
Reviews.Content: We took the number 5 bus from the airport and it drops off at the last stop, walk over the bridge past the train station and left by the next bridge to the hotel. Small but with all the extras that make it special. And the staff was really great. We explored the city and with the boat bus stop right there it was a breeze to get around. When it was time to go to our cruise ship the front desk arrainged for our transfers. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise.....”
Reviews.Author: ravioli39
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a former Monastery , with a very large sitting room with a bar, TV and comfy red velvet furniture. This was the former dining hall. A nice place to relax and use 1 of the 2 laptops that are available at the front desk. There is a lovely garden with beautiful wicker furniture to sit outside and relax and eat breakfast if you so desire. The front desk staff was incredible, very friendly, helpful with quite a sense of humor. It is steps away ffrom the train station down an alleyway which at first, doesn't look too desirable. But, there are several hotels and restaurants on the alley. The rooms are small, but very clean........we were on the 2nd floor and there are no elevators. There are toiletries and plush towels. Breakfast is excellent with lots of choices and is always being replenished. Cheeses, salamis, fresh fruit, cakes pastries, toast, croissants. Although we loved it here, there are drawbacks. the church is right next door. so at 7:45 and 8:45 every morning we awaken to the tune of very LOUD bells. It is noisy at nite with people walking back and forth and since there are restaurants on the street, diners are outside and then you hear them moving table and chairs to clean up. It is in the area before crossing the Grand Canal, very busy, vibrant area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet eden steps from the train station”
Reviews.Author: Jerry16
Reviews.Content: This little gem is literally steps from the train station. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spotless and the bed comfortable. There was an inside courtyard with covered seating where we had a delightful cocktail hour with wine and cheese picked up at a local market. The staff actually supplied the glasses gladly. The breakfast was more than the average continental fare with hard boiled eggs, crisp croissants, cereal, cheeses and a variety of meats. Free wi-fi and quiet atmosphere less than a 100 meters from the hustle and bustle of the Grand Canal completes a wonderful gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Experience - Par Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte1942
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful experience. After a busy day sightseeing it was bliss to return to relax in the beautiful garden with a book and cool drink, preferably the hotel's version of the 'Spritz'. Or for a nightcap after dinner in the very comfortable lounge. The staff wer excellent, very helpful and well informed, whatever the question and spoke excellent English. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Another "Loved It" Review for the Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: teresita21
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has ever been to Venice before and experienced the joys of navigating Venice's alleys, bridges and ferries with luggage will definitely appreciate Abbazia's location. For those who haven't been yet - trust me, you WILL appreciate this. Steps from the train station Abbazia is easy to get yet tranquil and serene. Other than church bells we never heard any outside noise. Rooms were comfy and we enjoyed having a jacuzzi tub. Service was helpful and sincere. Breakfast wonderful. We walked away appreciative of the friendly and hardworking staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Everything that they say is true!”
Reviews.Author: ChargerDriver
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great hotel - well located, charming, and everything one could want for a place to stay in Venice. Yes, the shower (see other reviews) is a bit inconvenient, but when you open the door to go to breakfast and get that first whiff of fresh baked goods, you will have an inkling of what Heaven must smell like. The staff, each and every one, was truly outstanding and helped to make our stay quite pleasant. A couple of things that we haven't noticed in prior reviews that may be helpful. When walking from the bus station, there are folks that will help you with your luggage across the glass bridge. Rates vary, so ask first! 2 Euros seems to be an appropriate amount per bag. Others have mentioned that the hotel is quite close to the bridge, and it is, kinda. With heavy suitcases, it seems farther so any energy saved crossing the bridge might be helpful for dragging the luggage the last 500 meters! When leaving the hotel, if your luggage has gained weight, there is a service that we haven't seen mentioned. The front desk wil arrange to have your luggage picked-up at the hotel. You follow the gentleman to the left side of the train station where a taxi will be waiting to take you directly to the airport. It costs 60 Euros but we felt it was worth it. The gentleman pulling the cart clears a nice pass through the crowds and it certainly saves a lot of time and aggrevation! Don't go to this hotel if you want the typical sterile room, shag carpeting, and other standard stuff. Go to this hotel if you want to have a great stay, friendly people, a wonderful breakfast and to be treated like a real guest. It is truly outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- great staff”
Reviews.Author: artmarc2158
Reviews.Content: we checked into the sister hotel the deluxe- the room was very nice but it had 5 steps up to bath- which we thought would be hazardous at night-The girl at the desk( julia) called the owner and found us another 3 star hotel when all hotels were booked.They absorbed the difference in price. we were in the abazzia after the cruise-.great hotel - room on the courtyard.room was an 8 out of 10 for 3 star hotels in Italy-greakfast buffet in the courtyard was very enjoyable- the deskand other staff members were 10 out of 10. They were helpful in respects and suggested very nice resonanble restaurents with in walking distance on the canal. you cant find anything bteer for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Just right, and great location”
Reviews.Author: dredd123
Reviews.Content: Couldn't really fault this except maybe that the rooms (or at least ours) are a bit dated. Also for some strange reason there's a showerhead in the bath, but nowhere on the wall to hang it. Must be a Venetian thing. The location was spot on - just two minutes walk from the railway station, ideal for us arriving by train and with rucksacks. (By the way, we did the overnight train from Paris to Venice - this is AWFUL! The Orient Express it is not!) Breakfast is perfectly adequate, and can be taken in the hotel garden. They rent out laptops with wireless access - these proved very popular with some of the kids around for on-line gaming. I guess there's only so many canals a 12 year old can get excited about.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't mind going back”
Reviews.Author: 187870Peter
Reviews.Content: Conveniently situated near the railway station with a nice central garden. Plentiful continental breakfast & friendly staff. Nice double shower, spare pillows & blankets. Some people may not like the nearby church bell being rung at 7.15 & 8.15.am, however!0000000

Reviews.Title: “Great feel and atmosphere in this old Abbey”
Reviews.Author: hjmcclure
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Hotel Abbazia as it is good value for money, staff are very friendly & helpful, lovely breakfast and good location near the Grand Canal and St Lucia station. Good, reasonably priced food venues handy too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mollygo
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel! Walking distance from St Lucia, and you dont hear the trains at all. Great Breakfast. And easy to get to every thing in Venice. Either by walking or water bus. If I ever go back to Venice, i would stay here. I would recommend this hotel for Couples or families. Church bells very loud, but viewed it as part of the fun of Venice. Cannot say enough kind words about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel in an excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reenerbeener
Reviews.Content: The staff gave excellent service. They were always helpful and answered all of our questions. The room was nice. We had a view of the garden which was lovely. You would never know that you were in the middle of it all. It was peaceful and relaxing. As we came by train, it was only a short walk to the hotel. This is a good thing as that is the only mode of transportation, walking and boat. The air conditioner worked well and we were grateful for that because it was hot in July! Breakfast was included and my mother and I enjoyed eating out in the garden. There was free WiFi and 2 different lap tops that you could use. I would stay at this hotel again in a heart beat and hope to return with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JaneBD
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled at the height of vacation season, so Venice was very crowded. But this hotel is just off the busy street on a quiet calle with restaurants just steps from the front door. It is also a great location for the train station and water buses.Our room was doppia standard and it needed some updates but it was clean and large enough. The bathroom was quite small. The air conditioner did not work very well and the staff offered to move us to another room, but a rainstorm cooled things off so we kept 214 and opened the windows, and it was comfortable. The facilities are charming. The courtyard is quite a peaceful oasis. But the stars of this place are definitely the staff. Every one gives exceptionally warm, friendly attention to guests. The free trip to Murano and personal tour of the glass factory was a treat, too.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RonJulia
Reviews.Content: What a find in Venice...close to the railway station - no bridges to cross!!!....very good room rate and a super friendly staff. We booked this hotel after looking at TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Handy for the vaporetto stop...lovely garden where you can have your very nice breakfast - we even came back one evening with some grub and drinks we had bought from a shop nearby and ate it in the garden - much cheaper than eating out in Venice - unless you go to Campo St. Margherita Square for a pizza. We would also recommend a visit to Ca'Rezzonico a stunning house where Robert Browning lived and which has been restored as a stately house of the 18th./19th. century- again a lovely garden to sit in.....you can access the garden for free- handy if you're down that way and you want a respite from Venice's high daytime summer temperatures. We also did the Venice Ghost walk and found that to be very good. We would unreservedly recommend the Hotel Abbazia!! Ron&Julia ...Ross-on-Wye... England.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: robbles1970
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Venice. The first time I stayed in a hotel overlooking the Rialto. I was a little concerned this time choosing a hotel further away from Santa Marco/Rialto area. But Hotel Abbazia was a great location. It's two minutes from the train station. You don't have to worry about arriving and dragging your luggage onto a vaparetto. Also, because the vaparetto stop is right in front of the train station, you never have a problem finding a boat to bring you back to your hotel. The decorations look a little old, but the staff were incredibly friendly, the breakfast was fresh and plentiful, and the convenience of the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegent Escape”
Reviews.Author: ed78
Reviews.Content: We loved Venice - it was busy and noisy. At night when we were ready for quiet relaxation we found it in Hotel Abbazia. The location was perfect - just a short walk from the train and bus station, but in a very secure location. The hotel is tucked into the back of a narrow side street, or so you think. When you walk past the front desk, you're taken aback by the expanse and elegance of the hotel. It runs from front to back of the street. Our room was huge with a king size bed, plenty of walking space, a large size closet, writing desk and night stands. A beautiful Murano glass chandelier hung in the center of the room and beautiful wall scones gave the room a nice ambiance. The walls were covered in fabric that matched the curtains and coverlet. The pillows were large and plump... it was beautiful! Our room overlooked a garden with plenty of seating for guests to have a quiet snack or drink. The breakfast room was elegant and large. The breakfast was more than you would expect. The staff was very friendly and helpful -- always ready with a smile. I would go back in a heartbeat! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loads of character”
Reviews.Author: harnett38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this little gem of a hotel with my husband for 5 nights. We chose it after reading the many excellent reviews and we were not dissapointed. The hotel is situated in a quiet area and is easy to travel to and from to and access all of the main attractions. Our room was clean, comfortable and had air conditioning, good shower and was well decorated. In some other reviews people have said they found the early church bells annoying but we found them charming, much better than any alarm clock! The breakfast is of good standard and we ate most mornings in the garden. The staff were all friendly and went out of their way to help, even arranging opera tickets for us that night . We enjoyed our stay in the hotel very much and would not hesitate to stay there again or reccommend it. Some tips.... When travelling from Marco Polo airport, the quickest and cheapest way to travel is by bus. When you walk out of the airport the buses are straight in front of the door and if you get a ATVO blue bus to Venice it takes about 20 mins and costs 3 euros each. From the bus station cross over the glass bridge in the direction of the train station and the hotel is down a narrow street past the station 2/3 minutes away.( look for the yellow wall ). The water bus is the best and cheapest way of travelling around but if you are staying more than one day get a 48 or 72 hour pass. It costs 6.5 euros each for each single trip on the water bus so costs can easily mount up. We got a 72 hour pass and hopped on and off the bus as many times a we needed and was much more cost effective. Venice is a feast for eyes, so enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel on a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: micky1975
Reviews.Content: We booked on the worldweb our 3 nights stay at Abbazia hotel in Venice, Italy. So you always have to waight and see if it is what you have expected. Well....Abbazia was more than we expected! It was a very charming and good hotel for a good price.The location of the hotel was SUPER! The people at the desk where more than friendly. They all speak a very good word of Englisch. Staying in Venice a specially in hotel Abbazia was realy great! We can recommand it to everyone! Abbazia is THE place to stay for a visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ds651
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in the staff welcomed us and couldn't do enough for us. We arrive @ 9:30 a.m and rather than tell us we couldn't check in, they offered us a delicious buffet which we enjoyed in their beautiful courtyard. Afterward they gave us maps and a list of things to do. The hotel is an oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of Venice. It's beautiful and maintains the peace and tranquility of its monastery days. Since we were traveling by train it was important for us to be as close to the train station as possible. If we were any closer we'd be IN the train station. There is a bridge over the Grand Canal almost directly in front of the hotel and it's about a 20 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. It took us about and hour because there was so much to see and do along the way, including getting a gondola at out doorstep. If you don't like to walk, you can get a water taxi right there as well. The biggest surprise was the size of the rooms; they were large even by US standards! We were traveling throughout Italy and planned only one night in Venice which was sad because our favorite hotel was the Hotel Abbaziza.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel ! great location & service”
Reviews.Author: tomtom062
Reviews.Content: Going on other reviews we booked the Abbazia direct by email and had a standard room with a lovely outlook over the garden,which I requested. The front desk were very friendly and responded very promptly by email..
