It was a great hotel in a really good location ( we thought the best having walked around a great deal during our stay) set back off the main street, so nice and quiet but with lots of resturants,snack bars,minifood stores and shops ,in fact everything you needed was right there and great start off point for anywhere in Venice, with the boat service right nearby.As with all hotels you have to do some walking with your case so be prepared for steps over the main bridge but its much nearer than most or if you want to avoid any steps theres the public boat bus which stops right at the end of the small ally leading to the hotel. Its a restored abbey and has loads of character and original features but everywhere is kept spotlessly clean and it is very pleasant to walk through the hotel corridors to your room and dining area. There is also a pleasant inner garden where you can enjoy a relax or take breakfast in the morning.Generally after spending all day walking around Venice, which can be very tiring, it was always a joy to enter the hotel and to be attended by the excellent staff on the front desk, friendly and with a comical sense of humour. All other staff such as cleaners and porters were also friendly and polite giving a very relaxed atmosphere. I must mention Alvise the hotel manager, Mateo,Fabio and Mirko all did a great job to make you enjoy your stay and they will always offer you a porter to carry your bags. The room over the garden (208 ) was small but had a fabulous modern bathroom with mosaic tiles and double shower .The room & linen were spotlessly clean and very tidy , great job by the room service! Breakfast was from 7.30 to 11am which was great no rush ! very good with ample selection of hams,cheeses, boiled eggs, pasteries,fresh fruit, cereals,fresh orange to drink with coffees and hot chocolate.Although from a machine the cappochino was excellent and there was plenty of jams, toast, bread rolls etc and yogurts! The dining room staff were always on hand if you needed assistance and everything was kept topped up ,if not you just asked and they sorted it for you.The tables were cleaned ready for the next guest and you could eat in the dining room or take out to the garden after 9am, if you wished.Other reviews have mentioned the church bell which rings out loudly at 7.30 am and again at 8.30 am( or there abouts) but it only rings for about a minute and we found it a great alarm call and the second chime acted as a snooze ! We quite liked the bell, no problem , just seemed to go with the hotel ! We had a fabulous time in Venice but would personally recommend at least 4/5 nights to explore the city well, visiting outer areas and not just the main sights, some of the best sights were seen at night walking around over the narrow bridges under archways with all the shades and lights and glittering water - fantastic! So dont just visit Venice as a day trip! We went to Lake Garda for a 5 day stay but were disappointed with the Hotel and the area did not appeal to us as Venice did, although very beautiful to drive around and see the lovely towns etc. So we decided to check out and return to Venice and called the Abbazia who did everything they could to accomodate us again. We did one night in Verona ( which was amazing ) and back to Abbazia to be greeted as happy returning guests! the room was older in style as it was all they had at short notice, however upon request they went out of their way to prepare another room for the remaineder of our stay in room 310 , a superb room our favourite of all - thanks guys! The room was again spotlessly clean overlooking the garden and the bell and with all the great breakfast to look forward to all over again ! It was great to be back in Venice and great to be back in the Abbazia - thank you all very much and we will be back . Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Cate014
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in a superior triple room. There were actually four beds and the room can only be described as palatial. It was huge! The staff was friendly and always helpful. After walking into the chaos outside of the Venice train station its amazing that only a few hundred feet away is this oasis of calm down a quiet alley. Right on the edge of the Canareggio, you have quick access to a quieter more authentic portion of Venice yet you are convenient to all the sights and the vaporetti. Our only complaint was that there was mildew (quite a bit) on the shower head. But had we mentioned it I have no doubt that staff would have rushed up to clean it off. Its a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: bozo0340
Reviews.Content: The setting is wonderful, an old monastery, very peaceful and no noise! What was really great was that the concierges, esp. Alivse were so nice and actually cared about your visit. Alvise suggested good restaurants, itineraries , and made my daughters and I feel special! I would definately recomend this Place! It has a spirit of holiness about it.

Reviews.Title: “LACK OF SINCERETY”
Reviews.Author: ozgur-umut
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights during our honeymoon trip. The atmosphere and design of the hotel was great with a lovely mixture of antique look and comfort. The breakfast was rich. Bar lounge and especially the garden was unique and enjoyable during any time of the day. The location was convenient if you're using the train station; but not close to the center area. On the other hand, although our room was supposed to be "superior", it wasn't superior to anything at all. I had made my reservation six months ago and had noted that this was our honeymoon vacation. However what i was given was the smallest of so called superior rooms; one of the rooms in the corner with no view, two single beds put together and getting apart all the time, a tv with a couple of channels, a standart wardrobe and a small bathroom with no bathtub. All of our three-star standart rooms we stayed during our honeymoon trip were better than this one; all had larger rooms, double beds, bathtubs, coaches, views, some even had balconies and some of the hotels had actually offered us free champagne. This room however was nothing like in the pictures; and when i told this to the reception i was shown a standart room which was actually the smallest and worst room i have seen in my life, almost impossible to breathe looking to a closed area with pipes, to convince us that our room was superior anyway. But later i discovered that, in fact we were given the worst room because other superior rooms were bigger, had extra furniture and nice views. I consider this to be dishonest and very unfair; because when i made the reservation months ago, all of the rooms were available and i even had contacted the hotel a month ago to reconfirm if our reservation was safe. What is the meaning of reservation if they're giving away rooms according to some unknown discriminative criteria and honoring our oldest-dated honeymoon reservation with the worst one left? Did they think that others would complain about it but we were such losers that we wouldn't notice it? I may still recommend the hotel hoping that others could get lucky enough to be cared and favored, unlike us. But i'm giving them the worst rate, the exact value they gave us.

Reviews.Title: “This was the perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: FP4BMO
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an extended Italian trip and this hotel was our first experience with Italian accomodation. It was ideally located, less than 5 minutes to the train station, we took the water taxi/ferry from the airport and it dropped us off less than 10 minutes from the hotel, we missed the lane/road the first time from the ferry drop point as the hotel sign would be seen heading from the train station but not the opposite way. The hotel was clean and well run, the two men we met at the front desk, were great for local information and tips to deal with the gondola rides, local restuarants and other lcoal knowledge. The room was great for the two of us and our 8 year old son, he had a couch/bed that was perfect for him and a queen sized bed for the two of us. The room was small but it did the trick for the 3 of us, the bathroom was in great shape, very modern looking. The room had air conditioning that worked and was a nice relief at the end of a hot day. We had drinks in the bar area and the bar tender was very helpful in making coffees or drinks, and they were reasonably priced. We enjoyed the lounge area and could use the free wifi . The breakfast was great, breads, eggs, meats, cheese, yogurts and cereal ; a very wide selection to satisfy anyones food interest. This hotel was well represented by the website in that what was expected was exactly what we received. We really enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abbazia: More Than Met our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: sophie4
Reviews.Content: Based on trip advisor reviews, we chose Hotel Abbazia as a great choice for a hotel that would work well with our cruise plans and overall visit to Venice. Upon our arrival on the ATVO Flyer, Hotel Abbazia was just a 10 minute walk to the hotel and very easy to find. One drawback was that we had to cross the bridge with heavy luggage, but we managed. We could have taken a vaporetto (for around 6 euros each), but opted to manage it ourselves. It's baffling that whoever was the architect of this bridge did not keep in mind weary travelers dragging luggage over those steps! Oh well! The hotel has a gorgeous reception area, and the hotel personnel were so welcoming and helpful to us. We arrived on a VERY warm July day, and felt that the AC wasn't cooling the room as much as we'd like (we're from Texas...what can I say!) but it did get better and was not a huge issue. The breakfast was wonderful and you could eat either in the dining area or outside in a nice courtyard. Many reviewers mentioned the bells as a bother, They were literally outside of our window, but I loved them (and I was up anyway!) After our cruise, Hotel Abbazia allowed us to store some luggage while we traveled to Florence and the Tuscanny area. We came back to Hotel Abbazia for one last night before departing for the states, and to our surprise (and without asking) we were upgraded to a junior suite that was fabulous! The vaporetto stop was a few minutes from the hotel and we were in the heart of Venice (St. Mark's, Rialto) in a short time. We walked to the Rialto area in around 20 minutes, and that was with a lot of stopping to window shop! I believe this hotel was a great value, was in a safe location, and would definitely stay there again, even if we weren't going on a cruise!

Reviews.Title: “lovely location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker183
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a three night break in july. The location is perfect, few minutes walk from the bus stop and the train station, and along a quiet street. The rest of venice is still in walking distance. The room we had was small but clean. We were on floor two with no lift but the staff helped with our suitcases so that wasnt really a problem. The staff were really lovely and very helpful. The nearby church bells were very loud and early but to be fair we were getting up to explore anyway so it wasnt a major issue. The breakfast was pretty basicand the breakfast room a bit tired. The garden area was lovely and quiet for a relax after a hard day walking around Venice. A lovely place to stay and good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but be prepared for those early bells!”
Reviews.Author: FrancophileLeanne
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel, we had read the reviews that warned of the nearby church bells that sounded at 7:00 -- but didn't quite appreciate how early that really was until we arrived! Just be warned that the bells really are loud, and ring at 7:00 and also 8:00. Other than that, this hotel was lovely and wonderful! The front desk staff was really helpful, and it's located right next to the train station, so it's very easy to find and get to, even when dragging luggage. It's about a 30-minute walk to St. Mark's from the hotel, but the walk is lovely and there is also a vaporetto stop right out front of the hotel, so it's very easy to get to anywhere you need to go. Since the hotel is also located on a main street, it's close to restaurants and shops, most of which stay open until at least 10:00 at night. The breakfast buffet was also very good. Overall, a great place to call home while in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RichardBelgium
Reviews.Content: We made a trip through Europe by car and stayed for two nights in this charming hotel. The hotel is as close as can be to the (as far as I know) only public parking on the island, so we did not have to drag luggage through the entire city center, a serious advantage considering that, at night, you can spot desperate travellers pulling their bags over the bridges, swearing and sweating. The hotel is a charme, located in an old monastery with a beautiful garden, a large bar in the old refectory (with an intact pulpit). Kids slept (4 & 7) with us in a large room with high ceilings, clean with good beds. The guys at the reception are friendly and funny. The breakfast was rich. The station of the grand canal "vaporetto" is very close by, as is in fact the entire city center. Overall, a greate place to stay, visiting Venice with our without small children (and certainly if you came by car).

Reviews.Title: “welcoming and friendly hotel with staff who really do care!”
Reviews.Author: pizza_face_2k10
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i have had the pleasure of staying at the Abbazia hotel. My teenage son and I stayed for 3 nights in July, our twin room overlooking the garden was light, bright and airy, the barthroom was modern with a large shower. The location was very convenient as it is just off the grand cannal and close to the train station. We arrived by bus from the Marco Polo airport and had no problem walking from the bus station to the hotel. I would have no hesitaion in recommending this hotel and I look forward to returning sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: benteW
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location close to the train station. It takes about 10 min. to walk from Pz. Roma - and there is ONLY one bridge to cross! The hotel is old, a little bit used, but very charming. Nice little garden - excellent service in the reception and breakfast room. Feel free to take a cup Cappucino with you in the garden. I can only recommand these hotel. You can not find many of these hidden places to that price in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and charming a winner!”
Reviews.Author: tommyv40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a pleasant surprise. Our hosts were charming and very helpful. The hotel has a small garden that we spent several evenings having wine. The breakfast in the morning was a perfect blend of different types of food and the caffÃ¨ is fantastic. When eating in Venice look for the small cafes off the beaten path as their food is outstanding at a good price. Be alert a lot of places charge a coperto or cover charge and put servizio or service (tip) are included into the bill. The first day I tipped on the tip.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Spencer3861
Reviews.Content: I picked Hotel Abazzia for this trip to Venice because of it's proximity to the Piazalle Roma, where we would pick-up our bus for a Mediterranian cruise. As the other reviews state, the location is great for transportation and shopping. The rooms were good, the bath was modern and very clean. The bells do ring rather loudly in the morning, so don't be surprised. The breakfast was great for a European 3 star hotel. We enjoyed taking it in the garden court. The staff was of great help to us, as our bags did not arrive when we did. They assisted us with multiple calls and personal intervention to get them delivered before we left for our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “AAA location”
Reviews.Author: tasmike
Reviews.Content: Great location only 60 metres from rail station & 30 metres to grand canal with no steps. Hotel had lots of character & charm. Very easy access to all forms of transport especially the water buses (water taxis are very expensive) Reasonable price for Venice .Staff helpfull & spoke exellent English. Shopping nearby is fantastic as is the choice of resterauts etc Oh great breakfast to.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, but Even Better and a Great, Great Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: DNewk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay here. The location is great--very close to the train and bus depots. The room (106) was huge, and the bathroom was well equipped. The courtyard in the back was nice for reading...the bells are early and last for a bit, but not as loud as I feared. The staff at the front desk was, in a word, was fantastic. Great recommendations for dinner--which was on the canal and just a stone's throw away...Only one minor drawback--the bartender seemed to have the personality of a door knob.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: wineloverScotland
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel and very surprised about how large the bedroom was. The location is perfect - so near to the Grand Canal and the vaparetto stop, and yet in such a peaceful spot. It was lovely having breakfast in the garden area. We really liked the sitting area and found some great people to chat to - only complaint really was that on our first evening the bar was not open. The reception staff were extremely helpful and were great characters.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Vanegas
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the train station and the grand canal. The rooms were comfy and clean. The hotel is a converted abbey and has so much character. You have to eat breakfast in the patio garden. The staff was great. If I go back to Venice, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lifefunjourney
Reviews.Content: This is a late review on this hotel. We stayed there in Sep 2008. It was pleasant and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Would stay there again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and very friendly and knowledgable staff”
Reviews.Author: HFMNWEngland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my family (husband, 2 children, parents) based on reviews read on Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. The hotel is in a fab location - up a quiet street only 1 min walk from GrandCanal and 2 mins walk from train station/Vaporetto stop. I had booked 2 triple rooms as there were no quads on the website, but on arrival, the very friendly staff member offered me a quad room at the same price so we could have both children in with us. The rooms were very well equipped and a good size, and the bathrooms were fantastic with lovely marble modern fixtures. The rooms were all very quiet, and we loved the central garden area where we ate breakfast. The staff were brilliant and gave lots of valuable advice on where to go, and on the best way to get to the airport, which they arranged for us. We arrived at 9am in the morning having left our cruise ship first thing, and the receptionist said we could go for breakfast, which was a real bonus. When our cases arrived, they were put in our rooms for us. I could not fault this hotel and would certainly recommend it to anyone. Venice is an expensive destination and I thought this hotel was great value for the high standard that it provided.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Hessi0n
Reviews.Content: We had a huge room with a queensize bed and also another single bed which we didn't need. The ensuite was also huge. (room 106) The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Mirko on reception. After our stay we went on the Orient express which departs from Santa Lucia Railway Station. (walking distance) Also close to the 'bus station. And the Vaporetti water 'bus. They have a well maintained garden were we sat in the evenings and drank. The bar is very reasonable 2.50 euro's a drink. It is a converted old monastry and the only negative was that the old bell still rings out the hours starting at 7am.!!!!!!!! (but you got used of it) The high pulpit is still there in the lounge area. Less than 100 euro a night each. Very reasonable in comparison to other hotels in the area. This hotel could easly pass for a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: zero1919
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel and the friendly, helpful and very funny staff made our stay very pleasant indeed. Nothing appeared to be too much trouble for them which is a welcome relief after plane and train travel. Free internet access...just grab a laptop and away you go. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to my friends or anyone who were looking for a point from which to discover Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to this wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mkaps
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a 16 day vacation through many major cities in Italy. Venice and the Hotel Abbazia were our favorite. Great Location, Quiet, Clean with Beautiful Rooms, Helpful (and funny) Staff. Overall our experience was amazing! We will, without a doubt, return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AC in our room was dodgy but overall Hotel Abbazia was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteEpicurean
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving Venice by train, hauling more luggage than you would like to admit and want to avoid exhorbitant water taxi fees or the hassle of embarking on Vaporetto then this hotel is for you. It literally took my wife and I (five pieces of luggage) only 3-4 minutes to walk to this hotel. Bravo. Staff was very friendly (special kudos to Mirkko) and helpful in making reservations for dinner and arranging for porter assistance to a taxi and the trip to airport (thanks Matteo). We enjoyed garden for evening cocktails and found breakfast to be very good. Would definitely stay here again at this little oasis. Perhaps it was operator error on our part, but the airconditioner was feeble in its output of cold air and the evening outside air was not cool enough to cool the room off. This made for a restless night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet haven in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mullsworth
Reviews.Content: Returned to Venice after two years and stayed again at the Abbazia, an old Monestary in Canareggio. It is located in the perfect position, just a couple of minutes from the Station and Ferruvia Vaporetti but eating breakfast in the tranqil enclosed garden you are completely unaware of the bustle just a block away. Each room we've stayed in has been clean and spacious and the triple we had for the boys - all over 6 foot - had three proper beds! The only extraneous noise is the monastic morning call to prayer at 8am with snooze repeat an hour later. The continental breakfast is full and unhurried, with a generous assortment of pastries and meats but it was the staff that helped make the trip so memorable. Their knowledge of restaurants in all categories throughout the city, sense of humor and advice on planning days and travel, again made life easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelGnu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. If you like luxury, I wouldn't stay here but it was a great value for the price. The location is great and the staff are very helpful. It is only a block from train station and one of the main lines of the vaporetti so you can always catch a boat back home. It does get flooded but the hotel has boots for you to borrow. The breakfast was okay, it is a standard European continental breakfast. The lobby also has free wireless and you can borrow one of their laptops.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable and disappointing this time”
Reviews.Author: Cat555
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time staying in Hotel Abbazia and needless to say I kept coming back because I found it so good. Unfortunately not this time. Our room was small and very uncomfortable. It was on the 1st floor but apart from the main building. The room was tiny, my companion's suitcase had to be accommodated on the dressing table. We had to squeeze between the dressing table and the bed to get to the bathroom. The smell of airfreshners(2) in this small space was overpowering. We left them outside the room one day for several hours and then discovered the smell that they were masking. Our windows overlooked the alley where we listened to rolling suitcases from early morning and one morning what seemed to be a young tour group socializing loudly for over an hour. The twin beds were hard so our nights were long. Having stayed in lovely rooms there in the past I was extremely disappointed with this one. The staff are as wonderful as ever, the breakfast good, the location great, I even like the bells, but that annex, that room.. no, no, no.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Lori_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights during our honeymoon in Italy. While I had seen good review of the hotel online, I must admit that I was still a bit hesitant about staying at the Hotel Abbazia due to its close proximity to Venice's train station. (I feared that vagrants, cheap tourist traps, and noise would abound.) I was pleasantly surprised, then, when we arrived! The hotel is actually down a small street from the main train station plaza, about a minute's walk from the exit of the train station. The hotel surrounds a very quiet courtyard and the area around the hotel was actually quite pleasant - and convenient to the Vaporetto stop. There were several affordable restaurants nearby as well. The hotel itself was elegantly decorated and we were very comfortable during our stay. The front desk staff were very friendly, and breakfast had a nice selection of meats, cheese, and pastries. The only sounds we heard at night and in morning in our room were the occasional church bells from the church next door-- a pleasant treat for us! I'd highly recommend this hotel for its convenient location near the train station. That, coupled with its nice interior, make it a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Their reputation on Trip Advisor is well deserved. Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: purewaves
Reviews.Content: We just wrapped up a 3 night stay here and were were absolutely delighted with the experience. This hotel bills itself as a 3 star property but in our opinion, it's definitely more like a 4 star hotel. First things first...location! This place is located just a few moments from the bus terminal and train station. However, it has none of the negative connotations of being close to that type of place. You dont even know it's there. Location is super important because theres no motorized transport in Venice, so lugging around bags over cobble stone streets and on water busses is an inconvenience, especially if your hotel is 30 mins away from the bus/train station. But it wont be a problem for you if you stay here! Also, it was the little things that made this stay great. The helpful front desk, the charming outdoor space next to the dining room, and the complimentary laptops they offer guests to use if they didn't bring their own laptop. Oh yeah, the free breakfast was nice too. I should also mention that while the outside of the hotel is nothing out of the ordinary, the inside is majestic and interesting. From what I understand it was an old monastery that was converted to private use. Check out the bar area next to the lobby. There's a pulpit up by the wall. Pretty cool. As for the rooms, they were decent and pretty well decorated but nothing special. Ours faced the inner courtyard which was relaxing and lovely (except for the 7:20am church bell ringing 100 times - not even kidding). I should also point out that the rooms were flawed in a few ways. First, the showers were a bit on the crappy side. There was no fixed shower-head, just a detachable one with a long hose and a holder on the wall. However, the holder was affixed about 2 feet off the floor, so you couldnt stand under the stream of water without holding it up. Made for an interesting shower process. Also, no mirrors in the room aside from the bathroom one. And finally, minimal storage space for our stuff. In the end, I highly recommend this place. Check it out for sure if you are going to Venice! Pros - Good value, clean, comfortable property, free breakfast, great location, fast wireless internet (also free), complimentary laptops to use, very cool inner courtyard to chill out in. Cons - Basic, though tastefully decorated rooms, awkward showers, no mirrors in the room, poorly stocked minibar, the morning church bells are ridiculously loud and go off at 7:20am on the dot every day. Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “So Glad That We Picked Hotel Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: Lynne09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel at the end of a very active 12 day Med cruise. It was the perfect way to end our vacation. The hotel was everything we could ask for. It was very easy to get to, great places to eat around the corner and very charming in every way. We can't say enough about the friendly and helpful front desk. They (Matthew and Fabio ?) went out of their way to help in any way they could. They were truly great!!! Our rooms were spotlessly clean and so was the rest of the hotel. The only bad thing about our stay there was that it was not long enough. We would love to go back and would stay at the Hotel Abbazia in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: leonardmiragliuolo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Abbazia several times over the past 5 years and I believe it is one of the best bargains in Venice. The hotel has a great location and its staff is always pleasant and very helpful. Rooms are great, location is great, staff is great, and the price is right! I recommend this hotel to all of my friends who plan to travel to Venice and I always look forward to staying at the Abbazia. Bravo Abbazia!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,location and a nice surprise built in!”
Reviews.Author: nestingdoll
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the staff in this hotel was incredible. Every single person that worked there was incredible. Matthew at the front desk was like our own private tour guide in giving us sightseeing, eating and even our departure information for getting to the airport. We arrived very early (0900) after getting off a cruise ship and our room was ready! Matthew sent us to refresh in the room, free breakfast and then we came back to the desk and he told us everything we wanted to know aout Venice. We were also given a great surprise and to a free trip to Murano in a private water taxi to see a glass factory that is owned by the hotel owner. We had private tour of the of factory and a staff member there who was knowledgable beyond compare. The location is outstanding. Near the the Piazza Roma bus stop and only steps to the Grand Canal and eating and shopping. A great bargain for the expensive city of Venice! You get your moneys worth at this Hotel. There is no elevator though (but there is a porter to carry your bags for you).

Reviews.Title: “Great small boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: muscatravelr
Reviews.Content: We went for the "standard" room, rather than pay a bit extra for the superior. While the room was small, the bathroom was beautiful. We were just fine with the small room. We had a lovely window that opened on to the garden area. The location could not be beat. We came and went by train. It was so nice to not have to haul our bags far. They very graciously agreed to store our bags and offered us breakfast when we arrived at around 9 a.m. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - all you can eat nutella croissants mmm”
Reviews.Author: sallyeo
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by bus and the hotel is just a 5 min walk away (though over the big bridge - you have to carry not roll the suitcase across!) Its hidden down a side alley so its a bit quieter. Reception staff were polite enough, walk through the beautiful 'church' room with pews and a pulpit. Room was on the 1st floor over looking the garden. There was some work going on but it didnt disturb us. Room was an OK size and bathroom much bigger with trendy tiles and a double shower! There is a large bell tower about 200m away and its extremely loud - chimes at 6.20am and at 7.20am! If the windows are shut it shouldnt disturb too much and with earplugs can't hear a thing! Breakfasts were really good - efficient staff - meat platters, cheese, loads of different croissants, cakes etc, cappucino and fruit juice, fruit, yoghurt etc. We often took stuff with us for lunch and that would see us through until dinner at 7. One pointer though - Il Sandolo (you pass it down the alley had the most appalling staff and the food was vile!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a Venice stay”
Reviews.Author: sunnidafl
Reviews.Content: We arrived via train and had excellent directions provided by the hotel for the short walk from the train station. It was wonderful not to have to figure out the vaporetto system first thing. We were able to walk to our hotel, check in and drop off our bags before exploring Venice. From the moment we walked in the door we knew we had made a great choice. The helpful desk personnel greeted us by name and provided us wih a map and information. The room was large and nicely furnished. we especially appreciated the lrge fluffy bth towels. There were two English news stations on the TV. The area around the hotel had many cafes and restaurants for evening meals and we even found a pub with Gunness to celebrate St. Pat's Day. Breakfast had a wide variety of options and the staff was willing to accomadate requests and kept replenishing the buffet. There was small bar in the lobby for an evening aperatif. It was to cool to use the garden but it looked like a lovely area for summer use. We were thrilled with our stay and would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel021
Reviews.Content: I am just back on tripadvisor trying to find hotels in Zurich and realised I had forgotton to write a review for Hotel Abbazia. My husband and I found it a lovely place to stay especially for the price in comparison to other hotels in Venice. Very friendly staff who were most helpful. It is conveniently located very close to the bus and train stations which makes it much easier to drop your bags at your hotels as opposed to lugging them around the narrow streets of Venice before exploring. We enjoyed wandering the streets and doing a spot of shopping on the way to St Marks square whch is about a 30 minute walk-if you go straight there. Will definately stay here again when back in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for our stay in venice!”
Reviews.Author: maroDublin
Reviews.Content: i stayed in hotel abbazia with a group of friends for a four day break in march 2010. the staff were all very friendly and helpful the room was a very good size ,very cosy hotel near the train station (10 minute walk) also convenient to many nice cafes and restaurants. there was also a great selection for breakfast more variety than most hotels i have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE THE BELLS”
Reviews.Author: LadyKaKa
Reviews.Content: My only problem with this hotel, is its location to the bell tower of the monastry, which the hotel was once part of. It was enough to make me jump out of my skin as it is very loud and lasts about 5 minutes each time, early in the mornings (about 8am) and 3 times on a Sunday (even earlier). Apart from this hotel was delightful, rooms nice, staff and restaurant nice, good location to bus and train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great building.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAussieScot
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 teenage boys) stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Abbazia in Dec 2009. Venice - complete with sunny days, floods at king tides and snow - put on quite a show! We also travelled out to the islands - strongly recommend Burano with its delightful coloured houses and Torcello - what Venice might have looked like back in the 12th century. The hotel is very convenient - only 3mins walk from the railway station and 2mins from the Vaporeto. We were a little concerned that we might hear the trains - but it was a very quiet spot. A converted monastery, staying the hotel is certainly a fantastic experience - from the opulent red reception area, to the delightful courtyard (until a few inches of snow during our time there). Most of all the hotel was warm... and a welcome relief from the bone-chilling sub (or close to) zero temparatures outside. We stayed in the Abbazia's family room (2 doubles + 2singles) which was fine for our needs and we were generally up before the bells The staff were generally helpful and welcoming. The breakfasts were fine, although opinion was strongly divided in our family as to the quality of the coffee. All in all a remarkable hotel in a remarkable city.

Reviews.Title: “Too Dank and Musty”
Reviews.Author: JanBurke
Reviews.Content: Although this interesting and lovely looking abbey hotel is conveniently located, it is somewhat difficult to find in a narrow alley near the train station at the foot of a bridge. Our room was large, airy with several windows, and decently furnished. The bath was new, clean and comfortably large also. All very clean and the staff was very nice. However, there is no elevator and we were on the third floor with a tight winding staircase. Small inconveniences could be overlooked if the abbey was not pervaded by the inescapable odor of dankness. The problem was only exacerbated by dozens of bottles of overpowering perfumed oil and reed diffusers throughout the abbey. We had to move ours to the hallway and noticed that someone else had done the same thing. I must temper this review by mentioning that I am very sensitive to odors and any type of mold or dankness causes me headaches. Others may not be bothered by this as much as I. The hotel was not at all unclean and was much more reasonably priced than comparably appointed others.

Reviews.Title: “Singing its praises!”
Reviews.Author: sweedie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an exciting 3 night stay in Venice and were very impressed with this hotel. It was very warm and welcoming and the staff were very courteous and polite. The breakfast was good for Venice and the church bells ringing at 7.30am were the best kind of alarm clock. The location was excellent so we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Hotel Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: isis44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abbazia for 3 nights. It was easy to get to from the Bus Station and this is a consideration when booking a hotel in Venice - straight over the bridge and just 5 minute walk to the hotel. It's 2 mins walk to the Vaperetto and its also really easy to walk to any of the main sights from the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English. The room was not huge but we were hardly there and it was very clean and tidy and comfortable. The lounge is lovely with big comfortable chairs and retains the charactor of the old monastery and the prices were really reasonable too. Breakfast was fine - with a good choice to cater for everyone with cold meats, cheese, fruit and yoghurt as well as cakes and pastries. We had paid Â£226 for 3 nights with flights and breakfast included and I think this was exceptiopnal value for money. I would definately stay here again. Recommend Gino's restaurant and Pizzeria just round the corner. also had a good meal at the Chinese opposite although it looks a bit rough from the outside. There were lots of Chinese people eating there which was a good sign and I enjoyed my meal.

Reviews.Title: “great value and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoelChieroTemon
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is great, especially for a solo traveller. It has all of my expectation for a 3 star hotel in venice. The decoration is modern and not too venezian (big lamps and old style wall paper in the room), but surely showing character. My room is a double/twin bed for single use, which really big and warm. I was a little bit dissapointed to have my window not overlooked the garden. It was not a big issue though. :) I should also praise all of receptionists. They were gladly helping me with all of enquiries and gave me useful advices such as restaurants and means of transport to airport. One of receptionist also allowed me to settle the payment on the night before departure eventhough it was already past the scheduled time for early payment. Please note, the location is great, in my opinion. Because it is really convenient for the railway station and piazzale roma (the bus station). I prefer this location to allow me zero hussle for early morning departure to airport (<10mins walk to bus station and 20 mins journey time by bus). However, it is not that convenient for tourists who aim for attractions in san marco area and surroundings. You will need to walk more or less 30 minutes or take unbelievably expensive water bus. And the other thing, the hotel is providing free wifi. However, I cant connect it with my handset. Fortunately, they have 2 units of laptops that you can use only in lobby area. It is a plus for me, because the lobby itself is really comfortable. Please don't expect a first class breakfast. Abbazia has decent breakfast with tasteful and warm croissant, and hot beverage maker. It was more than enough for me. But I am quite sure most people want more breakfast varieties.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: hudsonhmeyer
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Abbazia from the moment that we arrived. Despite missing the quick turn (even after being aware of the directions), on a cold and wet Venice day the hotel was warm and welcoming, and didn't disappoint. The character of the old monastery is lovely, the rooms are comfortable, and the breakfasts enjoyable. Whilst there is no restaurant for dinners, the hotel is surrounded by restaurants so this caused no inconvenience. Staff were pleasant and able to advise on local attractions and transport options. In terms of location, the ease of access to the railway station was a feature when choosing accommodation, and this turned out to be a good decision when travelling to and from Venice by train. Also, proximity to the Grand Canal meant that the rest of Venice was easy to get to. Really enjoyed our stay, and will have pleasant memories of our time there.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: mrmundo
Reviews.Content: My wife and i recently spent an extended holiday here after our flight was cancelled due to the bad weather. We had taken our mothers who are 82 and 87, one of which travelled venice in her wheel chair with no problems. The hotel is in a perfect location close to public transport/shops etc. The hotel has a wonderful atmosphere with great character. We booked superior rooms which were lovely. The staff were exceptional and a credit to the hotel, I would return in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: crab67tkf
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice from Rome and turned left out of the train station and walked no more than 100 mtrs and saw the Hotel sign on the laneway so couldn't miss it. If you know to look up as you walk you will not miss it I guarentee you. You then turn left and walk another 100mtrs and the hotel entrance is on your left. Oh my god were the words that came out of my mouth. It looked like we were in the wrong hotel. This looks to expensive to be staying here. Our room was a quad and the gentleman at the desk said to leave our bags and a guy will bring them up which he did in no time and of course we gave him a small tip. Our room was huge. The bathroom was huge too. The bells did ring at 7:15 and were loud and the dogs joined in and there were 130 tolls but hey you're on holiday so you shouldn't be asleep wasting your day. We had a beautiful brekafast pastries, mini toasts, jams, cornflakes, museli, meats and cheese, torta, flans, a coffee machine all so yummy. The vaporetti is just back up the lane and a short trip to St Marco's Square. Venice was under water but had boardwalks set up to walk on so no problem. The cafe just out of the laneway charges a heap to sit down so don't sit - stand. Food is pretty expensive but we did go to the restaurant recommended by another trip advisor which is left out of the hotel laneway and walk to the bridge and turn left again and find a bar/pizzeria on the left about 200 mtrs up. Thanks for a wonderful stay Hotel Abbazia we will recommend this hotel to everyone who will listen. Internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext10
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel one street away from the station (ideal as you don't have to haul suitcases across Venice). The room was spacious and fairly basic, but clean and exceptionally comfortable. The lounge area downstairs is superb and the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great too. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, soo romantic :)”
Reviews.Author: bell44
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel very classy , good location , not long to walk around Venice !! Good service, very friendly at the desk, easy to get to the buss and train station just 5 min walk, very clean, rooms are smaller than you might think but that didnt matter at all the fact is you were in Venice and it felt like you were in Venice. The air conditioning wasnt very good, the room had to be very hot b4 it came on!! Then again maybe we didnt use it right not sure ! Any way all toghether though lovely hotel and lovely place, if I go to venice again I would go to that hotel again, the garden was so cute and breakfast was very nice :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Zoeysgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and young adult children stayed at this hotel from December 24 through December 27. The three rooms we were given were very nice and rather spacious for a European hotel. However, I should note that we were given a free upgrade to some of the larger rooms. The hotel is a little hard to find because, like many Venice hotels, it is hidden down a somewhat narrow alley. Nonetheless, it is worth finding. The hotel used to be a monastery and still has that look and feel. Most importantly, the staff were wonderful. They helped us select and get reservations at two delicious restaurants for Christmas Eve and Christmas dinner, helped with tours and were just absolutely great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: msr01
Reviews.Content: Great location: Walking distance from the railway station and bus stop. Rooms were large and very clean. Good value by Venice standards.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pandkgee
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice with 2 friends who had done all the booking. We arrived in pouring rain but fortunatelt the hotel was very easy to find, a five minute walk from the bus station. The Vaporetto was also within a two minute walk. The hotel was wonderful, the staff extremely friendly/helpful. Our room was large and very clean with most facilities you could wish for - the only thing it lacked was hot drink facilities - how we longed for a cup of tea after walking afar! Venice is VERY expensive but a marvellous place to visit - I wold certqainly return to Venice and the Hotel - even the bells each morning from the church next door (which is a must to visit) are in keeping and the dog barks in tune with them!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel grate location”
Reviews.Author: sharon3001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights between 2-6th December. The Hotel has a great location, we took a bus from the airport, by far the cheapest option at just 2.50 Euros. The hotel is a short walk from the bus station, ideal for the train station if you will arrive by train. It took us about 25 minuites to get to St Marks, the walk is easily negotiated and there is plenty to look at on route. Everywhere in Venice is an easily reached on foot. We had a double superior room, the bathroom was very clean, though only a bathtub and hand held over tub shower head. The room spotless and overlooking the garden so very nice room. Lots of people have commented on the 'quality of the breakfast' neither I nor my husband would share the opinions that the breakfast is that good. We have both travelled throughout Europe a lot, we felt that breakfast was of a poor quality in terms of the food and drink it self and choice, 3 meats and two cheeses???!! Bread wasn't nice and croissants cold with no facility to warm them. Comparitivley to other Hotels I have stayed in breakfast was just OK,it did the job. It was also a bit hap hazard, you often had to find your own cutlery and plates, as this is a hotel not a bed and breakfast one would expect better service. Reception staff were very helpful, friendly and we would recomed this hotel. In terms of VFM overall it is good.It doesn't have facilities for evening meals,not a problem as there are loads of good places to eat in Venice. There is a bar though we didn't use it so can't comment. We went to the museums and if you plan to do that get a museum pass, it will save you money they can be purchased cheaper in adavance of your trip which we hadn't appreciated. Hope to return to Venice will use this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “"WOW, AMAZING" great located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Abbazia is possibly the best located nice hotel in Venice. It is a very quick & easy 3 minute walk from the Train Station. Everything in Venice is within walking distance & if you dont want to walk, the water ferries/taxis are a 2 min walk away. Being an old convent, the building is very grand with large rooms & hallways. There is a great big old room just off the lobby with a bar & is a great place to unwind after walking the alleyways of venice. The rooms were clean & comfortable & had all we needed. The staff were the best & friendliest we came across in our travels. There is also a pretty little courtyard however we did not find any time to sit out there. Our rooms were on the second floor, & there is no lift, however for a small tip, the staff gladly carry your bags up for you. Breakfast was also very good & held in another quite large room. Would definately stay there again, it is of really great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jandbsev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbazia between 3 and 7th December 2009. We could not fault its amenities, cleanliness, and the professional and friendly staff. It is ideally located close to the main transport facilities and the Grand Canal. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but serves breakfast which is of high quality and of sufficient variety to please the most picky teenager and conservatice older traveller. Our bedroom was clean and well furnished and the bathroom was well equipped with good quality towels and toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train station, clean, friendly, and overall A+”
Reviews.Author: XTim
Reviews.Content: One thing I didn't want to worry about when traveling to Venice was having to lug our luggage all over town trying to get to our hotel, yet stay somewhere nice. Hotel Abbazia allowed us to do just that. It's very close to the train station. You won't need to cross any bridges. It down a very quiet and safe walkway, about 100 meters from the front steps of the train station. Even though it's so close to the train station, it was still very quiet. However, there is a church very near, and church bells ring very loud around 7:15 and 8:15 each morning. The staff spoke english well, and were all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean, and VERY spacious for european standards. The bathrooms were also clean, modern, and spacious as well. The "bus stop" or vaporetto stand is very close to the hotel, which makes getting around easy. We chose to walk everywhere, and it was no problem. The wifi was free! If we ever make it back to Venice, we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “doubt you could find a better located hotel in Venice .”
Reviews.Author: Traghetti
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay in Venice and would endorse all the good comments on Hotel Abbazia. The location is perfect, no difficulties in finding the hotel from bus or train station , yet very quietly situated in a side alley no more than 100 m from all the vaporetto stops on the Grand Canal. Room was comfortable and spacious, breakfast very good and the staff friendly and helpful. Yes the bell does wake you at 7.20 with over 130 loud tolls accompanied by dogs barking but really there is so much to see that it is an authentically Venetian wakening. Recommend the Chorus Pass if you like to visit churches and see paintings in situ, 9 euros for 16 different churches tho we only made 7 of them!! Be prepared to get lost as you wander the streets, it's amazing what you come across. Venice is expensive for eating out , again if you venture off the beaten track it becomes better quality and value. The Cannaregio area to the north of the hotel is where the locals eat and there are many options. Really enjoyed our stay , what a city!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: kaz37Somerset
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing long weekend in Venice with my partner. The Hotel Abbazia is a great base locationwise to explore Venice either by Vaporetto (stop two minutes walk) or by foot! The hotel is an old converted monestry and is very clean with a great garden (also very quiet, accept for the bells in the morning!). The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful and really cannot be faulted. They helped us organise to go to a Vivaldi concert (that is a definite must if you are in Venice - Fabulous!) Our room was adequate, although on the small size, but since you don't spend much time in your room, we were more than happy. Breakfast is fantastic with a great choice with the usual ham, cheese, rolls, coisannts, pastries, etc. One thing I will point out, which has got nothing to do with the hotel, is that Venice is INCREDIBLY expensive. We thought it would be expensive, but not on the level of paying euro 6.50 for one small beer(!) . We only discovered on our last day that if you stand at the bar and drink, it is a lot cheaper than sitting down outside! The food is also extremaly expensive in restaurants and not that great either, unless you know where to go to eat. Fortunately, my sister knows Venice well and was there during our stay. She took us to a fantastic pizza restaurant where all the locals go to eat, although I don't think we would ever find it again on our own! Its a shame that Venice has become so pricey (apparently and sadly only one third of Venetians are now living in Venice, the rest are holiday apartments). Its unnecessary and spoils it due to prices. All in all I strongly recommend this hotel as great value and particuarly well located. Book it now, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: phil˙
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes from railway station up a narrow alley. Church next door provides wake-up alarm at 06:30. Room had a view of a scenic patio (and that church) (see photo). Double bed is indeed two pushed together but quite comfortable. Flat screen tv in room, library of discarded paperback in hallway. Lavish breakfast room with lavish breakfast (see photo). Breakfast was Buffet-style and there were rolls, meats, cheeses, hot hard boiled eggs, pastries, fruits, juices and coffees and hot chocolate, jams and Nutella. We each made a sandwich for the road. On request, the aimiable and knowledgeable desk clerk directed us to a trattoria patrionized by locals called Antique Mole just off the former Jewish Ghetto. Great food.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: JLV0909
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. At first glance, this hotel is really nice. The rooms were big, the staff was nice, but upon closer inspection, things changed. The "big bed" was really two beds pushed together which would have been fine if one of the beds didn't have a huge cave in the middle of it. This left us to try and squeeze on to 1 twin bed. Since we were only there for 1 night, we didn't bother to complain. The lobby had a funky smell and there are no elevators! The staff did take our luggage for us, but even so, that poor guy had to take 4 gigantic bags up and down 4 flights of stairs. We had a deluxe room which was big, however, the windows opened up to a dumpster and I'd rather have a small room with a bed that is somewhat sturdy. We were up all night listening to dogs barking in the alley that our room overlooked. The restaurant that was recommended by the staff was horrible! In fact, it was our worst meal in 14 days of vacation. The location of the hotel was perfect, though, I must say that b/c you didn't have to take a water taxi to get to it, it was literally steps away from the train station. Aside from that, there really isn't anything great to say. I wouldn't go back nor would I recommend this place to anyone, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: misstiny
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Abbazia after lunch and before our room was ready. We were told not to worry and were promptly sat down by the friendly staff and given glasses of prosecco and crisps. A perfect start to the holiday. We had booked a superior room and this was huge, with high quality finishings and furniture with a generous size bathroom. The tv and mini bar were a good addition with the mini bar prices being very reasonable for Venice. The hotel is a beautiful historic building with a lovely garden which unfortunately we could not enjoy as much as we would have liked due to the cold weather but it would be perfect in the summer. The hotel is located in a quiet street with no sounds from the outside other than the bells each morning. We will warn you - these are loud and do go on for quite a long time. However you do get used to them and really it did add to the Venice atmosphere. The church where the bells were next door is definitely worth a visit. The hotel breakfast was also very good. Plenty of choice and always a table and the staff were again most friendly and helpful. As for Venice itself. A lovely city which is much more compact that you first think. It is so quick and easy to walk everywhere. The Vaporetto is also a quick and reasonably cheap way of exploring the city. We would recommend the restaurants on Campo Santa Magherita and also the irish bar on this square where drinks were reasonably priced. We would also recommend the irish bar further up the street from the hotel (Lista de Spagna). This is opposite the church on the small square and serves very reasonably priced drinks with a good atmosphere. Overall our stay in Venice was very good. We highly recommend the hotel and could not fault anything about it. Perfect location, perfect rooms and perfect staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: rakurz
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research on hotels in Venice, I settled on the Abbazia. When we got there and saw the place, we were absolutely thrilled. The location is super convenient - practically next door to the train station and a vaporetto stop. The hotel itself is beautifully appointed. The arrangement of the hallways is a little strange, but once you get used to that, it is great. Our room was plenty big for us. The shower was great and had good pressure. The breakfast included with your room is also great. Sometimes these breakfasts can end up being little more than pastries and coffee. This one had meats and cheeses, eggs, cereal, various types of croissants, etc. The best thing about the hotel, though, is the super friendly staff. They could not have been nicer and that is one of the most important things when you stay somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean with character, charm, & a fine staff with character as well and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Califswimmer
Reviews.Content: Finally writing as life stays all too busy! Would and did invite all staff to our home in California as they added to the hotel's character as well as were tremendously helpful. The room with full bathrm (shower brand new) was charming and quite clean (and I am tough about this aspect). The bells are as delightful as the staff as they awaken you with an old world charm reminding you, "WOW this is not a dream, you really are in Venezia", plus no time to sleep in with oh so much to take in! Of course, the best way is not only by vaporetto but by foot to explore where the tourists don't go, but the lovely people of Venezia live! We not only recommend Hotel Abbazia, but surely have on our list a return trip! Fabio, Raffaele everyone there to make your visit a fine holiday! One bad thing only: you have to return home, but months later it still makes us smile just reminiscing our joyous time at the Hotel Abbazia.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be in Venice, like home”
Reviews.Author: johnina
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was memorable. From registering with Fabio and getting the run down on where to go, to the fabulous breakfast and wonderfully hospitable and friendly front desk team of Aluise and Mirko. The nicest people we met on our trip. I would strongly recommend this hotel, which is located steps away form the Venice train station and a block away from the water taxi, but yet quiet. Loved it, loved it and would definitely go back. The monestary bells work us up every morning so we got a jump on the day. It was a great experience. Hope I get back to this lovely place again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is so well located, lots of character, and wonderful front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: leafer516
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an old abbey, located on an alleyway around the corner from the train station and a short walk (over the new bridge) to the bus depot. A few steps over a bridge in the other direction and you have walking access to all of Venice, or hop on a boat at the foot of the bridge. The guys at the front desk are friendly, helpful, and have cheerful attitudes. The rooms aren't large but are clean and comfortable. There's a lovely garden where you can take your breakfast. A great experience w/o paying the high prices of other Venice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Little Charmer in a great location convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: BuckleySteve
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past couple of years and have had a great experience both times. It is extremely close and convenient to both the train station and the car rental area. I would recommend that you map it out beforehand though because it is on a tiny alley-like street that is easy to miss. The hotel itself has a beautiful old-world lobby, friendly staff, and good rooms. There is a convenient water taxi stop a block away from the hotel that you can catch to go to St. Mark's Square and the rest of Venice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Charm”
Reviews.Author: sgmSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming, in a quiet calle minutes away from the hustle and bustle. The staff are so pleasant and helpful, the breakfast pretty good (though absolutely terrible coffee), but the main outstanding feature is its proximity to the train station - literally a one-minute walk. For those planning to take the train around Italy, closeness to the stations should be your number-one priority when booking hotels - it will make your life so much easier!! and especially in Venice, full of bridges! Our room was huge for the 3 of us, looking at the floor plan it was 40% bigger than the other rooms on our floor, which was great! my only gripe would be that there is no shower, only a bath. It's not cheap but nothing in Venice is - you may as well go for convenience and comfort. p.s. we found all restaurants in Venice disappointing - tourist menus, half-hearted food, bad service. any recommendations would be appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Abbazia!”
Reviews.Author: jabburlingtonVT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbazia the night before our cruise, and for three days afterward. The location is excellent: when you are exhausted from an overnight flight, it's very close to the bus terminal bringing you from the airport, and it is steps away from the vaperettos (water buses). The desk staff speaks English very well, and are extremely helpful. Be aware, though, that this is very much a European hotel: rooms are smallish, and the first room we were in had a tub, a hand held shower, but no shower curtain. We asked for, and were given upon our return from the cruise, a room with a shower stall. . In addition there is no elevator, but a porter was always available to carry bags. The breakfast included a large variety of cereals, meat, baked goods, very much in the European tradition. Yes, the bells from next door can wake you up, but do you want to sleep the day away when you're in Venice?

Reviews.Title: “clean, close to train station, great breakfast, wi-fi internet.”
Reviews.Author: hphp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and a soild 3 star hotel. I loved that it was close to the train station (within walking distance) so no need to take a ferry. It is a bit further from the main attractions (St Marks square) but really Venice is so small you can walk everywhere within a few minutes so not that big of a deal. They also have a pretty decent breakfast and wi-fi internet too! It is a bit difficult to find though, it's in a narrow alley so ask around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel near Train Station - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EndyBOSTON
Reviews.Content: This is hotel exceeded our expectations. We went for the non-smoking superior room. Price was just right and room quality is superb. Very clean and comfy. The receptionist was very polite and helpful. There was a lot of variety at Breakfast. The garden space outside was very romantic and peaceful. Since this place was a monastery in the past, there is a "wakeup" bell at around 7:30, but at that time I was awake anyways. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION - This place is located 2-minute walk from the station, no kidding. Trust me, you don't want to pull your luggage through the uneven streets of Venice. Even though it was near the station, you couldn't hear any of the trains. The hotel is also located near a Vaporetto stop (bus). The entrance is easy to miss, so be careful. As you walk out of the station and take a left, it's the first narrow way to your left. Would definitely make it here again.

Reviews.Title: “If using the train, this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Melbites
Reviews.Content: We were using the train in and out of Venice so this is the perfect spot, literally in the first street from the station but yet very quiet and peaceful at night. Considering you are charged to take luggage in Water Buses and Taxis etc, it is worth considering if you are planning the same. The staff were brilliant, every request dealt with quickly. Lots of local info available, free internet services. Breakfast was fine, not the best but a good range of food choices. Always get up early to get the best picks! Delightful courtyard garden but Venice does have mossies so beware. Overall this hotel suited our visit perfectly. Very close to the Grand Canal and therefore transport of every kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the Abbazia hotel in December 2008. We chose the hotel for its location close to Piazzale Roma, which is where the buses from the airport will drop you off. Keep in mind if you are walking in Venice with luggage there are more than enough bridges and steps to make it a tiring journey! We found the staff to be friendly and helpful when asked upon. The room was a nice size easily accommodated a cot for our daughter. The breakfast was typical continental. We walked everywhere from the hotel, this is part of the fun of visiting Venice. Overall we had a great experience in Venice and the Abbazia hotel contributed to that. Yes there are the bells close by that ring in the morning. That wasn't a concern of ours as we were up early anyway. We also had time for a day trip to Verona which I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: groveavenue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Abbazia for 3 days prior to cruise..had large room ,very clean had air conditioning,lovely as it was hot outside.Very friendly staff ,clean bathroom.Nice outdoor garden.Tasty breakfast included .Booked directly on line ,real easy . Near station so no need to drag bags over bridges.Bus from airport stops at Plaza de Roma and one Vaporetta stop to station then easy walk go left at first alley see hotel sign. Bought vaporetta pass for the 3 days and it was well worth it as used many times to go everywhere and never had to stand in line to buy tickets..there is 1.2 or 3 day pass.Inexpensive eating choices on Lista de Spania just near hotel,much less than in the San Marco area. Hope this is helpful

Reviews.Title: “Very likely one of the best deals in Venice”
Reviews.Author: OdessaMama
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in other Venice hotels, so I won't compare - will just tell you about this one. When I arrived I was greeted by two very friendly and colorful italians with a great sense of humor at the reception desk who spoke great English. My room was very nicely decorated, fresh and spotless. Bathroom fixtures were new and immaculate. My room faced an absolutely beautiful garden, and I could hear birds churping outside my window. I had breakfast in that garden every morning. The hotel has free wireless high speed internet. The hotel is around the corner from the train station and right next to the water bus stop, which will take you anywhere in Venice, so the location is very convinient. Also, I loved the neigborhood - one block to the side of the tourist path and you're in a one of the quaintest and most authentic places in Venice. The staff is very helpful and fun. The breakfast was not the greatest - two varieties of cold cuts, one kind of cheese, some fruit, yogurts, cereal and breads, but no vegetables or prepared food. There's no restaurant in the hotel, so if you get hungry in the evening you can't order food to your room. The bilding is a walk up - just like all others in Venice, but the staff carries your luggage up and down, so as long as you can carry yourself up the stairs it shouldn't be a problem. Another flaw is the bells from the monastery right next to the hotel. They ring those bells for several minutes around 7 am every morning and they were heard loudly in my room (I kept my windows open). There was one night when I was so tired that they didn't wake me up, but on all other nights they did. I had no problem falling back to sleep right away though. If you're sensitive to noises and have a hard time falling back asleep, this might be a problem for you. Overall - great stay, tons of fun and wonderful memories. Will stay here again if I'm ever in Venice - can't beat the location, the garden, the fun Italians at the reception and the great rooms. On a side note - they have one room, which is very small, with a single bed and a small window facing the street. The bells are not heard as much there, but you can hear voices on the street with the window open. I negotiated to stay there for 50 euros/night for two nights when I extended my stay. Compared to 180 euros/night this is an amazing deal! People pay a little less to stay in hostels and here you have your own room and all the services of a great hotel for just 50/night. Inquire about that room if you're on a budget. HAve fun in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “it's true what they say about Abbazia - great location, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: GardenerLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: I chose Abbazia from tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed. I've been to Venice several times before but never found a hotel that was right. This one works - good location, at Ferrovia, handy for lots of Vaporetto lines; air con that works; and friendly staff who want to help. It's sadly rare that you turn up at a hotel and they say "ah yes, you wanted a room with X and Y" - at Abbazia they this right. Free wi-fi went down well with my teenager. And, as they say, in Cannaregio you can easily get away from the tourists. We found our way to bar/pizzeria Ai Tre Archi, on the Cannaregio canal, with gorgeous sunset views while we ate good food at resonable prices. A Grand Canal view would have been way more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelForever58
Reviews.Content: This is a very simple, uncomplicated place to stay in Venice. We stayed at the Hotel two years ago, and thought it met our budget needs when we were paying for two nights for a group of 5. This time my wife and I stayed here one night before boarding a cruise. We stayed in a Standard Room, which is very simple, clean and functional. We spent most of our time out of the hotel, sightseeing. Showers are very tight and snug-- there is not a lot of room to move around without accidentally popping open the shower door. There is no elevator, but hotel staff will bring your bags up and down the stairs for you. We stored our bags with the hotel while we went to Murano, but asked them to keep our bags in the front office instead of the luggage room. Breakfast is included and is a self serve buffet-- hard boiled eggs, croissants, cheese, salami, cold cuts, prosciutto, coffee, orange juice. We took the hotel's free shuttle to Murano to a glassmaking company called CAM-- it was truly free with no obligation to buy anything. [I'm a believer that there are no free lunches, so they must recover the cost some other way.] We were treated to a personalized tour with a glassmaking demonstration. Much of the Murano glass they produce is art. Many glassmakers are on holiday in August, but CAM has a glassmaker who does demonstrations for tourists visiting the factory. Afterwards, we were on our own to walk through Murano and shop in different stores. We hopped on the waterbus to get back to the hotel. A few tips on arriving and leaving....We arrived in Venice via Marco Polo airport. The first and more expensive way is to get here is via private water taxi-- 95 euros, which is pricey by current exchange rates, but worth the splurge if you are arriving here at sunset and want to take in the views. The other way to get here is to take a land taxi at the airport to Piazzale Roma, and hop the waterbus at Piazzale Roma one stop to the Ferrovia stop. It's about 35 euros for the land taxi, plus the cost of a waterbus ticket, which you'll likely buy anyway, to ride up and down the Grand Canal. The other way is via water bus from the airport, which we haven't tried. Venice is one of our favorite places to visit, and we would come again to visit. We would also consider this hotel again. The hotel is close to the train station, and when we were here the first time, Venice was our first stop before we traveled via train to Florence. You can easily roll your bags from the hotel to the train station. To get to the cruise terminal, we took the waterbus one stop from the Ferrovia stop to Piazzale Roma, then caught a land taxi to the cruise ship terminal. The land taxi cost us 9 euros to get to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best choices in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MyWave68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Abbazia in March of this year, but I am just now getting around to writing the review. This hotel had everything we were looking for, and I couldnt have been happier or more satisfied with our stay there. First of all, whether you take the train in or fly in, the hotel is very easy and accessible. It is literally just steps from the train station, and when taking the shuttle from the airport, you simply have to cross the bridge over the canal, go past the train station, and its the first street on the left. I say street, but its actually just a walkway, as is all "streets" in Venice. You will walk right past the street if you are not careful, so just remember when you pass the train station, take the first left you come to (right past the little restaurant). There is also water taxi access right there as well. The hotel itself is very nice, and was originally a friars convent and church. Very old world and romantic, not modern at all. But exactly what you would picture in a Venice hotel. We were traveling with my girlfriend and my two teenage children, and were very happy to find out we could get a quadruple room, with a kingsize bed and two single beds. If you have ever traveled in Europe, you know this isnt easy to come by. There was a slightly odd combination in our room of completely old world feel to the room but a completely modern looking bathroom, but once again, it was perfect for us. The hotel had a wonderful staff, the people at the front desk were very friendly and accommodating, and in the evening they opened the bar area, the bartender was very neat and precise, and it was a nice gathering area for people who werent quite ready for bed in the evening, even after walking all over Venice during the day! They also offered a basic continental breakfast every day, which was nothing special, but was nice to be included in the cost. And finally, the hotel was very reasonably priced, I cant remember exactly but I am thinking we only paid like $300 US for a two night stay. This review is mainly for the hotel, which I highly recommend, but in general, our stay in Venice was amazing, it is so beautiful and full of history, it was all very wonderful. You should go! p.s. Dont forget the gelato! mmmmmm.......

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: christyEngland
Reviews.Content: Following 3 fantastic days in Verona arrived in Venice by Train, hotel couldn't be closer, approx 200 yards. Hotel is down a very narrow alley opposite the bridge, inbetween two restaurants. Very busy area due to close proximity to rail and bus station, but the hotel is very quiet. Charming building. Excellent reception staff, very friendly, courtious, informative, helpful. Offer detailed information on directions and local transport. Room was comfortable. Reasonably priced minibar, T.V. double wardrobe with hangers, safe. Spacious bathroom with shower, w.c., bidet & basin. Hairdryer. Complimentary toiletries. Rooms cleaned daily, fresh towels daily. Breakfast good, the usual cereal, yogurts, pastries, bread, jams, cold meats & cheese, cake, fruit salad & fresh fruit. Juice, tea & coffee. Pleasant garden area. Bar is reasonably priced compared to bars & restaurants. The streets in this area are not as upmarket as in the St Marks/Rialto area. Venice is notoriously expensive so be prepared to spend. We visited 3 years ago and noticed a marked increase since last visit.
