Also be prepared to ask prices in bars and restaurants before you order any drinks etc or you may get a surprise when the bill arrives. We sat at one bar very hot & thristy, ordered a small beer and a can of coke and the bill was 10 euros !!!!! On our last day our flight was not until the evening. Left our luggage with reception and went out for the day. Returned and used the bathroom to change & freshen up before leaving. We departed from the bus terminal, again only a short walk, over bridge crossing grand canal. Overall was very impressed with the hotel, in our opinion exceeds its 3 stars. No lift so anyone with mobility problems may struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: dinmap
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location. Just around the corner from the train station and 5 min walk from the bus station, which is very helpful with your luggage. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. Very interesting since it used to be a monastery. There is no elevator though. The courtyard is beautiful, take some time and relax in the afternoon or enjoy you breakfast. The breakfast buffet was very good. Extra points for the very friendly and helpful staff. Be aware of the bells early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelIntl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location just around the corner from the train station. It was so much easier than taking a vaporetto with all your luggage. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. Very interesting since it used to be a monastery. There is no elevator, but they will carry your bags to your room. The courtyard is beautiful; we enjoyed a glass of wine outside in the evenings. Breakfast was very good. Staff was very friendly. Free internet with a laptop available for loan. Lots of shopping and restaurants around the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, but beware of the bell!”
Reviews.Author: VasilisAlimos_Athens
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent, the spot very convinient, the staff very friendly and experienced, the room charming and spacous, in generall all were perfect, BUT UNFORTUNATELY : there is an active monastery next door to the hotel and the monks insist on ringing their bell 150 times at 7:30 am and again 150 times at 8:30 am (one hour later on Sundays). Of course the hotel has nothing to do with it, but in the end why paying 200 euros per night (for the quadruple room) when not be able to sleep in hte morning?

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: paxfred
Reviews.Content: convenient to the train station, and short walk to the waterways. Quiet. Breakfast buffet in central courtyard (it used to be a carmalite monastery) or inside. THe courtyard would be a nice place to just come and sit quietly and enjoy the outside (though we never took the time to do it). The staff were friendly and very helpful. THe rooms were clean and comfortable with airconditioning that was much appreciated in the oppressive heat that we experienced during the three nights that we stayed there. All in all a good experience. Nest time I go there I would hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-Great location!”
Reviews.Author: melissa328
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights before leaving for a Mediterranean cruise. We chose this hotel beacuse of the close proximity to the train station, reasonable price, and other reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. This little hotel down a small alleyway was a great find. The staff was super helpful and friendly. Every time I passed the reception desk, I had questions and they were always glad to answer and give tips and advice. This hotel included breakfast, which was very good and you could eat inside or take your breakfast to a pretty outside courtyard. The hotel was small and did not have an elevator, but as soon as we checked in, someone was called over immediately to take our bags to our room on the second floor. There are only three floors to the hotel, so it's really no big deal to walk up a flight or two of stairs, especially when all you do in Venice is walk. ALOT! Our room very very small, but fine for us. Our bathroom was actually pretty large, with a huge shower that had two very large shower heads in a long rectanuglar shape. Two people could comfortably shower at the same time. We inquired about taking a vaporetto to Murano and the staff offered a free water taxi and tour of a glass factory with no strings attached. That was a pleasant surprise. The location was good. We were pretty far from the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square, but we had no problem walking there. It was fun exploring the back alleyways, which were much more quiet than the main routes. There were also two really nice restaurants that we ate in not that far from our hotel. We were given a good map and directions. We did get lost a little bit, but isn't that the fun part of being in Venice anyway? All in all, I would recommend this hotel. Great breakfast, staff, good location, and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and fabulous reception staff”
Reviews.Author: BurnsideBunch
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from trip adviser ratings - and were really, really happy. The location, if travelling by train (out the front door of train station, turn left walk approx 60m, take tiny alley on left - look up on wall for street name - and walk another 25m or so) is perfect and leaving similarly easy if flying out as we were - walk back past train station, straight on over new modern bridge and buy bus ticket, think was 1 or 2 euro, and you're dropped at the door of th airport. Decide from the start how long you'll be riding the water taxis as the more days you buy at once the cheaper it is and if you stay here you'll clock up some water taxi trips. We went from here to Murano, Burano and the Lido...but still missed so many things we wanted to do in Venice so will have to go back again!! The staff were superb, friendly & helpful, breakfast was more than adequate...but no, do not stay here if you cannot manage stairs or cope with all your own baggage as others have noted. And yes, there was also only the showerhead over the bath but that didn't bother us at all. The room was lovely and LARGE which is not the norm in European Hotels...as well as spotlessly clean and the bed was huge and comfortable. We would stay here again because we liked the immediate surrounds, the price was good and arriving by train and leaving by plane it was a perfect spot. NB/ we lost our wheels on the uneven walk from the hotel to the bus...apparently they could have arranged a porter for us to take our bags but it wasn't a problem so if you're doing lots of locations and wheeling your bags make sure not to take the case on its last legs (as we did) because the uneven streets will finish any almost over suitcase off for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EAGIN
Reviews.Content: Nice and friendly staff, very cozy and romantic place to stay, very clean room, we were allowed to have our small Yorki dog with us. If we ever come back to venice, we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, friendly and helpful reception”
Reviews.Author: DavidEAuckland
Reviews.Content: If you don't want the problem of lugging suitcases through Venice to find your hotel, this is an excellent place to stay. It's all of about five minutes from the rail and eight minutes maximum from the bus station. Easy to find and close to interesting places to eat at, and visit, in the Canareggio area, such as Gheto. Easy walk (or boat ride) to Rialto etc. Quiet location, good breakfast, excellent service, friendly staff. I would certainly stay there again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a three star hotel - it's at the upper end of that band.

Reviews.Title: “We were very very happy with our time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: WendyAnneM
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried because there had been suggestions not to stay near the train station, but we are so glad we stayed at this hotel. The location was perfect- you tend to get lost in Venice, so having the train station as a point to aim for every night was nice. Also, the hotel was very nice, the rooms were very well air-conditioned (and that was important this June and July!). The stafff was very friendly, the breakfasts were good and plentiful. And, because we drove, we only had a short walk dragging our luggage from the garage to the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SaundraBF
Reviews.Content: Located super close to teh train station, this was a great place. The breakfast was one of the best i had on our European trip. The room was large and the bathroom was fantastic with 2 vanities. I suggest booking the junior suite whether you're in a group of 4, like we were, or less. The staff was very charming and helpful and the backyard terrace was stunning. I have not a complain to offer on this find. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: ysouk
Reviews.Content: I got to stay one night here because of over-booking at its sister hotel (Abbazia de luxe). The interior was nice and it does look like nice place to stay. However, one of the service staff was not very friendly and when I asked for some warm water, he made some sarcastic remarks. I also asked if I can switch on the air-con but was told that there is no air-con available in the room. I find it very strange, didn't I saw in one of response to a review that they installed the air-con last year. So whose telling the truth? When I checked out of the hotel, the rate was different from what I was told and the service staff was able to give me correct rate without going through any hassle. But I guess they really need to work on their service. Be that as it may, the hotel has a very nice garden and breakfast was good. It is near the train station but not as near as its sister hotel (Abbazia De Luxe). Although Abbazia De Luxe is only a B&B and not ranked as high as this hotel, I would much prefer to stay at Abbazia De Luxe instead of Abbazia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: EFAH
Reviews.Content: Very close to train station. Cute room but "A/C" would not let you cool the room to a temperature below 27 celsius. The tub had a shower hose. Difficult to use. The staff was very nice. The price for Venice was good so I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: JG-10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, and the front desk couldn't have been more friendly or accommodating (Mirko and Matteo were standouts), they instantly told us to leave our bags in the lobby for them to bring up to our room for us, and they patiently and cheerfully answered all of our questions and gave great suggestions. When we spoke of Murano, they mentioned that they offer their guests a free water taxi ride there (from 9 am to 12 noon), with a free tour of a glass factory. We took them up on this offer, and we wound up getting a private ride there, which was quite enjoyable after all of those crowded vaporetti rides. [To those who might want to do this, you should know that when you arrive at Murano, a guide will take you to the Cam glass factory and give you a soft sell to try to get you to buy some glass wares. We needed some wine glasses anyway and did purchase some, but you are not obligated to buy anything, just be prepared for the sales pitch.] Their private courtyard was a quiet sanctuary, a very nice touch. However, there could have been a better food selection for breakfast, the only hot items were hard boiled eggs. We could have done without the loud church bells waking us up at 7:15 am our first day, but that was the only negative thing we could think of about this place, other than the lack of storage space in our small room. The bathroom was large, clean, and modern, which was a nice surprise considering this is a converted monastery! We would definitely recommend this hotel to others, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect environment for Venice and fab staff”
Reviews.Author: redhead49
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the outside (up a back alley, looks a bit grim), the interior is beautifully and tastefully renovated from the friary it used to be. The room was large, spacious and airy, but my favourite bits were the bar (complete with pulpit) and the courtyard garden. If I had to be picky, I'd say they could do with a lift (no offer of help up the stairs with suitcases) and the shower was rubbish (just a shower head at hip height over the bath). The staff were wonderful - when we checked in, not only did the guy on reception recognise where we were from, but also told us the nickname of our local football team! Incredible!

Reviews.Title: “an excellent choice, close to Piazzale Roma, vaporetto stops & the train station”
Reviews.Author: TravellingIrishlass
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly service at reception. Spotlessly clean room, though unfortunately not with a view over the lovely courtyard garden. Best selling point is the location, which is easy walking distance from where the airport bus drops you at Piazzale Roma and close to the station (though we could not hear any trains). Hotel itself is lovely with a wonderful bar area with comfy sofas in what was the old chapel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been perfect except for one very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: cfrankli
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Charming hotel. Restful. It was too hot and we requested the thermostat adjusted and had to listen to a lecture on demanding Americans!! If I ignore this individual, I will recommend this hotel. Just know that if you need the room to be very cool with no humidity, you may want to stay elsewhere in the very hot summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous Place to Stay-Worth the Splurge”
Reviews.Author: Catsmeow3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Abbazia for four nights at the very end of Oct. 2008. We were spending 3 weeks in Europe and these were our last nights in Italy. Out of every place we stayed, this was my absolute favorite hotel. We chose to splurge a bit here and had more bargain types the rest of the trip with the exception of our hotel in Spoleto. We arrived late on a very rainy night and it was a great relief to just go down the steps from the train station and make a very short and easy walk to the Abbazia. I failed to get the name of the gentleman who checked us in, but he was very friendly. Our room was large, lovely and overlooking the courtyard (Double Superior-no smoking). A king bed and big bathroom too. There was no shower curtain (like I found everywhere in Italy this made showering without flooding the bathroom a challenge, luckily we had perfected that by then) :) Despite being very near the train station and water taxi station, it was very quiet. The only disturbance, which I found made our stay even more enjoyable, was the church bells. From what I remember they rang around 7:15am and I stopped counting the number of tolls. On Saturday they rang every hour after around 7am up 'til ???. We could see the bell tower from our bedroom windows. Loved it! Breakfast, buffet style, was nice and a sufficient way to start the day. Nothing extensive. Set up was in a dining area and the garden seating would have been great in warmer weather. The large seating room upon entering the hotel is very nice with a bar. Great place to relax before catching the train or meet up in. There is a good size "closet" for luggage storage if needed. Seeing the monastery past in the surroundings added great ambiance. The location was great. Venice is easy to get lost in, but since the hotel is so very near the train station (Ferrovia) following those yellow signs could get you back. It is also on a "main" directional strip that you can follow signs to favorite sites....again, though, getting lost or not being able to find what you are looking for is easy! I would like to thank Matteo who was frequently manning the front desk. He was hysterical and extremely helpful with recommendations, directions and just being nice to talk to. I would love to go back to Venice and would most certainly stay at Hotel Abbazia again.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of fun! SUCH a great, easy location from train station!”
Reviews.Author: sjsandy
Reviews.Content: Soooo would recommend this place because of the location alone. You can always find your way back "home", where that isn't always the case if you stay ON the island....yet you are close to everything. We shared the HUGE HUGE quad room with friends (one oversized, lumpy king and two twins--well spread apart), and it was, as I said--HUGE and spacious and Venice-like in age. The bathroom was well separated by a hall closet (we think maybe it had been a priest's quarters or something in an earlier life....), so there was a lot of privacy. People at desk were super helpful and the internet worked beautifully. The breakfast was very good, also. We will stay here again if we come back to Venice. Last time we stayed on the island in a very cool place but got incredibly lost every time trying to return to it....no problem here and we rolled ourselves to the train and back in 3 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL AND CHARMING HOTEL AND STAFF”
Reviews.Author: NYTRAVELAGENT1
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a stay at the Hotel Abbazia which I booked for a small group of 15. This was the first part of our stay in Italy and we could not have asked for a better way to start our vacation. From the moment I arranged our booking until the time we checked out, I was very impressed with the wonderful, attentive service from the staff. They could not have been more helpful or welcoming. When we arrived mid morning, Mirko managed to arrange for most of our rooms to be ready, which was very much appreciated after a long flight from the US (THANKYOU!) Everyone was very satisfied with their spotless accommodations and really enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel. The courtyard was such a wonderful retreat from the craziness of Venice over the Easter holiday. Breakfast was plentiful and the coffee was excellent. I am a travel agent in the USA and would highly recommend this hotel in the future. Thanks for everything, Mirko, Fabio and Alvise!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KathiJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best we stayed in, in all of Italy! Mirco at the front desk was absolutely the best. He told us how to get around on the bus, he gave us maps and made us laugh with all his wonderful stories. You almost miss the little alley this hotel is on, it is right by the train station, but with electric trains, you never realize you are that close. Our rooms were on the top floor (no lift unfortunately!) and we had old wooden beams on our ceilings and an armoire for our clothes. There is a beautiful garden with lots of modern seating. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. When we go back, we will always stay at the Hotel Abbazia.

Reviews.Title: “If Carlsberg did great value hotels - it would do the Abbazia!”
Reviews.Author: PickyGeordie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Abbazia over Easter. Overall, we rate it the best-value hotel we have ever stayed at. Believe everything you read from the other reviews. Its location is great - Marco Polo Airport, via shuttle bus and vaporetto, to door is about 40 minutes. About 6 mins walk from Piazzale Roma and 3 minutes walk from Santa Lucia railway station (look for the little alley way opposite the Scalzi Bridge - then 100m on the left). The very slight downside is that any ventures off to the touristy bits involve some time planning. The Abbazia's proximity to the Railway station means there are plenty of good-value trattorias/pizzerias within close walking distance, as are shops of all kinds. Despite its location, it remains quiet all times. The hotel used to be part of an old monastery, so the layout, style of decor and general atmosphere is one of quiet, understated charm - lots of beautiful dark wood panelling and cool marble. The pictures on the hotel website tell the truth. Our room was a standard double. It was smaller than some might be used to, but very tastefully refurbished and scrupulously clean (as indeed was the whole hotel). The bed was very comfortable and the room had a very reasonably priced mini-bar and a personal safe. The only down-side was the limited storage space which meant partly living out of our suitcases (not many people are likely to spend more than a few days in Venice anyway). The en-suite was lovely with a double shower! The breakfast room was well-run and the freshly-baked rolls kept on coming! Standard European breakfast food/drinks were on offer - all very tasty - and a healthy appetite could be served if necessary. The garden was a delight to use for breakfast but they like you to stay indoors until at least 8.30am, presumably to give some consideration to the late sleepers that overlook the garden. The biggest plus for us was the friendliness and the welcome offered by all the staff, particularly the gentlemen at Front of House. They all spoke excellent English which reduced my meagre Italian to an irrelevant embarrassment! Marko was only too willing to spend time booking a Pallazo Ducale visit for us, and Matteo offered the use of a PC in the back office to do my online check-in for our return flight. Nothing was too much trouble. In conversation, Alvise pointed out that, if you make your guests feel at ease, they will enjoy their stay and want to come back - it seemed so obvious to him, but as we all know, it isn't always obvious to others! Will we stay again next time we go back? - Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quarantasei
Reviews.Content: I've never bothered to write reviews after staying in a Hotel, but I was so happy with Hotel Abbazia that I feel compelled to do so! Having stayed in Venice on previous occasions, I can easily say that of the 450 + hotels on & around the Laguna, it is very easy to find one of a poor standard. During my last visit in 2003, the hotel I stayed in was the worse I have ever come across so I used the reviews on Trip Advisor this time around hoping to avoid another experience like the last & found almost all those who commented on Hotel Abbazia spoke very positively about it. On arrival, I was not disappointed. The location was excellent. The room (for 2 adults & 2 children) was excellent as was the more than abundant breakfast & the courtyard garden was lovely to lounge around in in the evening. The staff were brilliant & extremely friendly & the next time I hope to return to Venice, I will not look else where & go directly to Hotel Abbazia. Other guests have talked about the bells from the near by church as being a down side. They didnt bother me in the slightest! This is an excellent no nonsence Hotel with bags of character I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Venecian Hotel - central, good price, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: phobos4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia ticks all the boxes of a hotel in Venice. First off, it offers a competitive rate for a hotel located in the lagoon itself. Also, its in the old jewish quarter which makes it within easy reach once arriving by bus from the airport (i.e., 10 min walk). The rooms are clean and have high ceilings, while a decent breakfast will get you started for the day. Dont come here for luxury - but you can expect good value nonetheless. The finishing touch which differentiates this hotel from others in a cramped Venice is the Hotel's courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character and convenient to the train station and water bus stop.”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii-traveler09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 20-year-old daughter stayed for 2 nights in late March, our first visit to Venice. Because we came by train, I booked the hotel for its proximity to the station. (Conveniently also at the end of the water-bus route.) We had reserved a triple standard room, but were given a quad superior on the 3rd floor, off a side corridor. The room was huge, with a very high ceiling, a king-sized bed, plus two singles. What a nice surprise! No elevator, but the staff carried all of our luggage up to the room. The bathroom was very modern, with a big shower and a double sink. We could not have asked for better accommodations for the price. Also, it was very quiet at night. The staff very extremely nice and helpful and spoke perfect English. My husband did not care for the bells (I counted 130 rings each at 7:15 a.m. and 8:15 a.m.), but I didn't mind them. The breakfast was great, our only complaint was that they didn't mark what kind of filling was in the croissants (I was lucky enough to have an apricot-filled one, but couldn't find another for my husband.) Also, on the first morning the coffee machine wasn't working correctly, but was fine on the second day. We would definitely stay at the Abbazia again when visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: overeazy
Reviews.Content: First the bad there is no lift in this hotel. I am not sure if this is the norm for Venice or not. The hotel did have someone on staff who carried our bags to our room for us so it was not like we had to lug them up the stairs. Now the good and there was lots of good. The room was clean and nicely decorated and the bathroom was large with a whirlpool tub. Free Internet connection in the rooms.. They had a real nice reception area and courtyard. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And its location to the train station was fantastic. So easy to get to and yet so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: sandalsFlorida
Reviews.Content: 4 stars. Superb . 2 night stay before our cruise. We were delighted by the charm of this renovated monastery and its interiors, complete with church bells!. Our room was a simple, standard room with 2 twins with a large marble bath overlooking the courtyard. The breakfast was tasty and offered a good selection of items. Suggest eating in the courtyard if seating available. Staff very friendly and helpful. Warning: do not trust front desk staff's restaurant recommendations. Very convenient to public transportation. Walking distance to bus terminal if you have small luggage. Right around the corner from the train station. Water taxi pick up is also right in front of train station. St Marks Square is about a 20 minute stroll or about 15 minutes by water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: arkwebus
Reviews.Content: Very close to the main station in side street this hotel is wonderful with excellent rooms and a public seating area. The staff are fantastic with a sense of humour. It is not particularly cheap [what is in Venice?] but good value for money. There is an adequate breakfast buffet with as much as you choose to eat. The only downside is that twice each morning about 720 and 820 the large church bell next door rings VERY loudly. But this is Venice and you would want to be awake!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cdcSeattle
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice at around 10 am and were going to drop our bags off and explore before check in. The desk staff said that they could have our room ready in about 20 min and to go and have breakfast. We were elated after a long flight. We had something to eat (nice buffet) out on the sunny patio and then went to the room, showered and were ready to start experiencing the city. The staff was friendly and gracious. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Great location convenient to the train station and vaporetto stop. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Super Hotel With Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ferrybeggs
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 great days in Venice and having 1st class accommodation helped to make our break in a beautiful city even more memorable. This is a hotel with lots of character, comfortable rooms, nice breakfasts and last but not least, very friendly & helpful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and I would have no hesitation staying there again. Top marks.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is beautiful and nothing is too much trouble for the staff”
Reviews.Author: barclaysofnqf
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. It is very close to the railway station, the bus station and one of the main hubs of the Venice waterbus system. From here you can easily get to San Marco, the airport, the Lido, indeed every part of Venice. You are right by the Scalzi bridge and all of the good value hostelries of Canareggio, San Croce and San Polo are available within minutes. The hotel is also beautiful and very comfortable, provides an excellent breakfast and is overall excellent value. For those who are familiar with the very best hotels in Spain, it's rather like a small Parador. It has a historical significance, situated right next to the Scalzi church, and this is evident from the reception area and bar/lounge. The most impressive feature of the hotel is the friendliness of the staff, and the fact that nothing is too much trouble for them to deal with. They are lovely - just so welcoming, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Alas, there is no restaurant, leaving you free to try one on the many fine value Canarregio/ San Croce restaurants for lunch or dinner, or affording the option to travel further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Worth to be recommended!”
Reviews.Author: vacationist
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in the Abbazia during the carnival days. The hotel is located in a side street a fews steps from the railway station. It's also close to Piazalla Roma, where the bus station. The hotel is housed in a former abbey. We had a renovated, spacious and tastefully furnished double room in the second floor with view of the leafy inner courtyard. It was very quiet (except for the bell-ringing at a quarter past 7 and quarter past 8 in the morning). The bathroom is equipped with a bathtub (without shower curtain). Still worth mentioned is the flat TV (unfortunately only one German-speaking programme; but we didn't travel to Venice to watch TV ...) What we found a bit disappointing was the breakfast..Machine coffee and juice, on-baked rolls and croissants, tin fruit -all this cannot be! There will be enough bakers in Venice who deliver fresh bread and rolls in the morning. And a very good espresso machine is in the bar! The breakfast lady at least was very nice and helpful ...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and accomodation for the price”
Reviews.Author: dmj0311
Reviews.Content: Was my first visit to Venice and I really wanted to find a hotel close to the St. Lucia Train Station in Venice. This hotel was literally 2 minutes from the hotel, on the same side of the Grand Canal, no need to worry about dragging luggage over a bridge or for a long distance. The hotel was lovely, not large but very well maintained and the staff exceptional. The room was not very large. But very clean and more than adequate space for luggage and moving about. Breakfast included in the price made it a very good value and the breakfast was more than filling every morning. My stay there was wonderful and would return again and recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: FCSCampinas_Brazil
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Abbazia in January. ItÂ´s a very well located hotel, near the train and the bus station and near the car rental shops. The rooms are good, recently reformed, with a nice shower.The crew is very kind and helpful. They suggested restaurants, concerts, showed how to take the vaporetto. The breakfast is also very good and complete. Add to all this the charm of staying in an old, restored abbey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Hotel Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in January. The location was great, right next to the train station! The staff were all very friendly. The room was newly renovated and very clean. There was free wifi! That's a HUGE plus in Europe. The breakfast was only ok, but it's free. Really the best part about staying at this hotel was the friendly staff. I highly recommend it, and will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: braceman
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel at the end of December and would highly recommend it. The room was plain but clean and comfortable. We had a bathtub with a handheld shower attachment so you couldn't stand up and take a shower, but the bathroom was very nice. There was a mini-fridge in the room which is always a nice touch. The heat wasn't adjustable but we were neither hot nor cold. Of course in the winter if you're hot you can just open the windows. I always take a sound machine with me when I travel so I didn't even hear the bells in the morning. The breakfast was very good with ham, cheese, boiled eggs, fruit, juice, rolls, etc. The staff was helpful although someone at the desk said it didn't cost that much to call the U.S. from the room and I had to make a call to activate my cell phone (which I forgot to do before leaving the U.S.) The 3 minute call cost $45, so don't call the U.S. from your room if you can help it. They did have free wireless internet in the room, though. The hotel is close to the bus and train stations which means you don't have to take your luggage on the water taxis. The alley leading to the hotel isn't too hard to find and there is a sign directing you to the hotel on the first building on the alley. If I ever return to Venice I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEEKMAX
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend staying at the Hotel Abbazia. Besides its extremely close proximity to the bus station and now that the Calatrava Bridge now open it takes less than 5 mins to reach from the bus station. Very friendly and helpful people on the desk, in the breakfast room in fact all the members of staff that we encounter were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is near the river bus, which is about 4 stops from the Rialto Bridge to give you some idea of location. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for value, proximately, cleanliness and excellent staff. Will definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: haydan
Reviews.Content: After having my 10 pm ryanair flight cancelled due to fog and spending most of the night trying to rebook another one. I walked into this hotel at 7am as it is very close to the train and bus station. The reception staff were so friendly and helpful and lucky for me had a room. They insisted i had breakfast (even though i was only staying one night and would have it tomorrow as well) The room was nicely decked out, the bed comfy and the bathroom modern. Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place for a break”
Reviews.Author: formuladick
Reviews.Content: A bit of waffle to start....last February my wife and I went to a real dump of a hotel in Amsterdam (Hotel Ajax - if you want a good read search for that one). We hadn't taken the precaution of looking at this site (or any other). This time I decided to use this site as a guide for a nice place to stay. It was ranked #18 overall and so I booked. I am glad I did. It is a perfect place for a break (ours was only a weekend) as very close to the railway station (although no direct train from the airport) and also close to Piazza Roma where the busses and taxis arrive. Literally a 5 minute walk away with small cases..a bit trickier I suppose if you are laden down with bigger luggage. Had a bit of trouble actually locating the hotel because the "road" on the address is really only widw enough for about 3 people at a time... The entrance hall and the receptionist were very welcoming. Check in straight forward, room on ground floor so cannot comment on issues of lack of lift. Room 106 was a lovely room with a lovely shower (also with a bidet!) Only gripe really was the lack of coffee/tea making facilities. Although we didn't use the mini-bar the prices looked very reasonable. Other reviews will make negative comments about the bells from the nearby church tower. We quite liked them. The first one was timed just right to get up and about for breakfast. The bells had a 1 hour "snooze" facility for a later start. Breakfast was adequate, but on the second morning there were a lot more guests about and there seemed to be a bit of a delay in resetting the tables. The bar/lounge area was also very welcoming and the charges also reasonable. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: toronto
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor for this hotel we booked it. It lived up to all its expectations plus more. The hotel is in a perfect location to visit Venice and the staff were the best. The rooms are beautiful and the breakfast was a perfect way to start the day. The only problem was our stay was too short. Thanks to everyone at the hotel (especially Mirko) - you should be very proud of the service you provide to your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated”
Reviews.Author: annie5m
Reviews.Content: I would warmly recommend this hotel as an ideal place to stay in Venice. It is within a few minutes walking distance of both bus and train stations and also the Grand Canal, therefore very convenient for getting around Venice. This might give you the impression that it will be noisy, but it is actually very calm and peaceful, centred around a quiet grassy courtyard. The staff are all friendly, professional and helpful. The desk staff speak fluent English and I think other languages also. Bedrooms and bathrooms are clean and comfortable. Mini bar prices unusually reasonable. Breakfasts are above average by Italian hotel standards. The Abbazia has lots of charm and character, and I will certainly use it again if I return to Venice. On a general note, if you are travelling as a group to Venice, and can therefore share the cost, I would definitely consider using a private water taxi to get to and from the airport, rather than public transport. Just follow the signs in the airport, they leave from the same area as the public transport, which is about 5 minutes walk out of the back of the airport building. It should cost about 90-95 euros in total, it only takes about 25 minutes, and is the best way to see Venice for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kentucky123
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, close to train station and water bus stop and a bridge over the canal. Great staff. Hair dryer was a little weird.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: virgintripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Large airy room with an excellent bathroom and a lovely breakfast. A very short walk to station which is a huge plus in Venice. Staff friendly and happy to assist with any queries. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great--hated to leave.”
Reviews.Author: PCS1942
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in Sept. 2008 and it couldn't have been better. Rooms were very neat, bathroom sparkling clean, breakfast scrumptous and the front desk employees were extremely helpful (especially Fabio) as our luggage was lost and they called all day and evening to the airport to see if it had arrived yet. The hotel is a former Abbey which makes it a very comfortable setting to stay in. The location was very convenient to the waterbus stops and the train station. The small street that the hotel is located on leads to the main street where great shopping and very good restaurants are located. Would definitely stay again when we go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Mature traveller48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October 2008. We were pleased with the location which is located in a small alley near to the railway station and the bus station, so we did not have to drag our cases onto the water buses and over bridges. It was also near to the water bus stop from where we went to St Marks Square, Rialto Bridge and Murano to watch the glass blowing. The rooms were of good size and had a minibar but no tea making facilities, The staff were helpful and very pleasant, and there was a lounge with a bar (also a pulpit from it's former use) where we could have a nightcap and relax in after a day sight seeing. The breakfast was buffet style, although the dining room was very busy around 9 am in the morning when we were there. There is a very nice garden that you can take your breakfast in if the weather is warm. The only minus was the bells that rang between 7 and 8 am in the morning so no need to take an alarm clock! The surrounding area also had some very reasonably priced restaurants, which had tourist menus as well as a la carte. We decided to dine by the Rialto bridge one night and were quite disappointed, we wish we had stayed near to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Abazzia!”
Reviews.Author: EricaMinnesota_US
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and it was just right for us. Very close to the train station, which meant we did not have to drag our suitcases up and down stairs or onto the vaporettos. There was no noise from the train station, though. It was very quiet. The staff was incredibly friendly - the friendliest staff off the 4 hotels we stayed in in Italy. The room we were in was small, but the bathroom was spacious. The neighborhood has many good restaurants and lots of shopping. You are close to the vaporetto stops, so getting anywhere else in Venice is easy. The breakfast was very nice. The garden out back was lovely and the bar area was gorgeous. I would definitely return and I highly recommend this hotel for anyone else travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Abbazia!”
Reviews.Author: munlie7
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for one night and it was fantastic. It is a great location if travelling to Venice by train - just a short walk from the station. The staff were so helpful, assisting with finding things on our map and letting us know where and when to catch the waterbus and bus to Marco Polo Airport. The room was comfy and the bathroom amazing. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find”
Reviews.Author: JB37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in October. It was easy to find and is walking distance from the bus station. The Vaporetta stop is a one minute walk from the hotel. We booked a 'superior' room and were very pleased with it - not huge but well equipped and certainly big enough, with views over the internal courtyard. I did see a 'standard' room and it did not look nearly as nice - think it is worth paying a little extra for the better rooms.The staff were extremely friendly and eager to help in terms of sightseeing. The breakfast was ok but a little limited (the fruit salad was tinned). Mini bar prices were cheap as were the bar prices in the main bar. Overall, a very nice little hotel and we would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaMartins
Reviews.Content: I was 2 nights in August 2008 and the Hotel Abbazia for me it's perfect. Perfect quiet central location, very clean and the recepcionist MIRKO it's the much nicer that I met in my all travels. It's difficult to find one professional like him. When I return, Hotel Abbazia will be my Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: hdelbucc
Reviews.Content: This location was perfect for us as we arrived by train. The hotel is 200 m from the station so we didn't have to lug baggage to far as it looks like it would be a big chore and expensive if you had to use a water taxi/porter to get to your hotel. The staff was excellent from the desk to the bartender. They even gave us a notebook to use in our room for our two day stay and recommended a great place to eat after we had a terrible experience (the only one we had in Italy). NOTE: The horrible dining experience we had was at the Sandolo which is on the same lane as the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: Treely
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at Hotel Abbazia. The hotel staff was very friendly and welcoming. All of the staff that we interacted with spoke English very well, which was helpful given our limited knowledge of Italian. The room was very clean and spacious. The bathroom in the room was rather large as well. The shower (no tub) was a very good size for my 6â€™2â€™â€™ husband. We found the hotel very quiet and a great place to rest and relax. The breakfast provided was continental style (rolls, cereal, yogurt, coffee, etc). We found the breakfast suitable for our needs. The breakfast room was large with enough seating for all guests. We had access to a TV and wireless internet (with no charge) in the room. The hotel was rather close to the train station, which was great when carrying luggage. The hotel is about 30 minutes (walking) to St. Mark's Square and a bit less to the Rialto Bridge. There are a number of places (very close to the hotel) to catch a water taxi to these various locations...making the "commute" rather quick. We definitely recommend this hotel for future tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kimmerst
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. It is VERY easy to get to from the train station (about a 3 minute walk). It is set behind the main area near the touristy train area and waterway, so it was very, very quiet. The only steps to deal with are the ones coming down from the train station. Anywhere else in Venice, you have to cross many bridges and uneven walkways unless you take a pricey water taxi to other hotels. The lobby is large, wood polished daily, and the hotel is well kept. At night, they have wine and liquor available to purchase at their self serve bar in the lobby. The lobby bathroom was immaculate. The front dest was very helpful with maps, water bus schedules, and helped us choose the best bus to get to the airport (3 euro). Our room had 1 double and 2 twin beds, shower (no bath). We had a corner room, which was very large, especially for europe. The bathroom was also above average in size. The only not so great thing is that the bed was on the hard side. Breakfast was included in the price, and adequate. Fresh bread, cheese, meats, cereal, yogurt... all the Europe standards. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends, especially with the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: Lonestar438
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific. It certainly seemed better than 2 stars and a great value - especially in Venice. ....and free wireless!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: SW20_Zebra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbazia for a night at the beginning of August. What a great find - it was literally just around the corner from the train station. We didn't hear any train noises though. We arrived early with the overnight train from Paris but they were happy for us to check in and leave our bags in a storage room while we went and explored a bit. We came back at about 2pm and were able to check into our room on the ground floor. It was very comfortable and air conditioned which made a big difference to our feeling of comfort. We had read advice on this website that the best way to experience Venice was just to walk until you find something to look at. We couldn't have been happier doing it that way. We stumbled upon Rialto Bridge, and did make an effort to find St Marks Square, but discovered so many other little nooks and crannies that we would never have found if we were relying on a map. A highlight was probably the best ice cream shop in Italy (close to Rialto Bridge as you walk towards it from the station side of the Island....sorry can't give you much more than that) There are plenty of little resturants around the hotel but I would advise looking for somewhere away from the main tourist routes. The prices drop and the service is far better. We noted a place that seemed popular with the locals at lunchtime near Tres Archi (about 15 mins from the hotel) and went back there in the evening. I think it was called Pizzaria Tres Archi. It lived up to expectation and had a great meal on the side of the canal as the sun set. Breakfast in the hotel was a nice start to the day (other people have mentioned the bells - it took getting used to but it prepared us for Tuscany where every village seems to ring bells early in the morning). Good Italian coffee with loads of pain au chocolat, bagels, and spreads, along with youghurts, cereals and fruit (probably tinned though). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and definitely plan a trip back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCaymanIslands
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights while on our honeymoon in Venice. It was an excellent hotel, literally right next to the train station and with direct access to the vaporettos which take you all around Venice. The staff were very friendly, the rooms nice and clean and we couldn't have asked for better location. The front desk clerk helped us book tours around Venice and was very helpful with all questions, definitely would recommend this hotel for the great price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Venice.......”
Reviews.Author: teens2006
Reviews.Content: This was a great find in Venice, quiet location but just seconds from the Lista di Spagna street and from the station. Easy access to the vaporetto - it was always easy to travel to and from the area, as it is served by several routes. The hotel itself has lovely details from its history, the front desk staff are helpful in an enthusiastic way, and the initial booking was really quick, and confirmed almost immediately. Nice extras like towels, larger than you would commonly find in European hotels. Breakfast outside in a courtyard. Felt like a nice quiet refuge from the bustle of tourists just yards away.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: gman30341
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place, great service, very convient to water taxi and train station. Would stay again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tadzy
Reviews.Content: We chose the Abbazia based on trip advisor reviews and location. We wanted to be close to the station so we didn't have to haul our bags on and off boats as we only stayed one night. The hotel was perfect in this respect. Just a few minutes walk from the station and grand canal yet tucked into a quiet side street. We saw many people squeezing on to the vaporettos with suitcases and were so pleased we didn't have to do that! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good - considering it was included in the room rate. The rooms were surprisingly well decorated with modern bathrooms, perhaps not as large as I had expected as we had booked triple and double superior rooms - they appeared a lot more spacious on the website. My only recommendation would be to ask for a room on an upper floor (if you don't mind stairs) as our rooms were on the ground floor and were quite dark. This wasn't an issue for such a short stay, however, perhaps the upper rooms have more natural light coming in. All in all, highly recommended at such reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDeb
Reviews.Content: We (two couples) only stayed one night at the Hotel Abbazia before boarding our cruise ship for the Greek Isles, Croatia, Turkey, and Italy. Dragging out luggage over the bridges in Venice and searching for the Abbazia was well worth it. The rooms are clean and spacious with more than adequate bathrooms. But the real pleasure of the Abbazia is the FABULOUS breakfast and the extremely friendly, attentive staff. The staff are more than willing to help you in any way they can and to tolerate Americans fumbling at Italian. We were happy with every suggestion the staff made. I hope we get a chance to go back to Hotel Abbazia and spend more time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: hockeyfanincanada
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Clean place. Close to the railways. Easy access via water ferry everywhere. Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric and quiet Hotel Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: CiaranHughes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Abbazia for one night while visiting Venice from Lake Garda and found it to be one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The hotel has real character, charm and atmosphere and is extremely quiet [despite being close to the railway station]. The front desk speak excellent English and were extremely helpful both when our travel arrangements changed and when we needed a doctor for our daughter. I would definitely recommend this hotel [especially the junior suite] and will stay here again the next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “cracker hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CONNIE34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Abbazia after our hols at Lake Garda, very convenient to train station, quiet setting, staff excellent and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rbbuzz
Reviews.Content: We loved the Abbazia, we had 19 rooms in total (for ourselves and our guests because we were getting married in Venice). The hotel has a lot of character, rooms are clean, well appointed and very nicely decorated. And I really appreciated the mosquito blinds at the windows. The small court yard garden is a lovely touch and hard to find in Venetian hotels. Ask for a room facing the garden. Excellent location for walking or the vaparetto. But the best thing about the hotel are the staff, they are friendly, lively and competent. We will definitely be back and strongly recommend it. In fact we prefered it to the 5 star Molino Stucchi Hilton where we spent our last 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet hotel, in very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Treemonisha
Reviews.Content: We had booked a week's stay at the sister hotel, the Abbazia de Luxe (see separate review), but they had lost our reservation, so we were offered alternative accomodation (at rack rate, cheaper than our booked rate at the more fancy Abbazia de Luxe, though). The first nights we ver given (free) two small singles. Avoid the singles!!! For our remaining six nights we got a nice double room towards the large garden. We liked the room, the quietness, the great lounge with free wifi. Breakfast was OK for Italy. Location was quiet. Not the best part of Venice, next to St. Lucia railway station, but very convenient for transportation. The hotel is very quiet, and for me in a perfect location. The staff is very friendly. Highly recommended. I think they use the same booking system as Abbazia de Luxe, so be 100 % sure to get a confirmation for your booking from the hotel directly, not just the automated confirmation from the booking system!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jlockepac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Abbazia on our honeymoon and we were very pleased with the accomodations. Mirco and Mario were very helpful. They even tried to track down our luggage for us when the airline had lost it. The rooms were small by American standards but they were clean and comfortable. The bathrooms appeared recently renovated. The breakfast croissants and cappucinos were excellent. The best thing about this hotel was its location. We traveled by both bus (from the airport) and by train (to Florence) and because Hotel Abbazia was very close to both the train and bus stations, we didn't have to walk too far with our luggage in order to get to the hotel which made our trip much more pleasant. The hotel is also very close to a vaporetto stop so that you can easily get to another part of the island quickly (however, we enjoyed strolling from one site to the next). We would definitely stay there again on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: FabulousTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at the Abbazia Hotel and this was our first visit ever to Venice, Italy. It was really nice to get off the train and get to the hotel within 5 minutes without any confusion or hassle to locate it (Go left after exiting the train station. Just past the Degli Scalzi bridge which is the first canal bridge you see, on your left is a little 6-foot wide alley that is otherwise known as a street in Venice. Walk down the street and it's on your left). Despite the close proximity to the train station, you'll never hear a train from your room! It's quiet. The 7am bells of the church do wake you up, but it's perfect because your breakfast at the hotel opens at 7:30am & you can get out and sight-see after that! The staff is incredibly friendly, funny, informative, and helpful. I can't say enough good things about all of them. The room is small but well appointed and the bathroom is modern and clean. Venice is incredibly expensive and we felt fortunate to find this fantastic hotel for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dintylondon
Reviews.Content: We were not quite sure about this hotel as it seemed so close to train station and not really in the middle of Venice. We were at the hotel and in our room 15 minutes after getting off the train and heard horror stories from others who had to lug bags throughout alleyways and into boats The proporty was excellent, staff were outstanding and room was great value for the price. It was really pleasant having a drink or breakfast in courtyard away from the hectic crowds of Venice. We found Matthew and staff a delight to deal with and they gave us some great advice on places to eat and see. If you go, don't forget to ask Matthew about his tiger.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: dmcgd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abbazia on two different occasions during a two week period. Prior to booking our stay I asked if we could leave a very large suitcase at the hotel for two weeks while we traveled throughout Italy (we were trying to avoid schlepping excess baggage around) and Hotel Abbazia was very accommodating. When we arrived for our first stay we were greeted by exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Upon checkout there was no problem leaving our extra bag and they even confirmed our return date. Upon returning for our second stay (with family in tow), we were again greeted by friendly staff and was informed that our bag was already in our room. The staff was also extremely helpful in assisting us with directions, restaurants and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: stesuec
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel with fantastic views of the Grand Canal, then this is not the place for you. If you want a hotel that oozes charm and character, than this is it. We stayed here for 2 nights as the first leg of our journey around Italy. The hotel is located a 10 minute stroll from Piazzale Roma if arriving by bus, or a 2 minute walk from the train station. The reception staff are very welcoming and have loads of info should you need it. We stayed in a superior room on the second floor which was spotless and spacious.with a bathroom that was modern and new. Given the proximity of the train station, we were worried we may hear noise from there, but the hotel was very quiet. It was nice to hear the bells from the Abbey in the morning and they added to the charm of the place. The breakfast was varied and plentiful and could be taken in the lovely garden if you wished. Everywhere is walkable, but if you wanted to take a vaporetto, there is a stop within 100 metres of the hotel entrance. All in all, this is a gem of a hotel, and when we return to Venice, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_and_Steve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbazia for one night after disembarking a cruise in Venice. It was perfectly located for us as we were taking the train from Venice SL station to Florence the next day, and the hotel was literally a 3 minute walk around the corner from the station. We went by the hotel the night before we were disembarking the cruise ship, and asked the desk attendant about a transfer for us and our luggage from the pier to the hotel. He quickly booked one for us and the other couple with whom were were travelling, and we were quoted a price that was 1/3 of what the cruise line was charging. He then invited us to have a seat in the lounge, and ordered Prosecco for us on the house. The next morning our transfer was waiting for us with a sign, and within 10 minutes were storing our luggage in the hotel baggage room and heading out into Venice for the day. Accommodations were simple, but clean, and everything in the room worked. The breakfast was ample, but I agree with a previous reviewer that the breakfast room was stifling. But then again, in an old building without central air, it's hard to keep a room cool with 35C + temperatures outside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Drea81
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adored my stay in Venice! Hotel Abbazzia couldn't have been any better! The staff was excellent, friendly, and super helpful! Our room was great! Air conditioned, huge bathroom, and extraordinarly clean! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: MMackDevon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel initially for its proximity to the bus station & for its value relative to others of the same standard. I have stayed in many hotels in many cities & have to say that this was one of the best. The hotel has 50 rooms and despite being full when we were there you could have been mistaken for thinking it was empty, no noise from anywhere in the hotel. Excellent room, air conditioning worked extremely well which was very welcome as the outside temperature was 30+ degrees. The mosquito nets on the window were also an added bonus. as was the safe in the room. Staff very friendly and also very funny & with some good local tips. The barman takes his job very seriously.... As for the monastry bells, I though they were brilliant, you certainly knew that you were in Venice. When I return to Venice, which I will, I won't be staying anywhere other than the Abbazia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: paultry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Abbazia for three nights in May. I picked this hotel based on good reviews on Tripadvisor and it did not disappoint. Firstly, the location is excellent â€“ about 5 mins flat walk from the train station â€“ quiet, very convenient. No worries about manhandling luggage across bridges! And within walking distance of everything - shops, ferry, restaurants, all the sights. Easy to find too, using the directions posted on Tripadvisor: Exit the train station by a side door (from the trains, if you face the main exit this door is on your left you can see the brick wall outside the door) followed the small walkway to the street, you will be facing a bridge, turn left onto that street. Walk a short distance and turn left up the first alleyway. Walk a while longer and the Hotel entrance is on the left. Our room was spacious, quiet, and clean. The carpet was a bit aged but wasn't too bad. Apart from the queen size (I think) bed, we also have a couch in the room. Breakfast was excellent, with hot and fresh croissants (the best we had in Italy) and various other options, including cold meat, bread rolls, eggs cereals etc. Hotel staff were very professional, helpful and cheerful â€“ got a big 'hi, hello' every time we passed through the front entrance. Would definitely stay there again if we ever have the opportunity to go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nickelass
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find in notoriously-expensive Venice. It's tucked away off of a main street, and was fairly easy to get to from the airport. The rooms were small, but very clean and recently renovated. The hotel had a lot of character since it was a converted monestary. The hotel staff was also nice and helpful. The section of town seemed very touristy, but it was safe and there was a lot of activity. It's proximity to the train station also came in handy as we hopped the train down to Florence. The value of this hotel was certainly good, and I'd reccomend it to anyone looking for a nice hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kariluz
Reviews.Content: I was for two weeks in Italy. I stayed at different hotels since we went to different places and this hotel was the best of all. It was in a GREAT location. Very, very near the train station, so you don't need to stroll through all the streets and bridges with your luggage but very calm and quite. I liked the fact that we were so close to the station that in literally you walk 2 minutes and you are at the hotel. The breakfast was very good: ham, cheese, bread, cereal, croissant , orange juice, milk, coffee and water. You can eat outside in the patio or in the breakfast room. The staff was very friendly. Although we were told that our room was in the second floor it was actually in the fourth floor. The room was comfy and clean. The air conditioner didn't work very well at all. I definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's got character..”
Reviews.Author: RobZimmerman
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent for anyone arriving in Venice by train. If you are arriving by bus then it is a bit more of a trek, especially if you've got luggage and worse - a buggy and kids! But everything is relative, and this is still one of the most accessible locations for arrivals and departures. The area is very nice and safe. the hotel is down a tiny little lane (just like all the other tiny little lanes in Venice). The rooms are nice and clean. All-round decent standard. The rest of the hotel is unusual and has a nice feel to it. Staff were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the train station and right off the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Hokie98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 2 hotels in Venice (Hotel Olimpia before our cruise and Abbazia after our cruise). The staff at Abbazia was great. The rooms were small compared to American standards; however, the bathroom was probably larger than some American hotels. Everything was clean, and we had no problems during our stay. The hotel is located within a few minutes walk from the train station. The best part is that you DO NOT HAVE TO CROSS BRIDGES!!!!!! Believe me, after you have to lug your bags across one bridge, then you'll appreciate this attribute. We didn't use the water buses at all and found no problems on getting to the main attractions of Venice. The hotel is right off a major street and is not far from an open air food market. The good thing is that you don't get any of the noise that you can sometimes experience in European hotels. A note on the staff. We stayed here after a cruise that arrived in Venice at 6 AM. We had to leave the ship by 8, so we made it to Abbazia sometime before 9. Since we arrived well before check-in, the staff allowed us to drop our bags at the desk and they gave us access to the breakfast room and the rest rooms. We had some coffee and took a quick trip out to check out our surroundings. We were back by 10:30, and they had our room ready for us. The desk also provided some great dining recommendations as well as some tips to get around the city. They also mentioned that the hotel runs a free service to Murano (we didn't use it though). Apparently, the hotel's owner also has a shop there in case you are interested. Our only complaint was that we ordered a wake-up call for our last day, and we never received it. If you have an early flight, then you might want to set an alarm on your cell phone.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Swaney
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever been to considering relative value in Venice. All staff was literally the best I've dealth with around the world. Location is great and you would never know how close you are to the train station (i.e. quiet) and a short walk to where you can catch the bus or cab. I felt so sorry for everyone lugging their bags through the streets (i.e. those staying closer to san marco). I couldn't recommend a better overall hotel and experience and I've traveled everywhere. Breakfast was amazing and their garden is so relaxing and beautiful. If I could make one complaint, it was that the air conditioning wouldn't go lower than 27, but hey, I'm American and used to wasting energy and so long as it wasn't a terribly hot day, 27C is quite comfortable and we could live with it just fine. I recommend this hotel to all travelers and it is the only place I'll stay when in Venice. So much personality and just a perfect experience

Reviews.Title: “Religious Experience near the Station”
Reviews.Author: BWBT
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a converted Convent retaining quite a lot of its historical features, including a garden in the cloisters. It is remarkably peaceful considering that it is only a few steps from the railway station and thus very convenient. Although busy, this part of Venice is not run down or threatening as station areas can sometimes be. Our room was comfortable and characterful and the shower room although small and a little dated was efficient and well planned. Breakfast is buffet style with a good range of choices and can be taken in the garden after 9 a.m. There is a very attractive room which doubles as a corridor a lounge and a bar with comfortable seats and a pulpit! The staff are friendly and efficient and the prices good value for Venice. There is no lift in the main part of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: DarrenYorkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: What an absolute treasure this hotel is. An ex monastery (aren't most Venetian hotels) just off the Grand Canal a ten minute walk from the bus terminal, over the bridge, up a narrow alleyway and you're there (Railway station only 2 mins away). Excellent base for discovering Venice, delightful rooms, and bar area, breakfast in outside courtyard what can be better than this for the money? Surroundings - felt safe as houses even at dead of night, excellent bars & restaurants close by, 35 min stroll to Realto bridge 45 mins to St Marks just set off & enjoy this magical place.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: missfran
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel, a hidden gem. Perfect location for those arriving by train, and only a short vaporetto ride to all the main sites, we had a wonderful honeymoon stay here. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and large by Venetian standards, and it was like a little oasis of calm in the sometimes-hectic Venice. The whole place was very clean, the breakfast was ample and the garden was pretty. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly stay there again if we returned to Venice. Not even the church bells ringing every morning at 7.15am were a problem â€“ we were raring to get up and go! Locally, we recommend the Restaurant Poveledo, which is about 50 yards away from the hotel (hotel staff will give you directions). Excellent food on a pretty canalside terrace. Wish we could go back right now!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: keys2manor
Reviews.Content: We recently took a 3 week trip of Europe which included 2 nights in Venice at the Hotel Abbazia. It was the best place on the entire trip. I would highly recommend it. Best features include: > Proximity to train station. After a long train ride, it was a tremendous relief to wheel our luggage only 1 block, around a corner, and there we were. This does not diminish your ability to enjoy the city; the vaporetto get you around easily, and there is plenty of life at night in the area. We were down at St. Mark's within a half hour. > Professional staff -- friendly, knowledgeable, made you feel welcome and at home, and gave good recommendations and directions. > Price/Value -- our rate was 20% lower than (what seemed to be) comparable rooms cloer to St. Marks Square. > Room -- we had a quad-superior room (for 2 adults and 2 teenagers), and it was huge, "fancy" decor, and off down a side-corrider (i.e. quiet). It was great! We loved the bells in the morning. > Character -- the place has great character, from the sitting room / entry area with the pulpit, to the courtyard to a very nice breakfast area (and breakfast), to the side hall-ways noted above. Loved it! Had nothing negative at all -- we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaker31
Reviews.Content: A really great Hotel Superp location for exploring all of Venice Room very clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Would certainly stay here again and would recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abbazia Review”
Reviews.Author: Millie08Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our Italy trip, and we stayed at the Abbazia Hotel for our Venice visit. The location is perfect for those who are travelling around Italy via the train, it is located about 100 meters from the Venice train station. The walk into San Marco was about 20 minutes. Easy access to the water taxi's. The hotel service was helpful and friendly, the breakfast was lovely. Overall we had a terrific stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Sadie6
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia is a converted abbey within steps of the train station. It is down a narrow alleyway, and so has the feeling of great privacy. The front desk staff is incredibly helpful, but also incredibly funny. Our interaction with them made the hotel feel very personal, and earned our loyalty. Besides the pleasant and memorable desk service, there are two other great features of this hotel. One is the expansive, comfortable livingroom where one can go to read a book, meet up with the rest of one's party or have a cup of tea or a cocktail in the afternoon. It is lightly scented with a delicious incense that gives meaning to the term "aroma therapy." The other is the sun-bathed garden. After a few days of typical spring rain, we couldn't resist sitting out there, absorbing the warmth and feeling far from the crowds of the Venice streets -- just outside the garden walls. We were two moms traveling with a total of 3 kids. We took a double and a quad (the triple being full). Our room (the quad) was clean and plenty spacious with a big bathroom and tub. The included breakfast, which was in the little dining room, offered plenty of selections for all tastes. The hotel's proximity to the train station enabled us to get in and out of Venice with relative ease, especially in the pouring rain. For those who have not traveled to Venice, this part of the island is just as charming and picturesque and full of shops and restaurants as those areas around San Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Krishna_Venkatesan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in Hotel Abbazia. We booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and werenâ€™t disappointed. The Hotel is a quiet lane just 150m from Venice Santa Lucia train station. The rooms were of good size and well decorated, but we didnâ€™t like the room colour as it looked a bit dull, apart from that it was well maintained room. The entire hotel is well decorated and we really liked the courtyard. The location of the Hotel is perfect, close to the train station (probably an easier location to find your way back even if youâ€™re lost in the small alleys of Venice) and is about 20 minutes walk from St. Markâ€™s square. The early morning bells from the close by monastery added to a nice touch to our trip. The hotel serves a good breakfast and there are also some decent restaurants around the place. Overall a good place to stay in Venice, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great character”
Reviews.Author: debandandy
Reviews.Content: This converted monastery provided us with the a central base with which to visit Venice. Looks quite tatty from the outside, but is beautiful inside with material clad walls in our bedroom overlooking the garden. Yes, we were right underneath the bell tower but somehow the bells were charming and just added to our holiday. Service was really good and breakfast excellent. Would definitely stay here again. The Vivaldi concert, in St Marks Square,although only an hour long is worth seeing. Be aware that the campanile is very expensive at 8euros each so unless you really want that view, best avoided. The basilica is free to go into but if you join the queue to the right, you'll got into the treasury where you have to pay 3 euros each. Doesn't sound that much, but unless you're into bits of bone in ornate glass jars you'll not really feel the benefit. Venice at night is wonderful. Get the front seat on the vaparetto, and ride down the grand canal. All in all a memorable holiday which far exceeded our expectations. Oh and read John Berendts Falling angels when you're there for the full feel of Venice

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pardytours
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three day break in Venice 13-15th March, after booking a cheap flight with Ryanair from Liverpool. Searched the net and decided on this hotel after reading reviews on here, booked direct with the hotel as i got abetter deal than the sites which claim to do it cheaper. arrived at the hotel in the morning and the room was,nt ready (as we expected) but they have a room to drop the bags off so not a problem. The hotel was great, clean and spacious and the staff were very friendly and helpfull at all times. The breakfeast was european style but very good and i filled up each morning and it kept me going till dinner. We stayed in a standard room which was fine, bed comfy and a good power shower in the modern bathroom and a free safe in the room. The hotel is ideal for anyone arriving by coach or train as we did it is a 5 min walk from the coach park and 2 from train station so no messing about catching a waterbus. I would highly recommend this place to any body who wants a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bergstsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in August of 2007 and it was absolutely amazing. Initially we decided on the hotel because it was located close to the train station. We knew it would be hard to roll our luggage around Venice after arriving so we wanted something close. When we arrived we were greeted by a very professional and helpful front desk staff member. They had great recommendations for us while we stayed and gave great directions!! The rooms were simple, but comfortable and the courtyard was welcoming and very beautiful.
