I would highly recommed this hotel to anyone who is looking for a great hotel at a great price near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieBWatfordUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was 10 minutes' walk from the bus station, and we walked everywhere for our 3 days there. The staff were really helpful, humorous and efficient. The building is stunning, full of historical features (a pulpit in the bar/lounge area!). Breakfast was help yourself, plenty of choice, frequently replenished. Hot choc croissants yummy! Shops nearby, good restaurants, Jewish ghetto area, Ca d'Ora art gallery (not sure of spelling!) plenty to explore. Difficult to say how far/long to main tourist attractions, as we wandered and kept getting lost! 127 bells at 7.15 and 8.15 am, as the hotel is joined to a monastery, might be a disadvantage, but then we wanted to be up and about anyway. Otherwise it was very very quiet. Our room looked onto a beautiful garden, which would be lovely to breakfast in, in summer. We had a standard room, which was small, but had a very modern bathroom, nearly as big as the bedroom! We weren't in much, so no problem, but very little storage room if you are touring and have more luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: cnsl
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Abbazia. The location is minutes away from the train station. We exited the train station by a side door (from the trains, if you face the main exit this door is on your left you can see the brick wall outside the door) followed the small walkway to the street, you will be facing a bridge, turn left onto that street. Walk a short distance and turn left up the first alleyway. Walk a while longer and the Hotel entrance is on the left. Don't let the outside fool you, once you enter the door the hotel is wonderful. It is also very safe for being so close to a train station. The front desk staff are extremely friendly and helpful. We booked a quad room and it was a good size. The bathroom did not have a shower but the it was large and clean and the jacuzzi tub was a nice extra. We enjoyed just strolling the halls (which had automatic lights) and exploring the property. The garden was lovely, too cool to use in February though. The breakfast was fresh and filling. We stayed in Rome, Florence and Venice and this was by far our favorite hotel. We would recommend the Hotel Abbazia to anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “we just loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: slp33
Reviews.Content: It is around the corner from the train station so you don't have to lug your suitcase very far, yet it is tucked away in a monastery so it is a picturesque property. The staff are so cheerful and helpful. The lobby is lovely and the rooms are nice by European standards. We were here for three days and would absolutely stay here again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: pno2ner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 4 nites in February '08 and were very satisfied. Well situated down a safe alley very near a waterbus station, the RR station and the Piazelle Roma where all the buses from the airport come in. Its a bit hard to find, but the area is known as Ferrovia, and if you ask anyone they can direct you. If you walk from the P. Roma, about 1/2 mi. it is on the other side of the grand canal and involves crossing the Scalzi bridge-lots of stairs. You can also take the waterbus across from there, the next short stop and you're there. RR is on your side of the canal and involves just a 10 minute walk. It is a converted abbey building next to a church with bells! They ring each morning at 7:15 and again at 8:15, so be aware. The building is well maintained, beautifully built with marble floors throughout and natural woodwork. 4 floors and no elevator. Rooms are very clean, modern and quiet except for the bells. No room phone, modern bath with bidet, good shower, cushy beds, room safe, 20 TV channels in Italian, French, German and BBC and CNN in English. Many other hotels in the area. Hotel staff was very courteous, all spoke english and were eager to please. Our desk clerk suggested an opera one of the nights we were there, sold us tickets and mapped out the walking route we should take. Many daily newspapers available. There is a small bar in the lobby. The included breakfast was fresh, tasty and a good variety. Room rates were very reasonable, we were very happy there and would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: grroberrts
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on here. Happy to say I wasnt disappointed. It was a true pleasure staying here. Arriving late at night, it was reasurring to be greeted by name and to be told that we had been upgraded to a superior room was an added bonus. The room was clean and wonderfully decorated, with a spotless bathroom ( shower was a little cosy, but that might because i'm fat!). The 0715 alarm call (the church bells) was a nice touch they dont last long and you get to snooze until 0815 ( with a lay in until 0845 on sunday!) seriously the bells were not a problem and only added to the magic of Venice. The breakfast was typical continental and more than adequate. The Hotel is located close to the railway station, which is great for a spontaneous day trip to Verona. It is also very adjacent to the water bus stop " Ferrovia" which is great for the tired legs on day 3. We arrived from the airport by bus to Piazalle Roma, the hotel was a 10 minute walk away over 3 bridges. Be warned It is very very easy to miss. The hotel is located up an alley immediately across from the bridgeover the grand canal, look for a sign "hotel Florida" which is adjacent to it. All in all a great place to stay in a great place to stay. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Popeye050
Reviews.Content: Great location, ambiance and helpful service are some of the reasons why I would return to this property. When my wife and I decided on our honeymoon to Venice, one of the biggest apprehensions I had was the hotel. The only way you can get around in Venice is by boat and we certainly did not fancy lugging our bags around. Since we were arriving by train, it seemed logical for us to look for a property close to the train station or at least accessible without much difficulty from the station. Some diligent Internet searching led us to Abbazia, which seemed to be a reasonably priced property near the train station. What I did not expect though is the ambience and the warm service. We arrived in the morning and were told that our room would be ready only after noon. The guy at the front desk suggested that we use the facilities and help ourselves to some breakfast in the meantime. And just as we returned from breakfast, he had our room ready! We stayed in one of the nice rooms on the first floor overlooking the little garden patch and the bell tower. The room was well furnished and comfortable, though it did look a little tired. I think the only not-so-convenient things about this place is that Internet access is through wire and there are no elevators. Breakfast is complimentary and standard fare with cold cuts, bread, corn flakes, biscuits and beverages. The property does have a bar and lounge on the lower level for a relaxed evening. Location-wise, Abbazia is tops with markets, the Ferrovio waterbus stop and most historical and tourist attractions within minutes via waterbus. For the tariff, (US$ 84) I think this place is a steal in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan069
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia Venice - Brilliant Hotel - Great Location Reviewer - Jan, England Four of us have just returned from a three day break in Venice and were so pleased with our choice of Hotel. Warm, comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful service and a very good continental breakfast. Special thanks go to the night attendant for his help when needed. Denis the Bartender is a true professional who serves a bottle of wine with such a flourish and attention to detail that each order feels like a special occasion. We recommend a pleasant hour in the Lounge just for the experience. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJenni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbazia for two nice while we breezed through Venice. What a great choice! The hotel was nostalgic as an old Abbey, complete with pulpit! The front desk clerks were friendly and informative, especially on inexpensive dining advice. The hotel itself was in a great location, being just down the street from the train station. We happily avoided hauling our luggage up and down Venice's many bridges. At first, it was a little hard to find, but look for the sign next to the church outside. (I have good eyes.) Our room was tidy, large and comfortable, it had a view of the little courtyard and birds chirped constantly in the morning. I personally enjoyed the church bells chiming every morning, but I can see how it may annoy others with the close proximity, and therefore volume. But the best part about this hotel was the breakfast. By far the best breakfast in Europe, and so much of it! Fruit, yogurt, meat, cheese, bread and even hot eggs. FANTASTIC coffee and espresso. We ended up taking croissants with us for lunch, too. We really enjoyed our stay at the Abbazia. I will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 4AussiesSydney
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four (kids 15 and 13) travelling together. I chose this hotel because it was close to the railway station and even though it was close to the station, as often that is not the nicest area of a city. We arrived on the bus from a flight to Treviso airport at Piazza Roma, and it was only a 5-10 minute walk from there. The train station is 3 mins round the corner as is the vaporetto stop. It used to be a convent (I think) and is tucked down a little alleyway. Our room was huge, even with four beds in and the bathroom large and shiny clean, hot towel rail and hairdryer in too. The walls have a great old fashioned fabric and braid covering, and the lounge is full of plush red comfy chairs and sofas. Breakfast was brilliant, buffet with cereals,cold meats,cheese breads,warm croissants, including chocolate filled ones! The reception desk all spoke English well and happily and were helpful with information.We would definitely choose here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: raindancer12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel Abbazia and couldn't have been more impressed. The rooms were huge and very clean, breakfast was wonderful and the staff could not have been more helpful or pleasant. It was very convenient to the ACTV and the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: curse10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Abbazia for three nights at the end of November '07. We had a great time. The experience, in list form: Pros: * Location! Right next to the grand canal, a vaparetto station, and the train station. It's a little far from the main attractions, but it's only a 30-40 minute walk to St. Marks. Since we are big walkers, we thought this was a plus. * Super nice staff. When we first arrived, tired and jet lagged, it was a bit of a relief to not have to use my very bad Italian. The desk staff is very fluent in English if you need it- but they would also indulge my Italian. The gentlemen at the front desk were always helpful, polite and friendly. * Huge rooms. Our room had three beds! Who needs three beds? The space was luxurious by European standards. * Great breakfast. This was, by far, the best breakfast we had during our whirlwind tour of Italy. Lots of bread, fruit, cheese, yogurts, hard boiled eggs, and juice. Oh- and do-it-yourself cappuccino. Less-than-pros: * The hotel is a little dated. I thought this was charming, but some people get uppity about such things. Don't expect a bunch of modern amenities. * Pealing bells. Every morning, around 7:00 a.m. bells, bells and more bells. At least we didn't need an alarm clock or wake-up call. * I thought our room had a slightly funky smell. My husband thought I was crazy- so take that with a grain of salt. Overall a nice place to stay while exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Knowledgeable Front Desk and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: fobandbumpkin
Reviews.Content: This is my thirtheenth visit to Europe and fourth to Venice. We were very impressed with the front desk and the night clerk at Abbazia. The front desk was most helpful at all times, especially when we expressed our concern about our exit to the airport at 5 am., through a dark "calle" to the ferry stop. They suggested a special arrangement to have an authorized cab driver to pick us(and our luggage up) at the hotel, escort us to the railway station parking lot, and drive us to the airport. It was such an excellent suggestion! The night clerk was fully aware of our arrangement and saw us off with this cab driver, whistling happily with a buggy. I said goodbye in Itailan to the night clerk, an educated well groomed gent in his 60's. My husband and I (both in our 40's only, we are neither old nor fail, but safety conscious) followed this happy cab driver, walked briskly though the foggy dark, marched via the empty Ferrovia station, to the parked cab.. 15 min we were at the airport. I thank this site for the advice for choosing this hotel. Other plus points are:excellent location, plenty of functional eateries(Brek, Chinese). Even if money is not a problem, you'll get tired of Italian food on a two week stay. Needless to say, Harry's Bar or Cipriani are excellent places, but once is enough!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find”
Reviews.Author: Crundle
Reviews.Content: Dec. 20/2007 We were on a 3 week holiday in Italy with our adult children and spent two delightful days in Venice at the Hotel Abbazia. We arrived by train and the hotel is literally 2min from the station which was perfect. Dragging suitcases round the canals would have been a nightmare. The staff are courteous and helpful with a sense of humour which delighted us but I could quite understand not suiting some travellers. The rooms were spacious and well appointed with beautiful en suite bathrooms. Breakfasts were varied and very good although the coffee made your hair stand on end. The hotel arranged an excellent trip out to Murano to the CAM glass factory which was an amazing experience. The walk from the hotel to St Marks is an easy and pleasurable one. Take time to visit the Church de Scalzi attached to the hotel, it is quite beautifull but easy to miss and the pealing bells just add to the whole Venice experience. If you are not into walking there is a vaporetto stop right near the hotel. We highly reccommend Hotel David and will definately stay there on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: eddotcom
Reviews.Content: The Abbazia is just few yards away from the Grand Canal, and around the corner from the train station, a vaporetto (water bus) stop and water taxi stop. Although it is also within easy walking distance from the bus stop and car park, three bridges with stair steps have to be crossed which might encourage the use of a water bus or taxi by those hauling luggage. The hotel is hidden on a small side street which looks like an alley, and has a very undramatic entrance. We found the reception staff to be fluent in English, and not just attentive, but fun. The rooms were small, but clean and fresh. It looks like most, if not all rooms have windows to the courtyard, which the staff likes to keep covered with the heavy wooden shutters. Contrary to what another review stated, the shutters can be easily opened after opening the screen (a bar at the bottom pops up allowing the screen to roll up). The breakfast included with our room was not extensive but more than adequate. The fresh baked rolls were the best we had on the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: CrazyTourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location 2 mins from the station and about 5 mins from Piazza Roma (bus station). It was quite a walk to St Marco's square but we are thankful that we got a hotel close to the station as the station is well signposted and it is very easy to get lost through all the allyways so we always found are way back. We had a standard room which could have done with a lick of paint but was very large compared to other rooms in Italy. Breakfast was cereal, ham, cheese, toasted crackers and jams. The bar area is nice to relax in and reasonably priced. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. We had a room right next to the notorious bells but it didn't bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Brief stay but lovely!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim79my
Reviews.Content: I'm a very lucky girl as my boyfriend took me to Venice for my birthday and up until I arrived at the airport I had no idea where i was going. I wasn't disappointed!! Venice is a beautiful city!! Unfortunately we were only there for one night, so it was a whirlwind of a trip, but we will definately be going back. The hotel was easy to find and near to the grand canal. The reception staff were very friendly and kind. The room was slightly small but as we were not intending to spend any time in the room this didn't matter. the bathroom is beautiful and has everything you would need. The room had a mini bar which was handy and also a safe which was appreciated. The view from the room was of the garden and I can imagine that this would look even more stunning in the summer. We had a wonderful stay in venice and at the hotel and we would and will return in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: groberts1973
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Trip Advisor. It is a wonderful little gem of a hotel just hidden off the main walkway from the train station. It is perfectly situated whether you arrive in on a train, a boat or a bus. We arrived in to Piazzale Roma on a bus from Treviso Airport. It was only a 10 minute walk to the hotel. I paid 120 euro per night for a twin room including breakfast. The room was a little on the small side with two single beds. But, very clean and comfortable. The room was well heated, which was needed as the weather was freezing. The room looked out on beautiful little garden. You would never know you were in the heart of venice. The bells were no bother at all once you expect them. I found them a nice little reminder that I was in Venice! The staff were very kind and courteous. The breakfast was plentiful. I could not recommend this hotel more. I would definintely go back to stay there. Thank you for a lovely stay in Venice Hotel Abazzia!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timheuer
Reviews.Content: our traveling party loved this hotel. it was small and quaint. the lounge area was great and it was fun to be staying in a place with some history (it is a working monestary). the front desk staff was VERY helpful and kind to us at every opportunity. the location was perfect and we enjoyed our stay. the complimentary breakfast was the best of the three hotels we stayed at during our trip to italy. their ham was the best i'd ever tasted...and the nutella croisscants were yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: TryAnything
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived till the time we left they could not do enough for us. The location near the train station is ideal and the sound of the bell at 0715 is certainly not a problem and great to wake up to. The room was very clean and spacious, although there is no lift our bags were carried up for us and would have been brought down for us if needed. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: mmp1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a 5 minute walk from S,Lucia Railway station , It is a restored Barefoot Carmalite monastery. There is a private inner garden and the breakfast is wonderful and plentiful. We were given the family room which had a king sized bed and two single beds for 90 Euro a night. The desk people were friendly and helpful. There are no elevators, but no problem for us. There are rooms on main level. We ate at a lovely small restaurant outside across from the hotel. We walked everywhere and it was great this time of year. I would reccomend for couples who appreciate the old world charm in decor.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the Bells”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are great. In fact, the only thing that detracted from the experience was the smaller than European average room and the bells that tolled at 7am everyday. (Over one hundred and seventeen times.) Eventually, you learn to tune them out, but the initial shock is a little more than alarming.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm with convenience”
Reviews.Author: Lillyindy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in October for 3 nights and we were very pleased with this hotel. It is a former monastary and continues to have the old world ambience. We had a superior double room that was very spacious with a queen and 2 twins; beds were comfortable. The best features: ambience, grand old lounge area, close to the train station (if arriving by train this is where you want to stay- no fun schlepping your luggage all over Venice), good restaurants and stores nearby. Easy valparetto access. Good to know points: no elevators so a few stairs here and there- bellhops will carry your luggage or request first floor; no Internet access (internet cafe nearby though); the "street" in front of the hotel is really a small alley - easy to miss so look closely. Yes, the bells ring at 7 am, but it was charming and was easy to fall back asleep - otherwise the room was very quiet. good for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidtgordon
Reviews.Content: Arriving late after a delayed flight from Germany we were greeted by a smiling Matteo who made sure we were happy and well settled before advising us of the best, and least expensive, places to eat. Our rooms were well equipped and furnished, proper sheets and blankets on the beds, and a bathroom that was well heated and supplied with a range of good toiletries. The breakfast each day was well prepared and during our week long stay we were well looked after at breakfast. The hotel bar was open each evening and although not stocking Italian beers was well supplied with internationally acceptable drinks as well as tea, coffee and the best chocolate we had all holiday. Fabio and Mirko, the other front of house staff, couldn't do enough to help, suggesting good places to visit, suggestions for places to eat and by arranging a private water taxi to a glass factory on Murano. Thanks to everyone who looked after us at the Abbazia, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MKKfromUS
Reviews.Content: Could not have been happier with my hotel choice! Having a standard room, it was small but bathroom was wonderful and you could have literally eaten off the floors, the place was immaculate. The staff was just wonderful - helpful and friendly. Lovely bar area with very reasonable prices. Stayed five nights before going on a cruise and they had a great setup for getting you to the cruise port. Great location, easy to get to anywhere one would want to go. Great breakfast and close to restaurants. It really was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: purplepussycat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a second stay in the Abbazia. Hotel staff very friendly. Could not fault anything. Great location and yet so quiet (well apart from the church bell!!). Just lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: WI_Traveler2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on our honeymoon for two nights. We arrived by train and where pleased with the short walk to the hotel. The staff checked us in and then showed us to our room. Our bags where delivered shortly after. Very nice std room, never heard another guest our entire time there. The breakfast room always had a good assortment of items for breakfast from choice of meats, filled pastry, juice and always great coffee. We where always up prior to the church bells going off every morning. I would recommend this hotel to any one going to Venice and especially if traveling by train.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: armydoc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the train station from Florence and were at the hotel in just a few minutes (it's basically 2 blocks away and NO bridges to roll your luggage over!). The staff who greeted us were the friendliest we encountered throughout our entire stay in Italy. Our room was a superior double. It was 3 floors up without an elevator, but they of course carried our luggage up for us. The room was clean and modern, with simple decor. It was spacious with a large bathroom and big whirlpool tub. Windows were nice with shutters and screens if you wanted them open for air. When we told the staff that we needed to catch a bus at 7:50a the next morning, they went out of their way to try to get some breakfast items out to us before the 7:30a breakfast opening time. The lounge area is beautiful, and the breakfast room huge. The outdoor patio with tables looked very peaceful and clean, though we didn't have time to take advantage of it during our 1 night stay. You have easy access here to the main walking thoroughfares as well as to water taxi and water bus stops. I highly recommend this hotel, but it is especially convenient if you want to stay close to the train/bus station area.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, a fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: folpa87
Reviews.Content: I first arrived at the hotel abbazia from florence, i was extremely hot, i went to italy in mid july i still dont know, i was beyond tired, and in a very bad mood. and i had a lot of bags. however all that changed, i stepped into the hotel and was simply amazed. i had been in some ok hotels in italy with bad service, and was about to write off italian hotels all together, until i arrived here. someone came and took our luggage immediately to our rooms, Alvise, the manager saw how hot and sweaty we were and immediately gave us our keys, told us to take our time and wash and relax then we could check in. that was a life saver. when we came down a little later everything took only a few minutes to check in. the lobby is beautiful, and yes it is a converted abbey and the pulpit is still there, great photo op. theres a nice bar, and the barman dennis was very nice and made nice cocktails. the breakfast in the morning was very nice as well. first of all it wasnt only an hour from like 7 to 8 am like in some hotels ive visited, it doesnt end until 11! very nice large selection, and the waitress is sweet. yes ive read on here that some people complained about the breakfast but im not sure what they have to complain about, yes its a buffet style, and a nice one at that, especially for the affordable price you pay for the room. where in some hotels you pay high prices, then pay an extra charge for breakfast on top of that. the staff, (Fabio and Mirko) were happy to recommend places to eat, visit, and shop at. we followed all their advice and had a wonderful time. i have recommended this hotel to many of my friends and family, and i will continue to do so in the future. i read one bad review about this hotel, but believe me it is far from accurate.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic abbazia”
Reviews.Author: ad_kw_jb
Reviews.Content: i would have no hesistation in recommending this hotel to anyone.we have just returned from a trip to venice. the hotel was everything that we expected. we arrived mid morning and our room was ready. i booked a triple for three adults and the room was brill. plenty of room and a very clean spacious bathroom with shower. the room was.air conditioned with mozzie screens on the window. our room backed onto the lovely garden of the hotel. the staff at the abbazia were the most friendly we have come across in europe and we are well travelled. they go out of their way to assist you with anything you need. they open the bar for you even when it is officially closed. the guest lounge and bar is very quiet clean and comfortable and the barman very friendly and helpfull (makes great cocktails!). the breakfast is served in the garden if you would like and it is a continental style with boiled eggs, fresh breads, meats and cheeses. breakfast room pleasant and clean. again staff very accommodating and friendly. i visited venice in 2006 and stayed at the carlton grand canal and although a nice hotel and very lively it is not a patch on the abbazia.it has a great location near to the station and there is no noise at all apart from the bells ringing around 7 am and 9 am. no alrn clock needed to get out and about in venice whilst it is reasonable cool. thank you for a great stay in venice to all the staff. we will definately recommend to our family and friends and return again soon. ad,kw,jb, staffordshire

Reviews.Title: “Sweetest place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: robertadian
Reviews.Content: We've been to Hotel Abbazia twice now and we LOVE it more each time. The wonderful guys who run this place make it feel like home away from home. They exude a genuine warmth and offer enormous support to travelers. They took exceptional care of my teenage son who was in Europe for the first time. Bravo and many thanks! Please enjoy the bells...they are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed”
Reviews.Author: PeteandRon
Reviews.Content: When deciding where to stay for our 2 nights in Venice, we first debated whether to stay on the mainland (potentially better value) or should we experience Venice properly by staying there. We decided that Venice would be a unique experience so we should do it properly. Continuing this theme, we then settled on the Abbazia as being a former abbey, it would have some additional character which would add to our Venice experience. The hotel is indeed like it is presented on the web. Church bells sound in the morning, 120 times I think we counted at 0715 and 0815 when we were there. It is very handy for both the train station and the vaporetti (waterbus) stop which are no more than 5 minutes walk away. Whilst there must some merit in staying more central, the downside to that would appear to be that you have to transport your luggage with you. Once we realised the logistics of moving around Venice i.e boat/walk, we were delighted therefore with the convenience of the Abbazia to the station. Within a few minutes walk is a good selection of tourist shops and restaurants. We had a superior triple room which was on the second floor. No lift, but the receptionist arranged for the porter to carry our luggage up. Good size room, high ceiling with what appeared to be some original beams and what looked like a loft area. Perhaps because of the size of the room with the high ceiling and loft area the air conditioning was not great. Breakfast was disappointing. Did not seem to be any waiters per se, more kitchen staff who when they spotted you would stop what they were doing to see if you wanted coffee. First morning was reasonable although had quite a wait to get a glass for some orange juice. The second morning we were slightly later in coming down (not late, just after 9) but must have been just after the rush. Tables mainly emply but none cleared and no staff about. We had to clear a table ourselves and find clean plates etc from neighbouring tables. Not much on offer other than some burnt croissants ! Only bad breakfast in our whole 2 week trip to Italy. The other disappointment was that the bar was closed when we were there. The bar itself is one of the highlights of the hotel and it would have been a lovely way to finish the day off with a quiet drink in such a unique setting. Receptionist explained that barman had had an accident but was okay. However, bar would be closed for the whole week and it was not possible to serve drinks. Short comings aside, we would still recommend this hotel for it's location and genuine charm.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: DisneyBonkers
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Abbazia is full of charm, a hidden gem in a backstreet of a wonderful, romantic city. Before we even arrived in Venice I was impressed by the hotel - I booked a standard room directly online with the hotel, but changed my mind a few weeks before I was due to arrive so asked to be upgraded to a superior room. The staff were lovely and quick to respond by email confirming our request. I stayed in this converted abbey with my boyfriend from the 7th of August for 4 nights. We arrived in Venice from Treviso airport by bus and were dropped at the Piazalle Roma (bus station). I won't lie - we did have a bit of trouble finding the hotel and with our suitcases, burning sun, mass of people and bridges it was not pretty! If you head towards the S.Lucia Railway station, the hotel is down a small alley directly across from the Ponte Degli Scalzi (which is a lovely bridge, on the same side as the train station). There is a sign on the right hand side of the alley wall "Hotel Abbazia" and an arrow. But Invest in a good guide book with map! Some may be put off my the hotel being down an alley way but I found no problems with this, even at night and never felt threatened. If you are arriving by train or travelling on by train this hotel is perfect as it is directly next to the train station - some have said that this is a dodgy area at night, but we never saw anything to make us feel uneasy. The minute you enter the hotel, you are captivated by its charm! When you walk down the alley way the hotel is about half way down on the left. The doorway is welcoming. After being greeted by the welcoming Fabio, we had to walk through the bar area / sitting area to get to the stairs to the room. Our room was 307 and as there was no lift we had to carry our cases up the 3 flights of stairs but was no problem. In all public areas you are reminded of the building's history - the pulpit in the bar area, tapestries and religious figures / paintings on the walls. On entering our room it was big and spacious, all in blue! There were 2 big windows that had typical Italian shutters that when opened looked out onto the garden. I have to point out that I had asked especially for a room high up, non smoking, with a view overlooking the garden - and all my requests were granted. The bathroom was big with lovely white tiles and a large mirror. The only down side was it was a bath with shower in it - you had to sit down in the bath and use the shower that way as there was no shower screen. But we were warned when booking that it was either bath OR shower. An added bonus with the room - a safe and minibar! Further adding to the charm were the church bells that went off at around 7.15am - a great wake up call! Breakfast was included in our deal and was served at the times of 7 to 11am. Available was tea / coffee / fruit juice, ham, cheese, youghurts, cereal, bread and croissants. A lovely continental breakfast! There is an inside seating area and an outside area - the outside was disappointing! It looked nothing like the pictuires on the website - the tables were covered in birds droppings and when we did eat outside we were so plagued by pigeons we had to eat inside! But if birds do not bother you then it won't be a problem. The hotel may seem far away from the main area of Piazza San Marco, but Venice is a very small city and we found we could walk all the way round from the hotel in 25 / 30 minutes. You get to see so much of the city this way! All in all, Hotel Abbazia is worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Broni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on 30th July. In a superb location close to all the attractions but in a quiet side street. Reception were top class, really friendly and helpful. Rooms were nicely decorated, some might find them a little small if you were there for a longer period of time but we had no problem with space. One thing to watch out for are the pigeons, close your shutters or they will try to nest on the window sill and they make a much more annoying loud noise than the bells! They are also a pest at breakfast if you eat outside! Breakfast good and garden nice. Overall great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Venice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkFamilyof3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Abbazia and would stay again if we return to Venice. The location is fantastic, very close to the train station and right at the Ferrovia vaporetto stop. Our room (215) was at the end of the hall and had a nice comfortable king bed for us and a twin bed for our son. The air conditioning worked very well for which we were grateful as it was hot when we were there. The bathroom was roomy and clean, although the shower showed signs of prior leaking. The breakfast, included in the 160 Euro price, was really nice and you could eat either in the breakfast room or in the beautiful, shady courtyard. The reception staff were so friendly and helpful - they even directed us to a small playground where we could have a little down time among grass and trees with the local moms and kids.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: cocomojo
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel. The staff are the most friendly and helpful that we encountered in Italy. The hotel and rooms are just as they are is pictured on the internet. Very clean and updated considering is was once an abbey. Great job on the renovation. Another plus is that it is only a 2 minute walk from the train station, canal, shops and eateries. We were arriving at 10:30pm off of the train and were concerned about walking the streets & trying to find our hotel. The staff at the hotel said we would be fine (we called from Florence) and it was only a 2min. walk. They were right. The streets were full of people out and about. We felt very safe, and couldn't wait to join the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to hold your bags”
Reviews.Author: reviewking123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the train station, but thats the only good thing about it. Otherwise its just a motel. Old, ugly rooms, bad lighting, just completely average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Profnick
Reviews.Content: Our family had two deluxe double rooms at the beginning of August. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is restful, cool, clean and extremely pleasant. Breakfast in the garden is a bonus, (though don't leave your food unattended as the birds will have it!). Although right next to the railway station, there is no noise in the hotel, (though see other comments on the bells, which we found pleasant rather than annoying). Internet access for 5 Euros a day meant we could keep in touch with friends and send our holiday pictures back to bore them. The hotel is well maintained and a pleasure to relax in at the end of the day. It's a pity there weren't more guests using the hotel bar as it's a great facility but didn't have much atmosphere because it was almost always empty, despite good service and excellent coffee, wine and "nibbles".

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhodyjan
Reviews.Content: We loved our 3 night stay at this hotel. It has maintained all the charm of the Abbey that it was, and we especially enjoyed breakfast in the lovely garden.(a real rarity in Venice!). Arrived by train and found the hotel easily and quickly, without having to cross even one bridge! It was also very convenient to the Vaporetto stop. The only drawback was that there was no elevator. This did not bother us but we could see where it might be difficult for an older or disabled person.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abbazia, Cannaregio, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Maz007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at this hotel and it was lovely. The staff are great - very helpful indeed - happy to e-mail directions and answer queries before arrival and during stay. Unfortunately there is no lift, so luggage is a problem for arrival and departure if your room is 2 flights up. Breakfasts are fine - and cater for most tastes. The rooms are simple but classic given the history of the building. You shouldn't need an alarm clock for an early rise. There are 2 sets of bells to wake you - the first suggest you should get up and shower and the second peel for 130 counts mean you should be down for breakfast as it's around 8.30 and there's a busy day ahead. To get to the hotel we caught a bus from Marco Polo airport (3 euros each) which dropped us off at the bus station (only a short walk then to the hotel). The worse thing was that although it was only a few minutes' walk from the hotel, you have to lug suitcases over one low bridge but then a mighty beast of a bridge (about 80 steps) before you get to the ally where the hotel is situated. The Vaporetto stop (water bus) is a minutes' walk from the hotel and you can buy a 72 hour pass next door to the stop for 30 euros which entitles you to travel as much as you wish around the network, including glass blowers island of Murano which is a good trip for 1/2 day. Although you can walk across Venice quite easily in about an hour, it's easy to get a bit lost as it can be somewhat of a maze. A laminated street map Â£4.99 is a must. It's easy to walk 4 or 5 miles a day exploring the place - it's certainly a watery labyrinth - but it's good to jump on the water bus to save your legs every now and again. Train station was only a couple of minutes' walk away, which was so useful when we travelled on to Verona. There are steps up to the train station, but walking from the hotel, there is a side entrance to avoid carrying heavy luggage up steps. I think that either a ruck sack or small to medium case (wheeled type) is a good idea. The weather was so hot during our stay, that we only used 1/3 of what we took.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!!”
Reviews.Author: faig
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got it all: Great location, steps from the Grand Canal, railway station (but no noise), host of nearby restaurants and Ponte degli Scalzi (one of just three bridges over Grand Canal) giving great walking access to the whole of Venice. Great setting, with peaceful garden and wonderful lounge/bar. Fabio, Mirko and 'Nicholas Cage' lookalike (Barman) gave first class and friendly service. I would highly recommend this hotel - particularly given that it comes in considerably cheaper than many less impressive hotels in Venice. Good sized rooms for Venice with large modern bathroom. Also, bar drinks are cheaper than all but anywhere in Venice. If you fancy a drink at a canal side Osteria with no tourists, recommend one on FMTA Gradenigo Fondamenta (just 100 metres over the bridge from tha Abbazia.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: HKTNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of June and the hotel was beautiful. The room was spacious and clean. We liked the fact the hotel is located very close to the train station and the vaporetto stop but you would never know they were nearby, as the hotel is located in a quiet area. We arrived by train and were able to check into the hotel and get rid of our luggage by taking a very short walk to the hotel. When we left the hotel, we took the vaporetto one stop to pick up our rental car at Piazzale Roma. The breakfast was very good, the common areas were beautiful and the staff, especially at the front desk, were wonderful. We would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Could ask for no more”
Reviews.Author: jb06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Abbazia 24th-27th June and would return in a second. We had an early flight so arrived at the hotel approx. 10.45am, our room was obviously not ready but the staff at reception directed us to the breakfast room for something to eat. This was a very unexpected gesture but appreciated following an early morning flight. Breakfast was plentiful and a good choice (eggs, ham, cheese, cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurt, croissants, bread rolls, fruit juice, tea and coffee) and is served till 11.30am. If you ignore the hotel entrance (down a little alleyway) you will be pleasantly surprised by the charm and beauty that await, both in the rooms and the shared areas. There is a very large, cosy sitting area and small bar off the hotel reception and also a luggage room to leave your cases until your room is ready. All rooms seemed to overlook the garden/courtyard where you could have breakfast or just sit out to relax during the day. We stayed in a superior double room which was beautifully decorated and had a very glamorous bathroom. There is a tv, minibar, telephone and hairdryer in each room but please note no iron or tea/coffee making facilities. The room was small but adequate enough for the two of us, the bathroom in contrast was very large. From both your room and the garden/courtyard you can see the bell tower, be warned the bell rings a lot at 7.15am and 8.15am, i thought it added to the charm of the hotel but this may annoy some. As previously mentioned you are next to the train station but we did not once hear a train. The hotel is ideally located for both trains and the vaparetto stop, the nearest vaparetto is Ferrovia and the hotel is within a five minute walk of Piazzale Roma (although be prepared to carry your cases over a bridge or two). On the few occasions we approached the staff at reception they were very friendly and helpful and made the stay more pleasant. Overall you could ask for no more from a hotel, i would recommend it to anybody and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ncmoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in late June. Hotel is a 2 minute walk from the train station and vaporetto stop. The front desk staff was the friendliest I have encountered at any hotel. They spoke excellent English, had a great sense of humor and provided lots of helpful information. Even though we arrived at 10:00 AM, they had a room ready for us. Room was standard size for European hotels (about 10 by 10 feet, not including a big bathroom). Bathroom was modern and clean. Only downside was that the air conditioner in the room was a little underpowered to handle the oppressive heat (90 degrees F) and humidity during the days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay Best Location”
Reviews.Author: buckfan
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights during holy week abd absolutely loved this quaint hotel. The staff was always friendly and attentive and again Fabio was always a welcome sight at the front desk. Our favorite thing about this hotel was the location to the train station. IF you are traveling into/out of venice by train this hotel cannot be beat. We were there in less than 5 min. walk from main rail station and would have paid double to not have to lug bags onto water taxis or over bridges! We chuckled every time we saw people struggling with bags on the cobble streets. This place was not extravagant but was perfect for us and i would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: LIndamac508
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just one night before we flew home. It was so very convenient to the train station, just turn left and left again after the bridge on your right. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was plentiful. The room was very adequate. I did not like the perfume in the room too much, though and to get to the buses/taxis you must carry your luggage over 3 bridges. But I'd stay there again for its location and the accommodations.It was also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good for Money, Decent Breakfast, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sommervillegirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia is a quiet little hotel tucked away on a side street one block away from a busy main shopping street and one block or so away from the train station. My husband and myself (and four other adults) stayed for one night on June 10th. Fabio, who worked the front desk when we checked in, was very kind and accommodating. Even though we arrived at the hotel in the morning and check-in wasnâ€™t until the afternoon, Fabio allowed us to stow our luggage in a separate room and even kept our laptop bag behind the desk. Our flight was very early the next morning and therefore we would not be able to have breakfast the next day. He let us eat breakfast the day of our arrival instead (at 10am). The coffee was very good. It was a lot like Turkish coffeeâ€”strong, grounds on bottom. The hotel has a beautiful courtyard in which to eat breakfast or relax with a book. My husband and I stayed in room 410. We loved walking into a thoroughly air-conditioned room after the heat of the Venice streets. The room was very clean and we slept well on a pretty decent mattress (king sized mattress really comprises of two twin mattresses put together). Room 410 is on the top floor (5 flights of stairs folks) and has a cathedral-like ceiling so the room seems bigger. The bathroom is modern and sleek and well lit. The room, however, is not well lit. The room has 3 small lamsp and one of the bedside lamps wasnâ€™t working. A few things you should know: 1) There is NO elevator. You must be able to carry all your luggage to the room. 2) There is NO iron at this hotel. When we inquired why this was, we were told that most Venetian hotels do not have irons due to fire-safety rules. Only the 5 star hotels have this (or so the rumor goes). I highly recommend bringing Downyâ€™s â€œwrinkle-releaserâ€� spray (travel-size to get through security). 3) There is no soap or shampoo in the shower. However, there is liquid hand soap by the sink. Bring your own soap or use the liquid hand soap. 4) Our two windows had closed shutters and we were unable to open them because there was a screen between the window and the shutters. Therefore, we didnâ€™t get to see our view (probably of the courtyard) and the room remained dark. 5) Internet usage is 5 euros for a 24 hour period. 6) Breakfast was pretty good: It consisted of lemon curd filled croissants, rolls, sliced meats, sliced cheese, good European butter, nutella (chocolate-hazelnut spread), jam, coffee, milk, yogurt, various cereals, some fruit, orange juice, and another juice that tasted like V8 fruit juice. I think there were a couple other dry crackers/cakes pre-packaged and tea but we didnâ€™t try them. 7) There is a busy shopping area about a block from the hotel (but not as busy as the Rialto Bridge/St. Mark's square area) full of restaurants, cafes, and shops. The hotel was very helpful in getting us to the airport. They called for us to have a steward pick up our luggage at the hotel and we followed him to a van where he drove us to the airport. I donâ€™t believe it is more than a 20 minute drive. We split this with another couple that the hotel helped us find and paid 40 Euros per couple. We heard the water taxi would have cost us 100 Euros, so the staff at the hotel helped save us some money. I think we would stay here again. The other hotels in the same area with comparable ammenities were almost 100 euros more. It was clean, quiet, cool, and it had breakfast. I'd say it was somewhere between average and above average.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: FlorenceJune2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early June and were disappointed with our room. The room was very small - we booked a double room and there wasn't enough walking room with our 2 suitcases. The furniture and decor is very outdated. It was not what we were expecting based on the pictures and other reviews. Only upside was the location to the train station and the hotel staff, especially Fabio. Very personable and helpful. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would book a return stay”
Reviews.Author: mcorkran
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two nights of our Italian vacation in Venice at the Hotel Abbazia, and we couldn't have asked for a better place. The room was MASSIVE; we had booked a double superior room, but we ended up with the largest room in the place, which could easily sleep four or five people (it had a HUGE king-sized bed, a daybed, and a single bed, a separate dressing room/closet, and a bathroom through a little entry foyer.) Our only complaint about the room was the dinginess of the decor; everything seemed a bit too old to be completely clean. But the wonderful service we received and the helpful and pleasant staff made that matter very little. We would book this hotel again with NO hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “thank you mateo and staff”
Reviews.Author: gin1
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 day break at abazzia hotel, hotel is very easy to find from p. roma 5 minute walk. staff are all very friendly, my party consisted of 3 couples and we will all return soon. thanks mateo for the farwell drink.

Reviews.Title: “Abbazia was great”
Reviews.Author: CornellEngland
Reviews.Content: A group of 12 of us stayed for 3 nights in May. We checked out Trip adviser reviews & the hotel was as most people said GREAT. Mateo & other reception staff were very helpfull & friendly & always up for a bit of fun. Location was also very handy. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Abbazia!”
Reviews.Author: AsianCouple
Reviews.Content: VENICE: HOTEL ABBAZIA, VENICE: "VERY QUAINT HOTEL" DATE: May 23, 2007 REVIEWER: Asian Couple My husband and I stayed at this hotel overnight. At first, we were quite scared because we had to look for it along a very narrow alley. But we were pleasantly surprised when we found it. Very near the train station which was very convenient for us and modern facilities. The room was quite small and very few english channels but really clean and nice. They served a pretty decent breakfast for the price we paid. Their garden was also very pretty although it was still quite chilly when we were there. We had good pictures though. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tasi
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the hotel when we spent four days there in May post med cruise. Although we did not ask we were upgraded to a larger room, it was a little on the dark side (ground floor) but far larger than we anticipated. Great bathroom etc. The guys at the front desk were great fun, always ready with a joke and always so helpful. The breakfasts were interesting and we never went hungry. This place was just so handy to everything, we would definately stay there again and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: chessboard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is O.K., but not excellent. The garden didn't look at all like we saw it on the fotos of the hotel-homepage (there was no grass at all). We had a double superior-room, unfortunately looking the busy Calle Priuli and not to the garden (after 10 pm the Calle was quiet). The room was very clean, but not so big, as we expected. We will visit again this hotel, because it is quite convenient (near the station and to the Piazzale Roma) and the price (according to Venice-standard!!) is quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Venice Hotel Near Train Station”
Reviews.Author: WCEAGLE2
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in quad room with family (2 adults, 2 kids). Plenty of room. King bed with two single day beds. King mattress a little weak. Clean. Bathroom was fine and everything worked. Nice breakfast buffet. Wonderful front desk staff. They gave lots of advice for restaurants and day trips. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: screenname2000
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Abbazia. The hotel is great for the money. Breakfast was as much as you could eat and enought to last us all day (continental spread with cheeses fruit pastries etc). There were 2 single beds pushed together to make a double bed in a room 12 by 12 (small'ish). The room had air con and a really smart bathroom, towels changed every day and the sheets every other day. The bells are really loud the first day but as the days go on you notice them less and less. Would stay here again if we ever get to venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: mpaauwe
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at Hotel Abbazia for 2 nights in March 2007. We shared a double room for 100 Euros a night, a steal for such a nice hotel! The hotel is very conveniently located to the train station and a major vaporetto stop. It's not as close to some of Venice's main sites, but it was very easy to use the vaporettos to get around. Our room was even nicer than we expected! It was nicely decorated and clean. We had very large shuttered windows that looked out onto the alley below. The bathroom was large, clean, and well equipped. Our room also had a safe which I used during our stay. My only complaint about the room was the inch of dust on the rafters. The rest of the room was spotless, so why the filthy rafters? The staff were friendly and helpful, although we had very little interaction with them (too busy out seeing the sites). We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. Breakfast was not included, and we quickly figured out that we could eat for less money elsewhere. The common areas and garden are just gorgeous! We were awoken by church bells our first morning. We found out later about the Monastery nearby, and that the bells can be heard throughout Venice in the mornings. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice, especially for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ValpOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abbazia for one night before our cruise. Wish we had booked for another couple of nights. This Hotel and Staff were the perfect start to a marvellous trip. The bathroom was updated and everything was very clean. Breakfast in the dining room was a good start to the day. When we return to Venice we will definately stay at the Hotel Abbazia. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base ...”
Reviews.Author: holiday003
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our stay in Venice. It's a bit concerning from the outside (you walk up this tiny alleyway and the hotel entrance is very unassuming) but don't be put off - the inside more than makes up for it. Our room was small - but clean and well decorated. The bathroom was spacious, clean and modern with a great shower. No views from the bedroom - but it was quiet and peaceful, dispite being so close to the railway station. (You couldn't hear a thing - except the city bells that ring in the morning!) They offered a good selection for breakfasts - cold meats, cheese, boiled eggs,cereals, yogurt, breads and croissants etc. We didn't spend much time in the hotel as we were out sight seeing most of our trip - but there was a very nice lounge and bar area which looked great. The location next to the train station was very handy as we didn't have to try and lug our suitcases via a water taxi. There is also a vaperetto stop outside the train station ( S Lucia) with all of the main lines leaving from the station stop. We found that this was a great base to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Gulfie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything I expected- old venice charm, clean, close to transport links (train station walking distance, vaparetto the same) and restaurants, friendly helpful staff. The breakfast was absolutely great, coffee was the best I had. The reception staff even booked us the Ducale palace tour. The room a standard double was very comfortable, the bathroom was big and very clean, but if you have a little bit more to spend go for the suite or luxary option. The weather in Feb. was the only upsetting thing in the trip, it was very cold, foggy when we stayed in venice so the island trip (Murano, Burano & Torcello) although we were blown away, was very cold and could not see at all through fog, mist. Since it was Feb. the garden was not up to the standard in the photos but it was also a nice feature as you open windows to the garden side. All in all full marks and would recommend to anyone looking for a relaxing holiday in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Alivse and staff”
Reviews.Author: Shirley8520
Reviews.Content: Our wonderful trip to Venice was enhanced by our stay at the Abbazia Hotel. We are a group of 5 girlfriends who, when travelling in Europe, like to find a nice clean hotel where we feel safe and comfortable. We found it at the Abbazia. Rooms were small, but very clean, and the hotel staff were wonderful. The hotel manager, Alvise Vianello and his staff, Mirko and Matteo were incredible and went out of their way to see we were happy. The daily breakfast was a nice start to the day and the wait staff were very attentive, making sure we had plenty of coffee and tea. The beds in our rooms were great. Nice and firm and I didn't wake up with a back ache. I would love to have brought mine home with me. The hotel location was very good as well, located very close to the train station, which we used for a day trip, and only a few steps from lively shopping and resturants. All in all, I would readily recommend the Abbazia Hotel for your stay in Venice. Thank you, Alvise and staff, for a great stay in Venice. Shirley Williams

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave_and_Val
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Just a few hundred metres from the station and bus station down a quiet alleyway. Staff very helpful. Room excellent and rates very reasonable and includes breakfast. One of the best city break hotels we have used. Easy 50m distance access to vaporettos etc Will go there again if we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “As good as we had hoped”
Reviews.Author: chrisDalgleish
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel partly on a recomendation in lonely planet and partly from reviews on this site. The hotel is a haven of peace and quiet. The lounge bar is an excellent place to relax after a busy day. Our room (Superior double) was large by Italian standards and had a fine view over the garden. Staff were friendly and helpful. Although not in the centre of the city it is right next to a Vappareto stop or a great 25 minute walk through San Polo to St. Marks. Very good value for money, although we went at the end of the low season when prices are at their most reasonable. (Being Scottish this was a major draw). I would recomend this hotel to anyone and will probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: notu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abbazia on 3/5/07 & 3/6/07. I must say that the Hotel was a lovely budget option. Yes, you do have to walk down an alley to get there, but it is well worth it. The staff was wonderful & fluent in English. They had a delicious breakfast in the morning. The room was quite small, however it was decorated nicely. Ooooh and the bathroom! There was no shower, but the bathtub was wonderful. I spent almost 2 hours resting in there after my 12 hour journey!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: USAWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about Hotel Abbazia: the friendly and helpful front desk staff, the breakfast, the room and the hotel's convenience to the train station. It's about 5 minutes from the train station and a 3-4 minute walk to the water bus office. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Visit”
Reviews.Author: BrigitteDublin
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day trip to Venice. Our party was 3 Ladies of a "certain age". We stayed at Hotel Abbazia which near the station and water buses and the staff were excellent. Would definitely recommend it. Everyone should see Venice at least once

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bracken22
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the many positive comments I read about it on this website and I wasn't disappointed. The staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. Dennis (from Venice!), the barman, was fantastic too. When we arrived, because our room only had a bath and not a shower, they upgraded us at no extra cost! I have been ringing Abbazia's praises to my friends and will certainly return again, especially as we have fallen in love with Venice. A special thank you to all the staff who helped make our holiday so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly kind staff and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2CtheWRLD
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were so welcoming and kind. Our room was fabulous. I had requested a shower and they gave us a wonderful room with a lovely bathroom (with a large shower). We requested ice each evening (which I realize is not a common thing in Italy) and they went above and beyond to accomodate us without making us feel like silly tourists. This was the absolute dream trip for us. We stayed three nights total at the Abbazia - two before our cruise to the Greek islands and one after. I was so excited to be coming back to the hotel that last night (and looking forward to my last full day in Venice) and the staff at this hotel simply could not have been more wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: msgizelle
Reviews.Content: this hotel is considered a 3 star hotel, but that's an understatement. the hotel's exterior was a bit scary at first, but as they say never judge a book by its cover. the staff were incredibly helpful and sweet. the room was beautiful and clean. the location is a great spot for tourists because there is so much to do in this area of venice they call Ferrovia. i highly recommend this hotel. during my vacation in italy i stayed in 3 hotels, this was my (and my friends) favorite hotel. i would DEFINATELY stay here again when i come back to venice. great service, great location, clean and beautiful rooms, great selection for free breakfast every morning, and great price. it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staff and Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LadyDar
Reviews.Content: Our family of Four had A wonderful experience at the Abbazia. We cannot say enough about the pleasantness of the staff and The Hot Chocolate Croissants which greeted us at Breakfast table daily. Wishing to avoid the local' bus' to Murano they engaged a water taxi to take us over to Murano with other Hotel guest. The front desk staff made our 2nd trip to Venice a memorable one.(including recommending a wonderful Vivaldi concert in one of the churches) Be sure when being directed to areas outside the obviously signed touristy one's, to get precise directions as it took us well over an hour to find that concert!

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ohsevenphive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically convenient from both the waterbus and the railway station - this means that you don't have to carry cumbersome luggage on and off boats. A wide selection of pasticcerie, farmacie and supermarkets as well as lovely cafes and restaurants in this area also within an easy walk. Take advantage of the hotel's shuttle boat to Murano which is free and will give you a guided tour of a glass blowing furnace. We did that and caught the normal waterbus back after a lovely lunch on the water. The hotel rooms are very reasonably priced, the staff are terrifically helpful and the breakfast more than generous (especially as it is included) and included cereals, breads and meat, eggs and cheeses. Our room (302) was incredible! Massive bed and a beautiful bathroom with Jacuzzi and double vanity. I felt so lucky to have stayed in this fantastically lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: CiceroneWit
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks leading a group of fourteen students in Venice. The Hotel Abbazia was perfect. I had some initial doubts because it's so close to the train station, but they were completely unfounded. In contrast to many cities, the area around the Venetian station is quite nice, and since the hotel is around the corner, it still felt far enough away from the hustle of the pedestrian traffic. A former monastery from the nineteenth century, the building has a lot of character with a charming courtyard. The rooms are nice (if small) with terrific bathrooms. I can't say enough about the friendly and helpful staff. Because we made a number of day trips, the proximity to the train station turned out to be an immense advantage. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling on a moderate budget.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: daveangie
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel, convenient from train/coach drop of, 5minute walk. great location for water buses. try ginos restaurant we had a lovely reasonable priced meal just left from the hotel entrance. excellent very clean room. reception staff very friendly and breakfast very nice. no lift but porter helped us to our rooms. and if you are visiting venice you will be walking ALOT so a few more stairs really do not matter all that muh. would defintely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly, great location.”
Reviews.Author: NJNancy1
Reviews.Content: 3 moms booked this hotel because it was close the the train station.... it was so much better than we had hoped for. We had a room with two double beds and a day bed, a large armoire, and a marble tiled bath (very large by European standards). The front staff desk was great - on a rainy day they lent us umbrellas, gave us directions, laughed and joked. Because Venice is relatively small, it is extremely walkable. You are a short short walk to a main vaporetto station, which was extremely helpful. One night coming home from dinner on Burano, we got lost, and we were able to ask directions to "stazione di treno" and easily found our hotel again. Many locals did not speak much English, so learning a few key phrases worked like a charm! And yes, the church bells chimed early every morning. A small price to pay for such a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terriffic in every way”
Reviews.Author: wedgeclose
Reviews.Content: My family of four spent three wonderful days here in late August. All of the descriptions posted were very accurrate. The hotel is literally steps from the main train station. If you are arriving by train (recomended) from Rome or anywhere else the train trip to Venice is really nice and relaxing. The train from Rome was very modern and very reasonable in price. About a 4 hour trip but not at all uncomfortable. The Hotel Abazzia is tucked into an alley and is a converted monastery. We had a junior suite which was huge. The bathroom (for those who are into them) was VERY MODERN with jacuzzi. The front desk personel were beyond excellent! If you e-mail the hotel directly they will get back to you with accurate information within an hour or so. They really made our stay terriffic. The Grand Canal is right at the front door. The vaporettos stop regularly right in front and you can get anywhere in Venice from right there. There is a bridge over the canal right there also for easy access into other areas. Take advantage of the "free" water taxi to the island of Murano. It is free and a nice experience. You will buy some glass (which is why they offer it for free one way) so it is not a come on. Make a day out of going to Murano and then to sister island Burano (by vaporetto) for lace. Both islands are full of stores and restaurants spend an hour or two and then get the big ferry which takes you to St. Marks Square and the pigeons. You can take the vaporetto from st. marks back to your hotel. it takes about 30 minutes but you will stop at and see some amazing stations along the way. Also don't miss a trip to Lido Beach. It was really amazing to swim in the adriatic sea and the beach itself was really cool...and topless...get off the vaporetto and walk to the beach through all the upscale shops of Lido. Really and amazing place. Finally, back to Abbazia...the breakfast in the morning is good. some cold cuts, cheese, cereal, fresh baked muffins and breads and good coffee. there is a bar in the lobby which is very nice and a good place to just sit and veg. The casino is a short walk away....not las vegas...beware.....but all in all a good time. If you are flying out of Venice it is about a 10 minute walk to the main bus station. busses leave about every half hour...you need to buy a ticket for that bus in the bus station. The airport is about a half hour away and very modern. Venice is a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ElGrant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first vacation in years in Venice, and stayed at the Abbazia over December (traditionally a quiet season for tourism in Venice). The hotel is in an excellent location, close to the Plaza de la Roma and a vaporetto stop. There are also pleasant shops and restaurants nearby. Although the hotel is not really that hard to find, we got hopelessly lost on arrival. The trick is to look carefully to see the small alleyway on the first pass. (By the way, the little sandwich shop to the immediate left of the little alleyway serves fantastic food at very reasonable prices - perfect for a quick lunch! We would not, however, recommend the pizzeria a couple of doors further down - the food was awful, the music too loud and the service non-existent.) The hotelroom was beautiful, overlooking the private garden and the infamous bell tower. For late risers, we advise earplugs, as the bell tolls for a full minute at a time! However, as we were keen to explore as much as possible of the city, we welcomed the wake-up call. We also found a woodworm in the antique chair in our room - you'd be surprised at how loud they sound at 2 am! The staff were extremely helpful and spoke excellent English. Our stay would have been much poorer had we not met Denis, the wonderful hotel barman (try his Kahlua coffee!). He recommended several excellent restaurants, away from the normal tourist routes, and also gave tips on the best ice cream (Nico's Gelateria) and good authentic Venetian shopping (Via Garibaldi, on the eastern side of the city). The hotel does not have public internet access (unless you take your own laptop), but staff are happy to assist, or to point you to the nearest internet cafe. We found the hotel good value for money, and will happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: prinnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Abbazia two days before a cruise. This is a great budget hotel! The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They helped us with all our touristy needs, from restaurant recommendations to transportation. The rooms are small, they don't have any amenities, and we only had a shower (no tub), but the room was very clean. The rate included breakfast, which was excellent: warm croissants, bread, fruits, mortadella, coffee, juice and (best of all!) small packs of nutella. Located near the Jewish Ghetto area in Venice, this hotel is very close to Vaporetto and train stations. It's about a 20 minute walk to Piazza San Marcos (once you've mastered how to interpret the labyrinth that is the Venice map). This is not a pretty hotel, the outside is little run down, as well as the lobby area, and they do not have an elevator, but they more than make up for it with wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: abs1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the start of Dec 2006 and was probably one of the best hotels i have stayed in in Italy. Only downside was the church bells ringing at 7am ish in the morning! Breakfast was gorgeous-kept us going for the rest of the day. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and extremely helpful. I hope to vist Venice again this year and will definetly stay in this hotel again and I will also recommend to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended !”
Reviews.Author: bebe12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Abbazia during our 2 night stay in Venice. It was a truely great experience - the room was big in European standards, and the bathroom was absolutely wonderful, with an excellent shower. After a few substandard hotels in Italy, this was a godsend. The breakfast was great, and the service superb - fronkdesk personnel always greeted their guests with smiles and was ever willing to help. The hotel is only a few steps away from Santa Lucia train station, in a small lane which could be easily missed if you are not looking out for it, but it's the first lane to the left of Lista di Spagna ( the main street to the left of station exit ) so you won't go very wrong. Overall, this was a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel in all senses! I highly recomend it.”
Reviews.Author: elpasotravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel made my travel experience a very pleasant experience. I took my daughter to Italy as a graduation gift and it was one of the factors that made it something to be remembered. The hotel is rated three star hotel, the cost is more like for a two star hotel but I sincerely believe this hotel should be rated at least four stars. The rooms were luxurious and very very clean, the location very convenient, the price very affordable, the people at the hotel incredibly nice. I highly recomend this hotel to anyone going to Venice. I definitely plan to come back to this hotel next time I go to Venice. My email is aramirez2@sbcglobal.net in case you want to have more details

Reviews.Title: “Loved It ”
Reviews.Author: GoWander
Reviews.Content: Probably a well-kept secret in Venice...but not any more. This is a beautiful hotel. My room was clean, huge, elegantly decorated and very quiet (except for those church bells that rang early every morning...charming...but I thought it was my alarm clock and kept hitting the snooze!) The room looked out direclty onto the hotel'sprivate courtyard. Absolutely lovely. The bathroom was clean and well-appointed, as well. The breakfast was good (ham, cheese, bologna, breads, jams, cereal, juices, coffee, tea.) The location could not have been more convenient...close to the train station and the vaporetto stop and close to some really good restaurants and shopping (of course the island isn't that big, anyway.) I do plan on going back and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jamesallio
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel experience in Venice! Located steps from the train station, Santa Lucia (walk out of station, turn left, left on 2nd alley where there is a sign on the wall), hotel is packed with charm and is quiet even though it is less than a minute walking time from vaporetto, restaurants, shopping, schools, etc. Breakfast was good and waitress was cordial and delightful. Desk clerk Alvise gets top ratings for both charm and helpfulness. Would stay there anytime. Rooms beautifully appointed, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: budddd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abbazia for four nights, Nov. 9-12. Even though it is close to the train station (5 min. walk) it was quiet.
