Mirko, at the front desk, was very helpful suggesting several restaurants with great food. He was a very enjoyable person. The bed linens in the room were the most luxurious I'd ever experienced, so too the bath towels. The shower spray was also just perfect. The full breakfast that is provided was very filling and lasted us most of the day. There was hard boiled eggs, several different pastries, fruits, several juices, ham and salami, cheeses, hot chocolate, four kinds of cereal, and coffee, latte, and teas. I've probably left something out but it was very delicious. The hotel is at the Pte.Scalzi Bridge and right by the Ferrovia Vaporetto stop. (I'll try to include a picture). We got a great internet rate for our stay. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Abbazia again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryTeacher
Reviews.Content: We were warmly greeted upon arrival, checked in efficiently, and immediately shown to our beautiful room. This is a terrific hotel with lots to offer including: a big breakfast served from 7:30-11:00, portable computers with Internet that guests can take to their rooms, daily newspapers in several languages, in-room plasma screen TVs with Brittish CNN, and a lovely enclosed garden. The best aspect of our four-night stay was the service and the staff. They were all very professional and friendly, ever willing to help with maps, directions, train information, and entertainment suggestions. Concierge Mirko arranged a tour of a glass factory and vaperetto tickets. Raphael (with movie-star good looks) gave us great tips on museums and concerts. Our room was lovely and quite comfortable. The marble bathroom was equipped with updated fixtures, hair dryer, towel warmer, and big fluffy fresh towels. The hotel location is easy to find and convenient to the train station, bus/parking, vaperetti, major canal bridge, and is in a lively neighborhood with plenty of shops and sidewalk cafes. We were treated like royalty, as were all the other guests we encountered. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean, with Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Baltimoreguy
Reviews.Content: The Abazzia lived up to its high rating on TripAdvisor. Although our room was tiny (barely larger than the bed), it was equipped with a modern bathroom and the window opened onto a pleasant courtyard with fruit trees. Everything was clean and in good repair. Although the hotel is located in a lackluster neighborhood five minutes from the train station, the entrance is down a quiet alley and away from the noise of the street. The location proved to be a major advantage, making it easy to roll our baggage from the train station and to make day trips to Vernona and elsewhere. The staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English easily. The breakfasts were quite good and included cold cereal, fruit juice and fruit salad, as well as the usual pastries. Note: The churchbells next door ring loudly and persistently at 7:20 each morning. It's either charming or annoying, depending on how well you have slept. However, we would stay at the Abazzia again with no hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel to explore Venice from”
Reviews.Author: Muxima
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful four nights in this hotel in October 2006 - during the half term for English schools. It is ideally situated for exploring the city and quite near to the bus station which is where Ryan Air drops people off. You have to negotiate a couple of bridges so this might be difficult if you are not physically able. The hotel staff are lovely - they gave us excellent unbiased advice about restaurants and responded very quickly to othe coupls of requests we made. The hotel has an elegant lounge - and as a former abbey, complete with the bells of the neighbouring church still ringing at certain times, it oozes atmosphere. It has a four or five star feel to it yet the prices for drinks are very, very good. It is a genuine independent hotel which cares for its guests. Our room was small but beautifully decorated and we had a very modern and stylish bathroom - no bath but a 'Goliath' shower head! Breakfasts were continental but the croissants were piping hot and there was plenty of ham, cheese, salami and other fillers. If you want to savour the spiritual side of Venice, by the way, try to make Sunday Mass at St Mark's Cathedral and feast your eyes on the mosaics, your ears on the music and your nose on the incense.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: stokdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Abbazia for 3nites. Excellent hotel! Great value. Staff very friendly, English speaking, helpful and accomodating. Excellent location, just a few steps from the train stn. and vaparetto stop. Hotel is situated in part of an ancient monestary, and retains all of the charm and dignity, including the early A. M. bells! Our room was very spacious, as was the bathroom. Beeakfast included delicios fresh, HOT croissants. Lobby is a large turn of the century beaty, with large comfy sofas and the most enticing aromas. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miniboomer
Reviews.Content: We (two adults and a teenager) have just returned from 4 nights in Venice staying at the Hotel Abbazia on the basis of earlier recommendations. The review descriptions canâ€™t be faulted (for which thanks) and are full and accurate. Hotel Abbazia is good value for money. Itâ€™s conveniently located for public transport, itâ€™s clean and we found the staff without exception to be friendly, helpful and happy to go that extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abbazia exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: ladylawyer42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Abbazia for a week in October, and it exceeded all our expectations. We had the largest room in the hotel, and it was huge. It included a king-size bed, daybed, table and chairs, desk and nightstands. We also had a large bathroom, complete with Jacuzzi and a wonderful shower. There was a separate walk-in closet/dressing room. The air conditioning worked well and was needed at least on some days, as we had very warm and beautiful weather all week. The desk staff were extremely helpful, with good recommendations for restaurants and suggestions for sightseeing, and were very friendly and funny. They were able to get reservations for us for lunch at Locanda Cipriani on Torcello, and gave us good directions to get there. Breakfast was quite good, in terms of quality and quantity, although the staff seemed a little overworked. Overall, it was a great value for the money. Our only quibble was the lack of an elevator, but we really did not mind the stairs most days.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tappenden's
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. We did a lot of research before we booked, and this place was perfect. The staff were fantastic - helpful, friendly and very accommodating when asked of anything. The room was really large and clean, and I can't fault it. I would have given a 5 star rating but for the fact that the hotel bar never opened while we were there, which would have been good. The hotel is situated at the far end of the Grand Canal, which was good, as it wasn't totally touristy. We flew with Ryanair, and so got a bus to Venice from the airport, and the walk to the hotel was 10 minutes and quite easy to find, as it is right on the main canal, down a passageway, and there was a water-bus stop right outside too, which is great when your feet ache from all the walking. If I went back to Venice, I would book this same hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: luvtravl
Reviews.Content: Well situated nearby the train station and a vaporetto stop, I can highly recommend this hotel as a wonderful place to stay while visiting beautiful Venice. Previously an abbey, the hotel is attractive and well priced, with clean, spacious rooms overlooking a garden, comfortable furnishings, and excellent breakfast options in the breakfast room, and very helpful staff. A member of our group had to return home due to a death in the family after only 2 nites and the staff were wonderful, helping with emergency travel arrangements and sending a fax to the hotel in Rome to cancel their stay. The staff did everything they could to reduce the stress of our fellow travellers and help those of us remaining to enjoy the rest of our stay. This hotel was a great find. If we get the opportunity to return to Venice we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter95
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel converted monastery, located next to train station not to far from car parks yet opposite side to St Marks Square. Rooms clean and comfortable. Reception/Bar staff very helpful however staff at breakfast not so pleasant and not so eager to serve.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MkeB
Reviews.Content: We researched hotels pretty extensively for a European vacation that began in Munich, and ended in London. The Hotel Abbazia was a pretty easy choice for us as the hotel was located very near the train station, which was how we were arriving. We had decided early on we didn't want the hassle of porting luggage very far in this city. The hotel is indeed very close to the train station, but far enough away that noise was never a problem. The alleyway to the Hotel is very small and we almost missed it completely. Once we arrived the staff was terrific and very friendly helping us by providing directions and recommendations all around the city. Fabio, Alvise and Mathew were all wonderful, and did a great job helping us get around this wonderful city. Rooms were large enough, with decent and clean bathrooms, air conditioning worked fine, and the breakfast every morning of our stay was really nice. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly convenient hotel with informal atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BinkyB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbazia for 3 nights in late August 2006. We had a standard double room overlooking the garden. Staff: very friendly, speaking excellent English which compensated for our basic Italian Communal areas: clean, tidy and tastefully decorated - Abbazia is classic in decor without looking dated. Breakfast room was small with tables close together but courtyard/garden is available from 9am onwards. Breakfast: bread rolls, sweet-filled croissants, meats, cheese, jams/honey, fruit juices, fresh coffee, tea. Was ample to keep us full until lunchtime. We found that food came out in stages as there was only one waitress who was serving coffee/tea and clearing dishes whilst replenishing and setting out the food. Room: Standard room of a good size with good quality furnishings. The decor was all blue which made the room dull and dingey. TV offerings were dire - only one English speaking channel which was CNN - I know you don't go to Venice to watch TV but I do like to watch a decent news channel! Bathroom was a bit of a let down as shower was simply a mixer tap on the bath with no curtain or glass panel. However it was adequate when we had mastered the art of not getting the water all over the bathroom whilst washing! Location: Fantastic location for everything especially bus and train terminals (i'm not sure which way the previous reviewer went to carry luggage over so many bridges as we had no problem from P Roma!!). Vaporetto stop within yards although we found most places to be walkable (San Marco about 45mins slow pace) - part the fun of Venice is to wander around the little streets investigating and exploring, something that would be missed by taking the vaporetto from A to B. Overall: We liked this hotel as it suited our approach to holidays - laid back, chilled out and friendly. If you are looking for a highly efficient, highly polished, pristine hotel where service is delivered immediately then this might not be for you. We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: grumpytraveller
Reviews.Content: Having looked in some detail at the other reviews by members who stayed at this hotel we booked a superior room which overlooked the internal courtyard/garden and stayed for several days in August. Previous reviewers have described the hotel and its facillities very accurately. The hotel was of a good standard in a very good location (for arriving and for the water buses) and we found nothing to let our stay down. We found the breakfast to be of a good standard even though not very varied (as you might expect in Venice). All in all pretty good value and we would have no reason not to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RD77
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of the nice reviews on this site. We weren't disappointed -- it was a wonderfu little hotel. Staff was just fantastic, very jovial and accommodating. All spoke very good English. I was prepared for the infamous alley-way, but the wife nearly balked. Both of us laughed about it later, as the hotel itself is quite nice. The superior room was spacious and well appointed. Bathroom was large and modern, with a nice enclosed shower. Air conditioner was excellent. Nice breakfast at an indoor garden (beware of the pigeons). We made the mistake of taking a bus from the airport. The distance to the hotel wasn't bad, it was dragging the luggage over those bridges with all the steps. In fact, the final bridge I ended up hiring a guy to help carry our luggage over -- there was no way I could make it without leaving some pieces unguarded at one side or the other. Train is the ideal way, it's only a half a block walk to the terminal. It's at the opposite end of the island from St. Marks, but the fun of Venice is the boat rides or even a nice walk.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: OKBrit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbazia at the end of July and picked it based on the good reviews on this forum and the convenient location near the train station. I was delighted with both the hotel and the easy walk from the station. If you are arriving/departing by train it is an excellent idea to pick this location. We saw many people lugging their luggage on the Vaporettos and up and down stairs and bridges - it looked like a nightmare (thank you tripadvisor forums - I would never have realised this in advance if not for the helpful tips). Do not be put off by the approach to the hotel which is down a not very prepossessing alley (I knew this in advance but the rest of the group wondered where on earth I was taking them!). We arrived very hot and tired after 5 hours on a train from Switzerland - with no airconditioning due to some problem. As anyone who went to Europe this summer knows - it has been very hot. We were probably pretty grubby and miserable looking when we arrived - but the front desk was very welcoming and we were soon feeling a lot happier. The rooms were pleasant and had airconditioning - not the freezing variety we know and love in the USA but enough to provide welcome relief from the heat and humidity. The front desk were always very pleasant and helpful. Loved the hotel and it's ambiance. I really enjoyed the area - lots of nice little shops and away from the main tourist crowds. And getting to the tourist areas was easy with a Vaporetto stop nearby. The only bad thing - we were only there 2 days. I am trying to figure out how and when I can go back for a longer visit to really explore Venice. And yes I would choose the Abbazia again. Oh one tip - try and learn even a few basic Italien words - please/thank you/good morning etc. It is amazing how much more pleasantly people respond when you make some effort even if you are not fluent.

Reviews.Title: “Not dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: bibapoth
Reviews.Content: HOTEL - We have stayed in a numbder of 3* hotels in the UK and USA - but this is by far the best 3* we have ever stayed in. We stayed in a standard room - the room and bathroom were immaculately clean. Staff were helpful and spoke good english. A generous continental buffet breakfast is on offer in the morning with fresh coffee or tea. LOCATION - The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Santa Lucia train station - but you can not hear the "train / station noise". Its tricky to find though....... take a left when leaving the train station and then just after the bridge take a left into an alley way - after a few yards you will see the hotel sign. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: perthmember
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of it's location near the station, and on the strength of the positive reviews. The location was indeed very convenient, an easy walk with luggage from the train, and close to the vaporetto stop. The staff were friendly and welcoming on check in, however the rooms proved very disappointing. Make sure you check that you are offered a renovated room, ours was small, shabbily furnished, and had dirty carpet and walls. The bathroom was very basic and small, and there was a problem with the shower draining. We initially did not have a very good response to our complaints, being told that this was a standard room, and if we wanted better, we should have booked a superior or a suite, as these were rooms that had been more recently renovated. We were charged Euro 205, including child, for one night, then we were moved to a superior room, (at extra cost, no problem with that). This room was very spacious, more recently decorated, and cleaner, but the bath (this time no shower) had a similar problem with draining. Apart from these issues, there is a small pleasant garden area for breakfast (but you have to be lucky to get one of the few tables, otherwise it is a large indoors dining room), and a nice bar/lounge area to sit in. A nice touch was the communal bookshelf in the hall, where guests could borrow (or deposit) books. We were however disappointed with the attitude to standard rooms: we think that clean carpets and walls, unchipped furniture, and functioning bathrooms are mandatory in such an establishment, not reserved for the more expensive rooms. If some rooms are of a lesser standard due to gradual refurbishment, this should be made very clear at time of booking.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: gandt
Reviews.Content: It was June 7 and we had spent the past 2 weeks battling a left hand drive car, the autostrade & trying to get 4 people to make a decision on where to eat!. Although we had loved every destination on our journey to date, Venice was to be our haven and our first opportunity to be on our own. My partner & I ready to soak in the romance - WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED! We stepped out of the train station, after having dropped the car off in Mestre, and were taken in by the beauty (and overwhelmed by the tourists). The hotel was literally 3 minutes walk away from the station. We were greeted by the amazing Matteo - who's smile lit us up and sense of humour had us in hysterics for two days! The room was lovely, the gardens a wonderful sanctuary. Only complaint - bells at 7.15am. I know it's not that early but it is Italy and you don't go out until 9 or 10 at night, and mosquitoes - beware holes in the flyscreens. There are no lifts so you have to lug your luggage from your room when you leave - Matteo wouldn't dream of us taking it up. If you do decide to stay - take in the amazing sitting room (an old chapel) and do take the time to get to know the staff. They were all accomodating and friendly. We didn't stay long enough.

Reviews.Title: “godd hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: shellyshols
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else has said the hotel is in a very good location being so near the train station and the vaporetta stops. The rooms were lovely and clean with a good sized bathroom and air condtioning. The reception staff were very efficient, helpful and friendly. However the breakfast was diappointing and as another reviewer has said the outside area was spoilt because of the birds eating the food off the tables, particularly the pigeons. This could have been easily remedied by putting a net over the breakfast area, as other hotels have done, or getting a big cat! Also the tables were not cleared very quickly, another reason the birds were a problem. There was only one very surly waitress clearing up. It was difficult to get her attention to bring coffee, as she just was not interested and clearly didn't want to be working there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: excited4europe
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with this hotel. We arrived at 9:00 am after being on an overnight train so we were very tired. The second that the hotel worker saw us, he opened the door for us and helped ur with our bags! It was the first time that this ever happened. Our room was not ready so he then offered us the restroom, fully stocked with face towels so that we could freshen up. Aftef that, he even offered us the breakfast buffet!!! again, a first for me. My fiance and I were able to clean up, and eat, so we fully enjoyed our day in wonderful Venice. Now the room...It was also wonderful! Air conditioned, clean, and bathroom stocked with shampoo, and body wash. The bed was large, and we also had a huge closet cabinet. It was a great hotel, i would stay there again, and i would highly reccommend it for other people. Don't worry about the location, some think that it is bad to be near the train station, but in Venice, it is a blessing. and, if you are like me, you will enjoy any part of venice, as it is all impressive, even by the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Kieran1OO1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few days ago and was very satisfied with the overall standard for the price. I think that the main reason that this hotel gets such consistently good ratings are: 1)Several employees are outstanding. They make a huge difference, and made our experience a very pleasant one. 2)Itâ€™s location beside the train station means that guests are not compelled to carry heavy suitcases for long distances to get to their hotel. It is also less than a 2 minute walk to the nearest waterbus stop. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to the historic Ghetto area. A walk to St Markâ€™s Square, on the other hand, takes about 35/40 minutes. The clean air-conditioned rooms are of a good quality for the price but hardly exceptional. Our bathroom did not have a shower and obviously running a bath takes longer, so this was a bit of a drag every morning, but all in all, just a minor inconvenience. Breakfast is about average by Italian standards. It includes ham and a selection of cheeses, and a range of breads and cereals. Prices in both the main bar and the room minibar are very reasonable, particularly when compared to elsewhere in Venice, which is very expensive, even by Italian standards. Most hotels only seem to want to rip you off with the price they charge for additional services, so this was a new and remarkable departure. I have only one complaint. The outdoor breakfast area is infested with scavenging pigeons and other birds, hopping about on recently vacated tables looking for scraps. I cannot understand why so many other reviewers rave on so much about this area. Usually an hotelâ€™s outdoor breakfast area is packed during good weather but here it was usually less than half full. This speaks for itself. Not surprising when you consider that pigeons are major disease carriers - not for nothing are they frequently referred to as flying rats! I think that the hotel management should address this problem. Overall though , I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adored the Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: kilkennycat
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but after our wonderful experience at this hotel, I promised myself that I would as soon as I returned home. We spent the last 3 nights of a 13 night trip to Italy at this hotel and found it absolutely excellent in every way. The staff bent over backwards in their efforts to be of help. the barman was a font of knowledge about the area and Italy in general and the room was luxurious and elegant with stunning shimmery fabric on the walls and excellent air conditioning. The bathroom was large and elegant. ( we had treated ourselves to a superior double room) It was a beautiful haven of peace, tranquility and excellent customer service. One word of warning, the nearbybells toll rather noisily at 7 o'clock in the morning but then again what an excellent wake-up call to encourage you out and about to the beauty that is Venice. I thought this hotel was excellent value for an excellent location. I couldnt recommend it enough

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: trpplnr
Reviews.Content: Out of the four hotels we stayed in during our trip to Europe, this was the best. And the other hotels supposedly had three and four stars. Hotel Abbazia was very clean, the shower and bathroom were a nice size and the room was comfortable and quiet. We stayed in a Superior Double Non-Smoking Room. Mirko, at the front desk, was very friendly and more than happy to help us. Another gentleman who was on the evening shift, we don't know his name, was also very friendly. He recommended a great local restaurant that served authentic food, and we loved that the menu was only in Italian. We were the only tourists there and it was packed. A nice waiter was happy to help us decipher the menu. The breakfast at Hotel Abbazia was great and they have a lovely area in the garden where you can eat. The staff is helpful and friendly. They have a luggage storage room and a bar in a pretty room detailed in wood. The location is very convenient, it is right near the train station and the main vaporetto stop, yet tucked into an alley, so still very quiet. We would absolutely recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at Hotel Abbazia for three days in May 2006. I cannot gush enough about the many facets of this hotel- the location, the room, the atmosphere, the staff- everything was so wonderful. The hotel is filled with antique tapestries, glass ware and furnature that gives you a sumptuous feeling. It is very convienient for water buses and the train station, which was perfect for us because we were traveling to Florence after Venice. We arrived earlier than the stated check-in time by about 1 hour. The staff prepared our room in a half-hour and made us espresso during our short wait. The large sitting room adjacent to the lobby is so amazing! We stayed on the first floor of rooms, down a long, quiet hallway. Our room had two full-length balcony windows facing the courtyard, which was lushly green with banana trees and flowers. Even though our room was considered a "standard" room, it had two areas separated by an arch- the bedroom and a sitting room with a table and upholstered chairs. The walls of our room were covered with a gold brocade fabric that shimmered in the evening. There were also chandeliers in both areas. The bathroom was enormous compared to Italian standards- approximately 10x6 feet. The only downer was the shower was attached to the wall, so we had to sit on the edge of the large tub and bathe that way rather than stand for our shower. The bathroom was impecably clean and the linens really were linen! But the towels were thick and fluffy. The room had a very large closet with a safe and extra blankets and pillows. The breakfast buffet included with your room tariff is wonderful and the waitstaff that bring you caffe' and the' are friendly. You can eat in the garden on good days, and they set up a buffet outside for your convience. Every morning there was warm custard-filled brioche as well as hard-water rolls, Parma ham, provolone, yoghurts, jams, and my favorite- Nutella! There was also three types of juices, one of which was I think mango. There was also fresh fruit. The best part of our experience was the gentlemen at the reception desk- they were so kind and helpful, and even made us a tea tray one evening when my mom mentioned she was craving tea. They also arranged a private taxi to Murano for us and a tour of a factory- NOT a high-pressure "tourist trap." We also had drank some water our last night and when we settled our bill, they tore up our mini-bar receipt and didn't charge us the 2,60 euro for it. It's a small thing, but I remembered it. If you are reading this and have spent weeks looking for "THE place" to spend your precious days in Venice, Hotel Abbazia is it! It made our experience so wonderful, and the three days we spent there set us off in a great direction for the rest of our two-week vacation. Also, here are some tips: -When you arrive, buy a ACTV (public transport) pass. Aside for getting you around, the views along the canal and in the lagoon and basin are breath-taking. -Walk sesteri S. Marco at night, it is mysterious and magical. In the Piazza there is a string quartet playing and the gas lamps are burning. Pick up a hot chocolate to go from a caffe- it is called cioccolato in tazzo. It is like melted chocolate bars. Unforgetable. -Whatever you do, DON'T get a Bellini at Harry's Bar- they're 14 euro EACH and that isn't at a table! Oh, and they're about 4 oz. too. I sought out Harry's Bar because it was in all the travel guides, but it wasn't that great of an experience and bloody expensive to boot. -Finally, get lost in Venice. That was the best experience we had was weaving in and out of alleys. We saw REAL Venitians, not throngs of tourists! We traveled down alleyways so narrow our shoulders brushed walls, and found shops, wine bars, caffes and beautiful sights we wouldn't have seen otherwise. And if you get the opportunity, take a ,50 cent traghetto ride- so terrifying but exhilirating and you'll never forget your jaunt across the Grand Canal standing in a gondola!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May, 2006. The staff were extremely friendly and helpfu, the breakfast above average and the location perfect for arrival by train. The rooms were similar to others we found in Italy, but had all the room and comfort you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Staff and Room Stayed at Hotel Abbazia 3 nights in venice. It is conveniently located by the train station and I could not hear the trains at all. It is also located a block away from the water taxis so you can get to all parts of venice quickly and see the city like a tour. I left my cell phone there and they shipped it to the U.S free of charge. Had agreat time in venice with my wife and the Staff at this hotel is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: malysa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel abbazia on june 5th-7th. We were very pleased with this hotel. The satff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was in a great location, very close to train station, resturaunts, the grand canal. Rooms were spacious and clean. I would recommend this hotel it was great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “great location if traveling by train”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Abbazia was perfect for our needs; we traveled throughout Italy for 19 days only by train and water ferry. The location of the hotel is perfect. From the train station, it's a three minute walk yet the hotel is set off down an alley so that the noise factor is non-existent. The staff all speak English and are extremely polite and really enjoy joking with Americans. The room was spacious and the bathroom was set up in such a manner that the shower in the bathtub was mounted on the wall high enough that normal size people could take showers even though there was no shower curtain. The breakfasts were adequate and the ferry system to tour venice was just down the ally way. The only precaution is for late sleepers. The hotel is leased by an abbey and every morning at 7:15AM the bells at the adjacent church ring loudly. If that's you're normal time to wake up you don't need a wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: flapenny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel with a group of people May 25-29, 2006 for my first visit to Venice. It is close to the train station, vaporetto stops, and private wter taxis; however, it is in a quiet area which transports you to peace and tranquility. A former monastery, it radiates warmth and comfort. Our room was small by American standards, but perfect for us with A/C, TV, nice private bath with shower, and honor bar. The rooms are immaculate, as is the rest of the hotel. The lobby and sitiing area is furnished with comfortable chairs and sofas, with a bar serving drinks in the evening. A lovely courtyard holds tables and chairs for those who chose to spend a peaceful afternoon with birdsong. The breakfast (included in the price) has a good variety of continental choices. There are several trattorias and bars a short distance from the hotel. The best part of the Abbazia, though, is its staff. Matteo, Fabio, and Raphael make you feel welcome immediately and will help with any request you may have. All of the staff speak English very well. I have read people complain about the church bells in the morning, but they never bothered me. It may be a little hard to find, but if you face Canneregio from the base of the Scalzi Bridge looking toward the buildings on the train station side, look for the narrow opening by the Olympia Cafe. Pass down a few yards and the hotel entrance is on the right. I hope to return to Venice again and will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “VEry good experience”
Reviews.Author: Michelangelo77
Reviews.Content: I think all the good about this hotel has been said and I can confirm it. The breakfast could improve, it opened a bit late, at 7.30 and the cappuccino offered wasn't so good. Otherwise, good room, friendly staff, good value and the inside garden is wonderful. If you have a room with a window on it you can wake up with birds singing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: inbetweendays
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights May 23-25. We arrived in Venice by a long train ride from Nice, therefore we were grateful that the hotel is just a few steps away from the train station! We were greeted by a super friendly front desk staff who spoke perfect English. He also gave us a map and gave a 5-min orientation of the city. A porter helped with our luggage and led us through a gorgeous bar/lounge area, up the stairs and hallway which leads to our beautiful room. The room was air-conditioned, had a safe, a TV, and it was beautiful and looked exactly like the photos on their official site. The bathroom was spacious and well equipped (hair dryer, nice toiletries...) We loved the church bell and didn't find it too loud at all. In fact, you hear church bells ringing all over Venice throughout the day. Breakfast was complimentary and was quite a spread: croissants, yogurt, meats, cheese, rolls, cereal, coffee and 3 different kinds of juice. We also had a drink at the lounge area and enjoyed our chat with the friendly bartender, who was born and raised right here in Venice! If we ever go back to Venice, we would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Abbazia again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Abe1968
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Abbazia Hotel before our Mediterranean cruise on the Grand Princess. I booked the hotel based on the reviews here in tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel was everything previous reviewers said it would be. The Abbazia rooms, common areas and grounds were immaculate. Our superior rooms were lovely with great bathrooms. The staff all spoke English and were extremely helpful. For those of you who will be taking a cruise which leaves from Venice, the Abbazia has a great solution for transfers to the port. We were afraid our only solution to get to the cruise terminal was a water taxi because of the large amount of luggage the 4 of us had. The Abbazia staff arranged for a Porterage Service. Because of the Abbazia's close proximity to the Santa Lucia train station (about 300 feet) a porter from the train station brought a large luggage cart and towed our luggage to the train station where we were put on a van and driven directly to the cruise terminal. Instead of an 80+ Euro charge for a water taxi, the cost was only a flat rate of 40 Euros for the 4 of us plus 3 Euros per bag that they had to transport. We LOVED the Abbazia and would highly recommend it for anyone travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 of us stayed at the Abbazia for 2 nights in May. When we first saw the tiny alleyway that led to the hotel we were very cautious, on entering the hotel we were very surprised and extremely pleased. This is a wonderful hotel, extremely clean and well looked after. The staff were very helpful and friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Although the hotel is located in a side street, it is in a very central area for the water buses, water taxies, gondolas etc, as well as being conveniently located for walking over the bridges. The hotel has a large breakfast room which opens at 7.00 and also a terraced garden where breakfast is served from 9.00. The breakfast is typically continental but satisfying. When you come out of the hotel, just along the alley way is a wonderful Italian restaurant called Al Sandalo - where you can get an excellent meal at a reasonable price. We ate there several times. For anyone visiting Venice, this hotel is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Abbazia”
Reviews.Author: Skodaireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Abbazia hotel for two nights in May 2006. Four of us in a group, one couple and one mother/teenage daughter. We all loved the hotel. As it was May you could choose to have your breakfast in the garden (courtyard type) or indoors. The breakfast was european standard but quiet good. Both our rooms were beautifully decorated in typically venetian stye. I would highly recommond this hotel. It is right beside the train/bus station so was stragecially placed for hauling luggage around. One tiny little problem, because it is part of a working Monastery the bells will ring at about 7.15 am. If you like to sleep on it may be a problem!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in a Frommer's guidebook while planning my trip, and I booked it because of it's proximity to the train station. I was traveling with my mom, and I knew I couldn't drag her luggage and mine all over Venice. We were pleasantly surprised to find that our standard double room had been upgraded upon our arrival. We had a spacious room with three twin beds, and an enormous bathroom. The hotel itself is beautiful and tranquil, and the staff was simply excellent. I will definitely stay there again on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: SLC24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect as a base to see Venice. After a long train ride, my family and I didn't want to lug our suitcases all over the hard to naviage streets of Venice. This hotel is right next to the train station down a very charming little street - so small, you may pass it right by! The service at the hotel was wonderful. They helped us pick out some wonderful restaurants and set us up (for free) with a private boat to Morano to have a tour of a glass blowing factory. Be careful though, the factory does this in hopes that you will buy lots of expensive glass! The rooms felt slightly lived in, but they were clean and I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to train station and ferry stops”
Reviews.Author: CMMNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only a few hundred yards from the Santa Lucia Train Station (make a quick left after the church) and well situation for the main ferry routes which are also only a few hundred yards away. The hotel is a renovated Abbey and there is a nice feel to the front desk and common areas (wood paneling, high ceilings.) Front desk staff was wonderful (this from someone who hardly ever comments on staff.) Rooms are clean and adquate space wise. Bathrooms are modern and tiled. Yes, there are church bells at 7:00 a.m. Breakfast typical European Continental. If you are arriving by train, this is an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonicaTraveler108
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Abbazia last week for 2 nights. This is an exceptionally nice, comfortable, well run hotel, right off the Grand Canal. It's location near the train station is a big plus making it easy to get to from the airport as well. The rooms are comfortable, the bathrooms even better, the front desk staff is knowledgeable and friendly - all speak english and the 3 people who helped us on different occassions gave terrific suggestions for restaurants and helped us use the water bus system. A special thanks to Mirkol at reception - he is a great source of information about the city and was genuinely nice and helpful. The breakfast is included, and very good. I travel a lot and count this stay among the best experiences - at any cost. We'll be back - soon, I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Train Station!”
Reviews.Author: LauraSF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights and could NOT be happier. The service was beyond excellent. All of the front desk clerks were super friendly and seemed genuinely eager to check in with us whenever they saw us and help us in any way. The bartender was also really funny and also extremely attentive and friendly. I stayed in a triple with three other people and while floor space was limited, it was still a large room that was very lovely and very clean. The bathroom was awesome - it had a huge jetted tub and a large sink area. As another poster said, it is super close to the train station, down the first alley once you take a left. Oh! And if you get a chance, when you are in the bar/sitting area of the hotel - find the stairway up to the pulpit and poke your head through.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: RomewardBound
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Abbazia. Can't recommend it enough. We had a triple superior room - booked a standard triple but the front desk upgraded us for free upon check in. Staff was wonderful, very helpful, always available. Our room was very spacious as well as the bathroom. The shower was enclosed with glass doors. No bathtub as is standard in most European hotels. The 'double' bed was the size of an American king size. The lobby/sitting room was charming and the breakfast was the most substantial we had in Italy. It is true about the bells - but I considered that part of the charm of the place. It is owned by monks after all. A 2 minute walk from train station. A little bit of a hike from Saint Mark's Square but the boats are plentiful and easily to use. If you walk as we did several times there are plenty of very interesting little streets, shops and residence areas to see along the way. Some members of our travel party will be in Venice in June and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Good Location / Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ALauHongKong
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel at a good and safe location. It is very close to the trian statation and easy to find. The hotel staff are all very nice and helpful especially Alvise. I booked the hotel with him through email. He immediately knew me when I checked in and gave us a superior triple room at a standard rate (EUR115 per night). The room is big and the bathroom is also big too. It faces the inner garden. There is only one window and so there is not much light. But we were out all day and so it doesn't matter. The hotel is warm with heating and so it's good in such a cool weather. The breakfast is quite good as the bread are freshly made. I will certainly stay at this hotel again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An elegant and charming hotel. We found the reception staff very friendly and helpful and could not fault the hotel at all. The early morning bells were expected and not unreasonable (they reminded us that others had to be up and about while we could enjoy the comfort of bed for a while longer) The room was far superior to what we expected, having booked a standard room - I only wish we had taken photos. Perhaps we were lucky - we certainly were with the weather - but we intend to return to the Abbazia when we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: Suilven
Reviews.Content: This really is a very pleasant place to stay. The management and reception staff were particularly friendly and helpful. The rooms were fairly simply furnished but more than adequate, and very clean. The building has considerable character and the long lounge is very restful. The location is very handy for arrival and departure, with a waterbus stop at the end of the lane and the train station only a couple of hundred metres away. There is no shortage of places to eat in the area. Being some distance from the crowds around San Marco is probably a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as it seems”
Reviews.Author: chrisbodo
Reviews.Content: well where do i begin, stayed in Superior Double room in mid december ok its not a BAD hotel as hotels go but it is nothing compared to the hype its getting on here. i saw all the 5 plus ratings and thought it would be great but there were just so many things:- 1. faulty aircon 2. locked (therefore unusable) safe 3. stained carpets 4. exposed wiring around light fitings 5. ants in bathroom 6. ants at breakfast table (by the juice cups) 7. windows had shutters 90% closed from outside (hence no view) 8. noone at reception for a while when arrived so us and a postman with parcel were left hanging about 9. bells ring very loud in morning i dont meen pleasent chimes i meen full on loud bells that rang over 100 times! 100! at exactly 7.20am then again a hour later,it lost its appeal after the first 50 im all for some cultural bells but that was too much as your very close to them. 10. no shower curtain 11. wanted to keep passports until checkout-but if desk is not 24 hour would you chance it (noone gets my passport!) 12. thought i could smell burning/smoke tracked the smell to bathroom thought extractor fan which was unbearably loud when on was faulty turned out to be a towel,yea seriously the towel smelt of smoke so much i could smell it from the bed! ive never known anything like it,it was only one of them though. i asked for some items to be resolved at reception got told exactly this "it would take a long time" i stared blankly for a while and then prompted him for a better answer "so does that meen you will fix them or what" answer "erm...hmmmm...well i get them fixed but take long time" -when i asked him when he said "when you go out will be fixed by time you get back" got back nothing done! safe still locked etc if i was there more then two nights i would have gone somewere else. place had potencial and the breakfast man did a great job of looking after people on his own every morning,always pleasent etc. but i just felt let down by the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: efc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the train station yet so quiet. It's also easy to find and my wife and I were immediately greeted by a friendly staff who spoke perfect English. Nice big room with the biggest wash-basin we've ever seen! Broadband internet access was dirt cheap at 5 euros per day (we had our own laptop computer)! Breakfast was oh-so-delicious! Our only criticism was the lack of a shower curtain which made it quite difficult taking a shower standing up.

Reviews.Title: “what a peaceful, cosy place!”
Reviews.Author: poodleby
Reviews.Content: I booked the Abbazia with trepidation after reading a review that mentioned the standard rooms not being up to scratch. I needn't have worried. Our twin room was spotless, recently refurbished with hardwood floors, power shower with glass surround, nice furniture, lovely new beds and digital air con. The lounge is as characterful and cosy as it looks on the Expedia website. We had Christmas day there and the staff were lovely and speak perfect English. It was well heated for those going in winter (as Venice was cold in Dec/Jan). It was so peaceful even though it is down a lovely alley near the train station. We couldn't hear thr trains but could hear the church bells quite early! However it was a joy to hear them over xmas and we went back to sleep. If you are a lazy bug you will be pleased to hear that breakfast is served until 11am. Cannareggio is a great place to stay and has loads of character. The hotel is really easy to find and in a great location. Buy your all day travel tourist vaporetto tickets for 10 euros by the vaporetto stop opp the train station and explore the islands until you drop!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Very close to the train station so you dont have to haul any of your bags all over town or over the difficult bridges. Off a small side alley which keeps it quiet, with very helpful staff. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Staff, Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff at The Abbazia was absolutely wonderful. They were as friendly and helpful as can be. A++++++ service. The hotel itself is wonderful, great location, 1st stop off of the water bus from the parking area and very easy to locate. The room was nice with a very large bathroom and a comfortable bed. The room did smell a slight bit musty, but afterall, you are on a series of islands, so it is understandable. The commone areas very large and spacious and well decorated. Breakfast was excellent and the most choices of any our hotels in Italy. Venice was our favorite city in all of Italy and I would highly recommend The Abbazia and Venice very much to any trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our vacation”
Reviews.Author: bryce13
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel of our entire European vacation. It was beautiful! So Italian, the room and bathroom were clean and pretty. The room was also well air conditioned. The breakfast was delicious and free!! A beautiful outdoor eating area. The decoration was warming and pretty. Above all else, the people who worked there were among the nicest we came across in all of Europe, they spoke English well and were inclined to do so. The bartender even made us special drinks! Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: eve-boots
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay at this hotel which we chose following the reviews on this site. Great location, only 10 minute walk from the bus station which provides a quick link to the Marco Polo Airport. Only gripe is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and no room service on a sunday afternoon after a very long day sightseeing, but that is minor complaint. Good breakfast, rooms cleaned daily and lovely hot powerful showers. The bells ring for a couple of minutes but I think it would be hard to get away from bells anywhere in Venice. Nice Trattoria down the alleyway (second one from the direction of the hotel) - very reasonable prices (40 euros) compared to some in the main thoroughfare - avoid the Carretoni trattoria.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again - well recommended”
Reviews.Author: RichardJersey_UK
Reviews.Content: We have visited Venice before but this hotel was fantastic value. Tucked away, it's a little gem. Our room was spacious and excellently appointed - even the free bathroom condiments were top class! The main convent areas lend marvellous character to the hotel - don't miss the pulpit! We had a lovely breakfast in the secluded garden in the early morning sunshine. It's close to everywhere you might want to be and the staff were friendly and attentive. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific. Excellent location - near the train station. With this location, you don't need to drag your luggage onto a boat and then all over the city until you find your hotel. The vaporetti (boat along the grand canal) is very easy to figure out and convenient. Get the one day pass (or more if you stay longer) and you can see the whole city. The ride to St. Marks is not long from the hotel and you will want to take the ride up and down the Grand Canal anyway. The room was a good size and very comfortable. Note, though, that there are no elevators in the hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: dipdop
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the left about 50 yards up a 4ft wide alley directly opposite Scalzi bridge. As has been said, the reception and bar staff are very friendly, helpful and funny. Gorgeous lounge/bar area to sit and relax in - cheap bar prices too! Room was great as well (superior twin) and had nice bathroom with shower cubicle and good high pressure shower. Breakfast was nice continental with usual meat/cheese croissants, boiled eggs, jams etc. The hotel is not next to San Marco square but the waterbus each day makes it more of an adventure. The reception sell the 3 day transport tickets (22euro) and tell you how/where to use them. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Georgous room, great bath, front of house staff excellent, and funny. Breakfast perfectly OK. Location is wonderful. Quiet at night, so near the train - which is good, not dangerous, trattoria abound, as do espresso cafes, and you are off the train and in your room in less than ten minutes. Good distance from THE SIGHTS, but not smack in the centre - which is good too. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leeny67
Reviews.Content: Very close to train station (which is a safe area in Venice). It is the first street on left. I was looking for a larger street and went way past it. People extremely friendly and helpful. We only had 1 night in Venice (definitely should have been 2). We would stay there again--very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: Wahoowa93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbazia last week, at the end of our week in Italy. It was very pretty, and it had lots of character. Most importantly, the staff was helpful and friendly. They cheerfully toted our bags, offered recommendations for dinner and sightseeing, and even suggested a wine to order at the restuarant that we chose. I didn't think the alley was daunting, but this may be because it was after a week in Italy and we'd been down a lot of similar alleyways already. Nothing sketchy about it, just a little stone alleyway with restaurants and shops. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay there and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: EssexDgt
Reviews.Content: We booked the Abbazia from reviews read on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. Very centrally located, only a few minutes from the Grand Canal and the vaporetta stop. There were also some very pleasant, reasonably priced restaurants nearby. However, what really made the holiday for us was the friendliness of the hotel staff. They could not do enough to please. We booked a superior room which was well worth the slightly extra cost, but at 190 euros a night still very reasonable for the centre of Venice. Yes you do get a wake up call from the bells every morning, but bells have a slightly more appealing ring to them than Radio Four.I would certainly stay in this hotel again and have no hesitation in recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: cltc
Reviews.Content: We chose the Abbazia because of the Tripadvisor reviews and because we didn't want to spend a fortune on accommodation for our 5 days in Venice last week. (Venice prices are generally on the high side, but the Abbazia is good value for money.) We were not disappointed, in fact in some ways the place exceeded our expectations. As has been mentioned, the hotel is very conveniently situated - almost next door to Venice Railway Station (though you wouldn't realise it - there's no noise), and a 10/15 minute walk or one vaporetto stop from the airport terminal, which itself is just 20 minutes by bus from the airport. But as with everywhere in Venice, you do need a map to find it! Although it's not very near to the main tourist sites, they're only a short vaporetto ride away. Don't be put off by first impressions. Yes, it's down an alleyway, but then Venice is full of alleyways and very safe. Yes, the entrance is unimpressive. But once you're inside, you find yourself in a huge old former convent, immaculately clean, and full of character. There's even an old pulpit in the wall near the bar! The Manager on Reception couldn't have been more friendly and helpful, and even the person behind the bar was very friendly. Our superior room was perfectly adequate (no view, but you don't need to go far outside for views!). Breakfast did get a little hectic for the staff on duty between 9 and 9.30, but this wasn't a problem - and breakfast is available between 7.30 and 11 anyway. And the early morning church bells are a pain, particularly the loud 7.15 one, but you can always go back to sleep again or get up and about earlier in the day. All in all, an excellent hotel for its price and we would certainly stay there again if coming back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days at the beginning of September 2005. Two minutes from the train station; one minute from the public boat dock. Immaculate hotel; very friendly and helpful staff; beautiful breakfast garden. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and really liked this hotel. Very clean, very quiet, yet within 200 yards of the train station and 100 yards of the main bridge over the Grand Canal. A great place to establish base to explore Venice. Complimentary breakfast was terrific, the courtyard was amazing (eat breakfast there). It's a charming place with lots of character, great staff, and a wonderful setting. Note that it is very European - very small room, no in-room coffee, a hand-held shower, and bells upon bells at 7 AM. I really liked it, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: American_Dilettante
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Abbazia for 3 nights during our time in Venice. The hotel was absolutely lovely. Rooms are spotless and contain a television, safe and normal amenities. There are no bathrobes or slippers or the like. The desk staff are super nice at this hotel. They go out of their way to tell you where things are, provide maps, give invaluable local style advice and all of them had an excellent grasp of the English language. The breakfast was nice but their staff had a difficult time keeping up with the demand. They ran out of small things, but never for than a minute or two so it wasn't an issue. If you need internet access, you can rent their laptop from them for 24 hours for the bargain price of 5EU. This allows you to use the laptop to check email and access the internet. It was great (just remember to delete cookies and IE cache when you are finished!). The Hotel is also near the train station and the Vaporetto and Traghetto terminals (but is very quiet).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location -- great staff, two suggestions.”
Reviews.Author: willowcrown
Reviews.Content: The Abazzia is in a perfect location -- less than a five minute walk to the train station and about three minutes from the water bus stop. The hotel is charming, as are the front desk staff. They offered sugguestions and were very welcoming. The rooms are spacious and nicely furnished. I do think Housekeeping could do a better job sweeping/vacuuming the hardwood floors in the main part of the rooms. The bathrooms are very pretty but they really do need to at least put up shower curtains or doors so that those of us who don't like to take a bath can use the shower attachment provided without dousing the whole bathroom. I personally won't bathe anywhere but my own home, just out of sake of comfort. (I'm a germ freak) Jetted tubs especially, harbor tons of leftover bacteria, skin cells and other goodies from people who have used the tub before you. Therefore, we had to sort of sponge bath/shower off standing up in the tub. Twice we really got the bathroom soaking wet and had to use hand towels to dry everything off. The breakfast was good but the inside dining room was stiffling hot. Also, they are entirely understaffed. Both mornings I saw two people running around trying to keep afloat while guests stood and waited for bowls or spoons or some other thing. And forget trying to get a cup of tea or a coffee -- they can barely keep up with clearing off the tables. At the end of our meal, when we got up to leave, a poor girl who was flushed and sweating ran over to ask if we wanted coffee or tea. I didn't even have the heart to ask her for anything because she was visibly overwhelmed. Other than the staff shortage and the temp of the room, breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TR27
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Marco Polo airport, walked outside, stepped onto a bus and arrived at Piazalle Roma 25 mins later. The hotel was in easy walking distance from here and we were checked in and out having lunch within an hour of landing. ( We only took hand luggage). There are plenty of places to eat and drink locally, however the whole of Venice is in easy reach of the hotel. The Hotel was so friendly, we had a lovely superior room, clean and had everything we needed. Every member of staff was helpful and had a wonderful sense of humour. One evening we had a terrific thunder and lightening storm and asked the hotel to recommend somewhere close to eat. They gave us umbrellas and suggested Antica Besseta which turned out to be a fantastic find, definitely recommended. The position is brilliant, you need a good map with all the vaporetti stops (water bus) and the bridges on if you plan on seeing all the sites. We walked everywhere and were constantly lost which is when you find all the best backstreet 'Osterie'. I found Venice compared to other Italian cities incredibly safe, we wondered about in the dark and always felt safe. We had a lovely stay and would recommend Abbazia without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmcd
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, conveniently located near the train station, no need to struggle with luggage on the boats. Easy to get to anywhere else. Staff were great and very helpful in all respects. Room was great, plenty of space (although we did get an upgrade for our anniversary present) Breakfast in the garden a must. Note this is the only hotel I have ever stayed in (and that is a lot) where the mini bar prices seem to be more favourable than outside. (Odd but true) Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely family run hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides an excellent service for the site seeing traveller. It is in a great location right next to the station. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are basic but spacious and clean. We would certainly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel convenient to transportation”
Reviews.Author: AJJS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here midway through a 2 1/2 week trip throughout western Europe. It is just around the corner from the train station and vaporetti stops, but down a pleasant little street. It is a beautiful hotel and great value. The room was clean and pleasantly decorated. The staff was friendly. The included breakfast was pretty good, especially if you are able to get a table in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: KAB
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again if I came back to Venice. It is a couple of minutes walk from the train station and the water bus, yet it is in a quiet street and easy to find. The hotel had a very grand feel to it with a wonderful guest lounge (wood panelling, a pulpit, bar, loads of sofas) and a garden patio for eating breakfast (the usual continental). The room was very quiet and there were English language news channels on the T.V.

Reviews.Title: “It was great, ever helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little difficult to find at the first attempt, but from then on it shines. The staff and front desk are always happy to help, be it trips, guides, maps or restuarants and they are genuine when they make their recommendations which is refreshing when compared to some. Overall, excellent value, clean, well located and top notch staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Abbazia is a great choice”
Reviews.Author: usalinda
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and our family of 5 adults stopped in Venice July 1-4/05 How I wish we had even just one more day there. We felt that the hotel was in a great location. A short walk from the train station. The ony daunting part was that you walk down an alley to get to the hotel. Americans are not used to this and it was alittle scary but only the first time Our rooms were great and the hotel staff was super. Everything was spotless. Just note to the person that complained because one room was not as good as the other, oh well. Try to remember you are in Europe not the US These hotels are older and smaller and every room is not the same. In most hotels you will find if you are arranging services with the concierge desk it is going to be higher than going to into the center and doing it yourself. You are paying for convience and less stress. Don't forget to go to the courtyard for breakfast it was so nice and relaxing As for the church bells, well yes they ring starting at 7:15am. They weren't really that bothersome and we were not looking to sleep in anyway. Well I guess that's it. I don't think you will be disapointed. Get yourself lost in some of the back streets and find the little local corner store deli's to eat in their outdoor courtyards We loved Venice and the Hotel Abbazia

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location We took the bus in at night and itâ€™s only 800 yards from the bus stop which was really handy. Also right next to the train station and water-bus stop. Hotel Clean and tidy with a lovely hall and nice breakfast garden and breakfast room but the bedroom we had was just average and could have done with a freshen up. The only other negative and for the price I am being a bit over critical here was the lane leading up to the Hotel which wasnâ€™t exactly grand. You will be woken by the Bells in the morning but that just reminds you to get up and enjoy your stay. Staff Never had many dealings but the welcome at 11PM was very pleasant. Overall Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend!”
Reviews.Author: PowerHour
Reviews.Content: I am sorry but I cannot recommend this hotel. We reserved two rooms, one beautiful and one very depressing! They could not change rooms and could not explain why ther was such a difference in quality. I was told to put my children in the depressing one! Also, the concierge wanted to charge me $10.00 more for a water taxi than I paid when getting one on my own. His commission should come from the taxi service, not his hotel guest! It is unique in its design and convenient for the train, but not the most charming area of Venice, by any means.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, great location, super staff!”
Reviews.Author: shashi21
Reviews.Content: A friend from home recommended the Hotel Abazzia, being that she and her husband had stayed there 2 years ago. I can't thank her enough! We had no trouble finding the hotel (it is down a narrow alleyway...and first impression I began to think... what did I get myself into now?) It was within steps from the train station. The hotel staff (Mirza and Matthew) were both very friendly and helpful. Our room was very comfortable; AC was fabulous! Nice and cold! Bathroom was big and clean. Breakfast was perfect. Loved the cappacchino every morning! The vaporetto was within walking, going to whatever or wherever you wanted to go. We really felt at home. After the first day, we didnt' have to tell the staff our name or room number, they just handed us back the key! The church bells did not bother us, nor did the birds. We would definitely stay here again! Can't wait to come back to Venice! Well worth the price....this is not a typical 2-3 star hotel in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: windsor
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind the sound of churchbells in the morning, this was a wonderful place to stay. In previous trips, we got off the train and had to struggle to figure out the vaporetto system and navigate to our hotels- this time we just walked off the train, walked around the corner, and checked in. As a family of five, we had two large connected rooms with two large bathrooms, great air conditioning, firm beds, a safe in the room, breakfast in the garden. Front desk staff couldn't have been more welcoming or helpful (made numerous phone calls to find the luggage lost by Alitalia five days before, which never did find us during our prior stay in Rome). We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FLLman
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on price, location, and reviews. When we arrived in Venice it was a delight to find that the hotel was easily within walking distance (4-5 minutes from the front of the train station) from arriving. This was a delight as I saw others dealing with luggage loading onto boats, bridges, etc. We arrived at the hotel and found it to be clean, convenient, and with friendly staff. Also, the A/C worked great (something which can be a problem in European hotels), and we like our room cold! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbazia, is on a side street , near train station and Piazza Roma. It is an old Monastery, nice large rooms, quiet, and you get a good breakfeast included in the price( juices, meats, cereal, coffee, brioche, rolls fruits, eggs).There is a garden to sit in and eat also. A good pick for the money. Maid service is daily and the desk personnel are very helpful and speak english. Only drawback is the bathroom, the shower is very small, so if you are a large person, or clastraphopic be advised. You are near the water buses, Canal resturants, and a main walkway that goes to the Rialto Bridge which is full of quaint shopping places at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: deepwaterqueen
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, service, great room, clean, nice breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: sweetdainty
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed at the Abbazia Hotel in mid April. I would like to start off by saying that the staff is exceptional. Matteo and Mirko we always happy to help with side trips, resturant reccomendations, and car reservations. The location is great, not far from the train station and the vapporetto stop. The owners of the hotel also own a glass factory in Murano and we were given a free taxi ride and tour of the factory and its showrooms. We booked our room directly trough the hotel. I have to say that our room was clean but rather small ( we booked a triple and were given a quad) and musty smelling. I am not sure if the musty smell is true all over Venice or not. It was also in need of some better decorating. We felt like we were truly sleeping in a monestary. In other reviews I have read that the rooms were very nice but in our case this was not true. Also a warning that at around 7 am and again at 8 am the bells toll right near by unbelivably loud and long. Woke us up out of a dead sleep. All in all I would probably not stay here again unless I was given one of the nicer rooms other reviewers have talked about although I think I have never encountered a better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Abrolutely delightful”
Reviews.Author: ClwMurph
Reviews.Content: I would look forward to staying at the Hotel Abbazia again and again. The room, breakfast, service, location, and the beautiful restoration work done on this former monastery were all perfect. Venice is a beautiful city and this lovely hotel made our stay there as close to perfect as you can get. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “sweet little place”
Reviews.Author: Reptileseven
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, it's right near the train station down an alley. Reception area is clean as is the entire hotel. Rooms could have been bigger, but was very clean and so was the bathroom. Large closet, fridge, tv, plently of towels. Continental breakfast was great. Fresh fruit, meats, cheese, cereals, yogurt, pastries, rolls, jelly, butter, juices, cafe drinks. This area was also very clean. Quiet hotel and friendly staff. I would come here again.
